review_body: On our return from New Zealand we stayed two nights here during COVID “self isolation”. While we could not do anything but walk along the street by the lovely park nearby we had a great view of the ocean from our room - where needless to say we spent most of our time before our flight home. But the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, and the hotel restaurant was doing limited menu dinner “take-out” delivered to your room. They made the best of a difficult time for all of us.

The Lotus Honolulu at Diamondhead is our favorite hotel on Oahu because it is close to all the Waikiki activity without all the crowds and traffic. If you can score a corner room facing Diamondhead it is one of the best views in town—ocean to city with Kapiolani Park and Diamondhead right off your balcony. If you enjoy birding, the balcony is a great place to spot the birds of the park. The service is really great. They take the time to know your preferences and accommodate you. Plus, the lobby coffee is delicious (not that weak watery stuff so many hotels serve up). Great place to stay!

We've stayed here multiple times and always had a great experience. This time they went even further.We intended to stay 5 nights at the end of a two week Honolulu vacation. Because of the COVID-9 situation, they allowed us to cancel the last 4 nights without penalty even though we were past the refund cutoff...and, they helped us by refunding the original cost deposit and gave us the present "COVID-9" pricing, virtually half the original price.Everyone of the staff were very helpful and full of Aloha, in the midst of their own difficulties during this period.We are forever Lotus Fans !!!

Hilton Head, South Carolina

review_body: This was my 4th time staying at the Lotus. I like that it is away from the crowds--I always walk up to the other hotels and restaurants along Waikiki Beach if I feel the need, and get a taxi back after dark. The hotel is small and basic but very clean, and the views from my room were great. The bed was fantastic. Although it could use some updating in some of the rooms (I heard they might be planning renovations) it is a nice place to stay. Christieann and JR at the Front Desk could not have been more friendly and helpful--in fact, everyone was wonderful. This was a big plus.

Wonderful experience! The Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head is the perfect blend between high-end hotel & boutique property. Upon arrival we had confusion about our booking; but JR went out of his way to ensure the accommodation exceeded expectations. The small resort fee also covers valet parking a HUGE perk in this area. We loved the location on the quieter part of Kalākaua Ave yet walkable to Waikiki. Bonus = each morning the front desk manager warmly greeted us (by name) as she checked out free beach chairs & towels for us.

Nice rooms, wonderful staff, steps from the beach & great views what else can you ask for. Did I mention free valet parking? We love this place. It's away enough from the hustle & bustle of Waikiki but close enough to still be there if you know what I mean.

After a bad hotel in Maui, we were pleasantly surprised to arrive at the Lotus. The room is awesome, modern, pleasantly appointed. Picked the place to be away from Waikiki. The location was just close enough and easy to get around.

My husband and I spent 5 amazing days at the Lotus in October 2019. The ONLY complaint I have is that after a long flight, driving in the dark - the sign is very hard to see. We drove by a few times! However, everything else about the Lotus was fantastic. The staff was all very helpful and pleasant. The location is off the main strip so it is a bit more quiet, which we very much enjoyed. It is walking distance from the heart of Waikiki Beach, we walked to and from numerous times a day. There is immediate beach access too. There is an onsite restaurant with a wine down (that means free wine!). They also offer free ocean safe sunscreen which came in great packages that fit in a purse or bag easily. You can sign out beach chairs, blankets, umbrellas and I think even coolers. It was a great perk. There is valet parking at no extra charge. Last but not least - they offer free filtered water and a reusable water bottle (that is super cute and stylish). We really hope to go back again!

This was a great hotel for our trip to Honolulu! We really enjoyed being within walking distance to the main Waikiki Beach, but removed from the craziness. Would have loved to have a pool and gym, but the beach next door was beautiful and always much calmer/less windy than any other beaches we went to and made up for it. And jogging around the park across the street made up for missing the gym. The lobby/elevator/hallways could use some updating but the rooms and the restaurant were great. We only had happy hour snacks and drinks at the restaurant but everything we had was delicious. Really enjoyed having a balcony in our room, even though it was mostly a view of a parking lot we could still look out at Diamond Head and enjoyed the nice breeze. The staff was also so friendly and helpful all the time. Having a car included was a HUGE bonus as well and would be a big reason we recommend this hotel and would book again.

review_body: The Staff is friendly and has good aloha. The hotel itself is clean but furniture in the rooms is in need of a good cleaning or upgrade. Bathrooms are old but functioning. Towels are past their due date for replacement. We miss Carisa at the front desk but are so happy to see that Dev, Travis and Byron are still there. Maid service is great too. Always friendly and quick to bring extra towels or hangers. Hotels View of diamond head is nice and it is convenient to activities without being right in the middle of traffic of Waikiki.

We are regular patrons of this hotel. The location is perfect, quiet and relaxing. It is away from the hustle and bustle but still very accessible to everything, the beaches, shopping, dining, activities and other major sights. The rooms are very clean, nicely done and the views of the water, the popular diamond mountain and the beautiful sprawling park are magnificent! I enjoyed all the furnishings and the over-all interior design and set-up of the hotel. You will have no clue from the outside but as soon as you get in the lobby you will be greeted with a very fine, very well put together decor with a very classy taste.The Tbd restaurant by Chef Vikram on the second floor offers superb dining. He cooks not just from the heart but from the soul with so much passion, skills and techniques that translate into these wonderful flavors, textures and quality of every single dish he proudly delivers to the dining table. The bar offers a variety of drinks as well with some very special housemade infusions. Above all, Chef, the owners and their family and all the staff of this hotel are the true gem. Our family were one of the victims of the recent unfortunate fire incident in Honolulu and they took us in, gave us a complimentary room, fed us and showed us an overwhelming support, sympathy and compassion. For this we will be forever grateful.This is a home away from home, an ideal and loving place for you and your family!

This is our fifth stay for a good reason. This is an excellent hotel. It is quiet and comfortable with a very accommodating staff. Great views from the balcony in a very comfortable room!Previously we had hit and miss experiences with some of the ‘name’ hotels on the strip. In contrast to the name hotels where you get nothing for your resort fee, at the Lotus you get things like beach chairs, a water bottle, coffee and WiFi. The beach is also closer than other ‘beach front’ hotels.This is the spot to go!

This is my favorite hotel in Waikiki. On the Gold Coast overlooking the park and the ocean. Quiet spot to return to after a long day in the office. Lovely and spacious rooms that have all the amenities you need with a large balcony for relaxing with coffee or a glass of wine. Happy hour at the excellent new restaurant with 2 free glasses of wine and discount on food. The food at the restaurant is wonderful as are the drinks. I always stay here when I’m on the island for business. You can still get in the ocean for a swim a 2 minute walk from the hotel.

This hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but still an easy walk from all the restaurants and shops.There is a small beach a very short walk from the hotel and the reception are happy to lend you towels & beach towel to take with you. There is no pool in the hotel and it is not beachfront.Our room was comfortable and kept very clean and well maintained and we enjoyed our stay here.

From check in it was a nice experience. Had an ocean view room. It was very nice. Valet parking was great. Amenities like wine and coffee was nice. Had seen this hotel when dining at Michel's but never really thought about this as a place to stay. Really liked it! Will definitely think of this hotel in the future!!

I found my chi here and I’m not even screered to talk about it. This place is a long ways down the road from Waikiki proper if you are walking but that end of the road isn’t called the Gold Coast for nothing. I just got to the hotel and I have to get my food but everyone is so nice

My girlfriend and I stayed here for our anniversary. We are locals who know the area well, and if you’re looking for a quieter more relaxed part of Waikiki, this is the place. Upon arrival they had complimentary wine when the restaurant is closed. Our room had a nice view of Diamondhead, but not so much of an Ocean view due to the building in front that cuts off part of the ocean view. Service was great, valet service was included in the resort fee which was great. Nice rooms for a reasonable price.

This was our first trip to Oahu and the hotel was perfectly located. The hotel is easily within walking distance to the Waikiki dining and shopping but far enough away to enjoy the peace and quiet. The entire staff was very friendly and even sent a complementary bottle of champagne to our room for our anniversary. We had an amazing view of Diamond Head and the ocean from our room.

Please with the hotel room we got with two double bed it was very clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Very close to the beach and easy 10-15min walk into wakiki. coin operated washed and dryer onsite. Great view of diamond head crater. I'd forgo the ocean view room though due to the location of the hotel you won't see much ocean. Complementary water bottle was fantastic and water cooler too. Complementary coffee but only in the morning. complementary sunscreen that's reef safe. The only complain is there is only one elevator and it broke down the last night we were there not very fun climbing 8 floors. Overall a great experience I would stay again.

Always enjoy the hotel. Really love the low key, casual feel of the hotel. This is helped by the location just far enough away from the noise of Waikiki, but close enough to walk to. The staff is great.

This was our first time staying here and we will definitely be back on our next visit to Oahu. The hotel is a very short walk from the busy parts of Waikiki, but down here it’s quiet and peaceful. Fantastic views of Diamond Head and the ocean, with a nice swimming beach just next to it. The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff truly made us feel welcome. Beach towels, mats, chairs, valet parking, towels and more are all included in the very affordable amenity fee. If you want to choose in and out of the busy action of Waikiki during your vacation or business trip, this is the best place!

The hotel was clean, just not as nice as what the pictures show online. Employees were very friendly and very helpful. There weren't really any amenities except for a restuarant and bar that was open only in the evening.The view from the balcony was spactacular!!!

My first time in Hawaii, was referred to this hotel by someone who was there two months prior. Travis. Paul and Maria custom service skills were exceptional. The hotel itself was met all of our needs. The view of the park from the 11th floor is just like the picture, which is now my screen saver on my phone. I plan to return. Best Birthday ever and thank you for the gift. Continue with the excellent customer service. Jackquelyn from Texas

The room was very nice with views of the ocean waves and Diamond Head. The staff were so helpful and always available. We checked out beach chairs and towels everyday, and the valet parking was so nice. The little beaches right next to the hotel actually had good snorkeling for fish and turtles. Being on Kapiolani Park was nice, And great plate lunches, breakfast, and pastries uphill at the Diamond Head Grill!!

We chose this hotel based on its many favorable reviews — all of which it deserves. The hotel is an easy walk to all the action along Waikiki, but removed enough that you’ll enjoy the peace and quiet. The staff is friendly and helpful. (Travis, the valet, is a gem.) The decor has an Asian flavor, and there are lots of nice touches. These include gorgeous bathrobes, which are available for purchase (for $50 each). There’s unlimited Illy espresso in your room. Coffee is served in the lobby from 6 to 10 a.m., and it’s several cuts above average. You can borrow bicycles, as well as everything you’d want at the beach. The only downside is the restaurant on the second floor. The food is fine, but the prices are . . . well, several cuts above average. The $8 iced tea was a revelation (nothing wrong with it except that it should have cost $5 less). Fortunately, there are plenty of less expensive (but very nice) restaurants close at hand. Go to one of those, and you’ll be delighted with your stay at the Lotus Honolulu.

We stayed on the 9th floor again and enjoyed our view of Diamond Head, the Outrigger Volleyball court, and the ocean in the background/side view.The staff is wonderful. They moved the free happy hour to the bar on 2nd floor, so we skipped that part. The lobby was more convenient. The lobby has been very nicely remodeled. Valet service and front desk staff are excellent-they remember you from previous visits. They have added complimentary beach towels to check out for the day. We love the spacious rooms and balcony. The bed and frame could use an update. Some of the pillows need replacing. Plumbing from above whistled a few times, but we still love this place! Location is perfect. A 10 minute walk to Waikiki or the Zoo, and Kapiolani Park is across the street. We hope to return!

If you would like to be close to Waikiki, be almost on the beach but be away from the craziness of Waikiki - this is a perfect place. Wonderful staff, great rooms, afternoon wine, right across from Kapiolani Park and steps from the beach. Have bikes that you can use. You can walk to Diamond Head. Rooms are very comfortable and the upper floors have nice ocean views. This is a small boutique hotel - has about 45 rooms - 5 on a floor and the building is 12 stories. New restaurant on 2nd floor. The staff makes you feel at home at all times - best place to stay in Waikiki but really at the foot of Diamond Head in a great location.

a view of diamond head, the ocean, excellent rooms! neat ,tidy ,well serviced twice a day.just out of the insanity of town! !beautiful park right out front with diamond head right in front of you. staff are so efficient. friendly and have a sense of humour which is so fun . paul at the front desk is full of info and is a really nice guy. we shared many a joke and laughs with him . so easy to approach as well. we travel quite a lot and i rate our stay here as one of the best hotels we have stayed at .the price also was quite reasonable. all in all , we will be back and highly recommend the lotus to all. loved our stay here. ps, walking distance to town, zoo, aquarium, parks , surf etc.aloha. also, free valet parking which is great.

Had a great vacation. First time staying at the Lotus and it was wonderful. Staff were all very nice. Hotel room and view were great. Tons of amenities and the espresso machine in the room was a plus. I’ve stayed at many hotels in Waikiki and this was one of the best yet. Hope to go back again next year.

We booked months in advance at the Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head because of the excellent location, value, and generous cancellation policy. We could not have been happier with our well appointed ocean view room with a gorgeous view of Diamond Head! A private beach is only a few steps away. A larger public beach and a nice park with banyan trees is about a block away. The resort is near Waikiki but away from the crowds and congestion. Every staff member was friendly and helpful, giving us directions and great suggestions for activities and places to eat. They paid close attention to every detail and genuinely wanted us to have the best experience possible. Murat was awesome and helped me over the phone before our stay. I highly recommend Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head and would definitely stay there again!

Really nice hotel, away from the chaos of waikiki but close enough to the action for bars and restaurants. Very clean, nice rooms (not perfect but still comfortable and well appointed. A close walk to the beach. Staff is very friendly and had good suggestions. Free use of beach chairs, towels etc. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back.

My husband and I chose the Lotus for our honeymoon accomodations and enjoyed our stay very much. Service was exceptional and rooms were quiet and clean. We really enjoyed the complimentary wine every night. Staff went the extra mile and had a bottle of champagne waiting for us our first night and also gave us a full bottle of wine to ourselves one evening. I would definitely stay again and recommend this gem to anyone looking for peace and tranquility right off the Waikiki strip.

Stayed here for my 30th birthday with the boy friend and I could not have been more pleased with the Lotus Honolulu.. I live on island, so when I decided to stay in Waikiki for the night to celebrate my day, the choices for hotels can be overwhelming, over saturated with tourist and very pricey. The Lotus is honestly the opposite of that. It’s in a perfect spot at the end of Waikiki strip, away from the noise, and away from the crowds! It was worth every penny, and the price was beyond reasonable. From the moment I checked in, I felt special.. I had a bottle of Prosecco delivered shortly after arriving and got to take in the most epic view of Diamond Head from our room. The room was clean and the bed was so comfortable I didn’t want to leave the next day.Did I mention they serve free wine from 5-6? You can’t beat that!I absolutely recommend this hotel for anyone, whether your a tourist or a local just trying to get out for the night, this spot was perfect! I will be coming back again for sure! Thank you Lotus Honolulu!

We stayed for 6 nights in the hotel and we have only good things to say about this place. Very nice and kind staff, well maintained and cleaned room, very comfortable bed, everything feels like new. It’s away from the Waikiki buzz, but not too much, making it simple to walk to the beach or make a quick drives to anywhere. It was the perfect choice for us.

We loved that this place was away from all of the crowds and noise but was still easy to get to the beach. And the views of the beach and Diamondhead were amazing! Highly recommend this if you want a more calm place to stay.

We stayed here for two nights each going and coming from New York to Japan and this place provided exactly the R&R we needed. The staff are wonderful and couldn’t be nicer. The beach is great and the rooms are spacious and comfortable with microwaves and mini fridges. The “wine down” hour is a lovely touch. We heard that the restaurant will be closed for renovations for the next year or so, and that sounds like a great time to come back! Thank you for two great stays!

review_body: We booked last minute at this hotel because it had free parking but knew nothing else about it. We are so glad we did! Staff were friendly, they let us check in early. Room was lovely, with some great items like lightweight robes and a complimentary water bottle. Location was amazing, out of the madness of Waikiki!

We specifically requested a king bed as this was our baby moon, a few weeks in advance just after booking. We were told this would not be problem; however we were not given one upon arrival. We would have cancelled weeks ago if we were told that this could not be guaranteed. Rooms are fine nothing special, but definitely overpriced. Resort fee is a rip off for what you get. Also if you do stay here don’t bother with a ocean view or “partial ocean view” you’re just looking at a sliver of the ocean over a parking lot, in between two other hotels in front of you. Definitely not worth it.

Clean rooms and excellent location out of the crowded Waikiki area. Rooms had a microwave and fridge which worked well for having small kids with us. Excellent service and courteous staff.Rooms were small. Not enough seating and no table in the room. We were constantly moving the patio furniture inside to have enough room for our family to eat.

Owners wife almost badly injured my 10 year old daughter as she sped through the valet which mind you in one lane and ad my daughter was traumatized and crying her eyes out all they said was well no one was hurt and you should watch your daughter and teach her to watch out....wtf ???? Im mever staying there nor will I ever recommend this hotel ever*****

I'm from O'ahu and return often to visit family. I prefer to not go into Waikiki at all, but the Diamond Head location of the Lotus makes staying in town more enjoyable. Unfortunately, the location is really the best thing that the Lotus has going for it.The good: - The Lotus is clean and the staff is friendly. - The hotel is small and you never feel like you're swimming in a sea of tourists which is something I really look for. - They have beach chairs and mats you can borrow.- Close to the less-crowded Sans Souci beach and walking distance to everything Waikiki has to offer.Things you should know: - Parking is included in the daily "amenities fee" ($29 at the time I wrote this).- The term "ocean view" is used liberally by the Lotus. We spent extra for the Premium room and you could definitely see the ocean, but only through the gaps of the much larger buildings that are between the Lotus and the beach. - When I book a room for 3 people, I expect for there to be a place for each person to sleep. We had one king bed and when they brought in the roll-away the room felt cramped and we had to climb over it to get to the lanai. Rooms are small.- The bar/restaurant is nice but it's dark and modern. If you want that island vibe, you need to go over to the beachfront New Otani next door. Conclusion: I didn't really feel like the Lotus was a good value and even though we really try to make the best of things and not be big complainers, there were things about it that were constantly making us feel disappointed. Honestly, I feel like the property is misrepresented in the marketing and on the website. I wish I had read more of the 2-3 star reviews here before booking.

My husband and I stayed at Lotus Honolulu for 3 nights on the last leg of our 10 day Hawai’i vacation celebrating our 15 anniversary. Deciding where to stay in or near Waikiki was more challenging than expected. After studying maps and reading tons of reviews and screening targeted hotel ads we chose The Lotus. It was perfection. The location on the far edge of Waikiki next to the park and at the base of Diamond Head was lovely. We could walk bike or Lyft to restaurants easily. The park setting looking over trees and a quiet boulevard removed us from the chaos of the crowded concrete jungle of central Waikiki hotel zone. We walked the park morning and evening. Discovered the community gardens there and met some wonderful people. Lotus is a smaller boutique property that was just right sized and their customer service was personal. Valet parking (free) was an unexpected bonus. Their valets are smart warm and personable and efficient. Because it is smaller there was no wait time for our car. Our partial ocean view king room on the sixth floor faced both Diamond Head and the park to the left and viewed the ocean toward the right. Not a full ocean view but we could see waves. Best part is that the lanai (balcony) was never in full sun. A welcome respite from 7 days of full sun on the Big Island. The rooms are updated beautifully spacious and well appointed. The wall of glass on the lanai were actually two huge glass doors that opened wide. Instead of drapes which can be messy to open there are rolling white shutter doors for privacy and light control. So pretty. The closet was huge. The fridge and microwave were in a big cabinet that enabled us to tuck away our light food stash out of sight. The bathroom was gorgeous with large counter and an extra shelving unit on which we could lay out our personal care items I’ve never seen so much usable bathroom shelf space in a hotel. They provided a complimentary reusable travel water bottle and sunscreen This hotel was quiet because it doesn’t have a million rooms. They provide coffee and tea service in the morning in the lobby which was perfect. We didn’t need a free breakfast buffet and it’s chaos. We bought cereal and yogurt at the nearby convenience store and enjoyed breakfast and coffee on our lanai before heading out each morning. If we wanted a big breakfast restaurants were easily walkable nearby. They provide beach chairs mats towels and bikes to use daily. The semi private beach is just a few steps away through the parking lot. We had an issue with the air conditioning and their technician reset it within 5 minutes of the call. Amazing attention.  Our reservation included a car rental (bonus) since I booked direct with the hotel. It saved us quite a bit and we got a great room at a great price. It is a beautiful classy and wonderful hotel. I recommend it for guests seeking a quiet retreat. I will book here again on future trips to Honolulu.

Our first visit to Hawaii was magical and it started at the Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head. From our arrival to our departure, our stay was lovely. The entire staff was warm and welcoming and extremely helpful with directions and suggestions that enhanced our stay. The hotel lobby is clean and quiet. The rooms are meticulous and spacious and have exquisite ocean and mountain views. The hotel location is perfect for hikes, beach visits, or heading into town. We truly enjoyed our stay and hope to be back. Thank you!

This is my third trip to Oahu in two and a half years. On this vacation, I traveled with my brother and mother. By far this was the best property I stayed in. The hotel was warm and welcoming. Complimentary wine, attentive staff, included valet parking, and they fulfilled every request promptly. The rooms have a private patio with a view of Diamond Head & the ocean. The hotel is a short walk to bustling Waikiki, and there are several good dining options and a convenience store close by. Recommended.

We stayed for just a few days after visiting the North Shore and were delighted with the staff and amenities. We were a short walk to Waikiki and Diamond Head Park and a just a few steps to the beach, park & aquarium (although we did not visit there). We were able to use bikes, snorkel equipment and beach chairs during our visit. The view from our room was breathtaking. We would return again.

We love Lotus so much that we visited this year again after staying last year as well. The location 5-10 min walk away from the madness of Waikiki is perfection, and makes you feel like you’re in “real Hawaii.” The rooms are spacious, modern, and impeccably clean. And the amenities they provide you with cannot be beat - beach towels, mats, chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards, etc. Amazing. But the best part of Lotus is the service. Every staff member knows you after just 1 day and they all go above and beyond to make you feel at home and help even when you don’t know you need it!Sarah in particular at the front desk is FABULOUS! We asked her for a special favor for my parents who were arriving the next day and she spent a significant amount of work to make it happen. I’m confident this wouldn’t happen at a chain hotel on the main strip. Thank you Sarah, and thank you Lotus!

Overall, the hotel decor and room itself was simple and pretty nice. I wasn’t blown away or super impressed. The room I booked was advertised as an ocean view but it was more like a partial ocean view. I also found the front reception women on 6/26 & 6/27 super unfriendly, cold and minimally helpful. The walk to the beach wasn’t much of a path as it just leads to a slippery reef. Overall, a mellow place, with a small uncrowded beach area away from the craziness of Waikiki locates next to a park. I probably wouldn’t stay again.

Our recent stay at the Lotus had many pluses, and a couple of really bad minuses. First the bad: second night we were enjoying our balcony when we smelled cigar smoke. The smell was very strong and unpleasant. I called the front desk and they said they would do their best to locate it. We went in and closed our doors to avoid it. Next morning, sitting on our balcony having coffee, the smell of cigarettes came our way. Again very strong and unpleasant. I looked over the rail, and directly to our left there were 2 men, one with a cigarette. I said "excuse me, but this is a no smoking property, even on the balcony" The smoker took a puff and blew it my way. I said " Seriously? I will have to call the front desk if you do not put that out." Both men began verbally abusing us, calling us "trash Americans", one guy turning his butt to us and patting it saying "here, this is for you" I called the front desk. I went back out and one of the men was telling my almost 70 year old husband that he was going to "come see" my husband. We went downstairs and talked to Sarah, the front desk person. She said they said "sorry", and they would follow the policy. They were given a warning, but not fined the $450 charge for violating the rule. We said we wanted them moved, because we did not feel comfortable being right next to people who boldly verbally abused us and tried to intimidate us. She said she could not move them because the only open room would have been a downgrade. When I signed the contract it was VERY clear that there was to be no smoking. These customers spoke great English; I am sure they signed the same contract. It does not seem right that they were allowed to abuse other customers, violate rules they agreed to, and they have no consequence. The manager chose to offer us the only other available room- the penthouse suite for our last night. We accepted, though packing up and moving was a hassle. The penthouse is HUGE - way too big for 2, but has a fabulous view. We actually prefered our first room. It was very comfortable and had a very nice view. All staff were friendly, and other than the abusive smokers, we thought the hotel was great. The valet parking was so convenient, with super friendly and helpful attendants. Obviously this property will continue to have people violate their no- smoking policy if they don't actually enforce it. Too bad, because otherwise it is a little gem.

Loved the hotel, liked the location of the hotel, a little away from the bustle of the main street. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. cleaning the room twice a day, the staff is very welcoming. The view from the balcony is wonderful. On the beach near hotel we often saw a rest seal.

Just finished a week stay at the Lotus with my husband in a premium hotel. We were on the 8th floor and had a great view of diamond head and the ocean across the way. Very easy access to Kaimana Beach. There was coffee in the morning and wine in the early evening which was a nice touch after a day of exploring and before heading out for dinner. The uv filtered water was also nice to fill our water bottles. We also took advantage of the cruiser bikes, beach chairs, umbrellas, towels, and snorkel gear. It was soooo nice not having to worry about renting all of that stuff. All staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Parking is a piece of cake and never have to wait long for your car from valet. The rooms were clean, beds very comfortable and hot water with good pressure in the shower. We also never ran out of shampoo, conditioner, soap or lotion. It was easy access from the hotel to Waikiki Beach, shops, and restaurants along with the cafes on Monsarrat. I had originally booked our stay at the Marriott but after more research decided on the Lotus and could not have been happier with the decision to stay at the Lotus. Would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Oahu!

Just spent a few nights at Lotus! Sarah the guest services manager and Paul the bell valet made our stay so comfortable - the rooms are great and service is fantastic! The balconies are also such a tray to wake up to in the morning, and their water bottles are a treat!!

We stayed at the Lotus in Diamond Head in Oahu for six nights. The hotel itself is extremely nice, clean and has a very friendly staff. We had a premium room which had a view over the park, walkway, partial ocean view and over the top of a garage (which was beautifully landscaped). Birds visited our balcony daily. It was wonderful to sit out on the balcony in the early a.m. and p.m. If you visit and stay here, please get a premium room or you may be disappointed as the other rooms overlook parking lots. Our room was beautiful!I am rating this hotel with 4 stars and not 5 stars because when we stayed here the restaurant was closed. The Lotus is under new management and they are updating the restaurant. This would not usually be a problem; however, the Lotus is located on the other end of Waikiki and it is a half mile walk down the walkway to restaurants and shops and then another half mile back to the hotel. There are only two (expensive) restaurants located nearby the Lotus: Michel's At the Colony Surf (fine dining dinner only) next door and The Hau Tree Lanai across the parking lot. We suggest that if you book this hotel and don't have access to the hotel's restaurant, you may want to use TheBus service which is available very close to the Lotus and drops off throughout Waikiki. On nice days or in the a.m., the walkway is wonderful for exercise or just enjoying the views up the ocean coast or park. The Lotus is a boutique hotel and has a lot of nice services offered: wine in the late afternoon, turn down service, daily cleaning and boutique quality soaps, shower gels, hair shampoos and conditioners, slippers, and robes. A very nice, quiet hotel that is nearby the beach and walkway to everything Waikiki has to offer. The Lotus does not have a pool but the beach is very close by. Due to the fact that the Lotus is currently under new management, some of the services advertised have been discontinued. Also, staff mentioned that the Lotus is going to be completely updated soon. Please check before booking.

My husband and I traveled to Hawaii for an anniversary celebration and could not decide on just one location on Oahu, so we decided to stay in three different hotels over a ten night vacation. We started our trip at the Lotus Honolulu for three nights and had an overall good experience. The ocean view premium room we booked was worth the upgrade, as the room was very spacious and offered an amazing view of Diamond Head. However, there are two buildings between this hotel and the beach, so there was no direct beach view and beach access was through a (somewhat difficult to find) walkway that led out to a small beach area in front of a restaurant (no privacy). You are much better off walking out of the front of the hotel to the sidewalk and to your left around a few buildings to a larger and nicer beach area. Parking was valet only and the valets were very friendly and helpful with all our questions. One of my favorite surprises about this hotel was Wisp Restaurant, really amazing food and happy hour specials but unfortunately it sounds like it is no longer open. AVOID THE COFFEE MAKER IN THE ROOM, it had stagnant water in the tank that gave me a rather bad stomach ache the first morning. Instead, in the lobby area there is good coffee served in the morning and a free wine reception in the evening. I would recommend booking here if you rent a car, want a quiet hotel away from Downtown Waikiki but within driving distance of it and prefer views of Diamond Head to the beach.

I enjoy this hotel.This hotel is best I ever seen. here environment is comfortable for family and friends. Here free WIFI is available.The rooms are so clean and tidy. The rooms are so big or Ac rooms are available. Staf members are good.

Just returned from a 10 day cruise that ported from Honolulu. We flew in early to have some extra time to enjoy the island before boarding the ship. Since this was our first visit to the islands I relied on trip advisor to choose a hotel and was so happy with our decision to start our visit at Lotus Honolulu. The staff was fantastic, very friendly and welcoming from the moment we arrived. Our room was very clean with a gorgeous view of Diamond Head. If you don't mind walking they aren't far from shopping and resturants and are steps from the beach. They don't have a pool but we were ok with that because we were looking to enjoy the beach and natural beauty of Hawaii (and could use the pools on the criuse ship later). I never take the time to write a review, but they truly deserve the high reviews on trip advisor. We plan to visit Honolulu next year and stay at Lotus again.

This is my second review of the Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head. I first stayed here back in September 2017. Where my mother and I found refuge at the Lotus after a nightmarish Airbnb stay.Fast forward to April 2019. My mother and I return to Honolulu after scoring those coveted $100 roundtrip flights on Southwest from Oakland. I called up Lotus Honolulu because we were definitely going to stay there again. The only thing that gave us pause was that the Lotus was under new management as of January 2019. Since we so thoroughly enjoyed our first stay, we were concerned that the Lotus that we came to know and love would drastically change while under new management.The rooms are well appointed with either a king or two queen-sized beds, flat screen TV, wet bar with mini refrigerator and microwave. They were also balconies that offered picturesque views of Waikiki and Diamond Head. Thankfully our fears were not well founded. We actually fell in love with Lotus all over again and truly came to appreciate the sense of Ohana (family) as expressed from Travis, JR, Dev, Carissa, Sarah just to name a few. You cannot get a better value than the Lotus Honolulu in the Waikiki / Diamond Head area. The resort fee is quite reasonable and huge shock it includes complimentary warm valet parking from the likes of Travis and Dev! The daily resort fee covers the beach towels, beach chairs, and free bicycle rentals.The front desk staff (JR, Carissa, and Sarah) were always courteous and helpful, from making sure that we were comfortable in our rooms, ensuring that we could enjoy the complimentary coffee in the morning as well as the wine happy hour in the evening. They were always glad to assist us in finding the best bars and restaurants on the island.Daily Happy hour between 4:00 pm and 6:00 pm with red and white wine with bar snacks (like popcorn, pretzels, etc.)Daily Hawaiian coffee and tea in the lobby from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm.My mother and I had an amazing 9-day /8-night stay at the Lotus and had a difficult time saying goodbye and eagerly await returning to this special place.

This was a great location for us. We wanted to be close to things, but not in the craziness and crowds of the center of Waikiki.All of the staff was extremely helpful!I left something behind in my room, and they were so pleasant when I called them about it. When it was found they were so kind and assisted me in getting it back to me right away! They truly went above and beyond for me. Thank you!The rooms are updated nicely. I wasn't terribly fond of the flooring though. Maybe it was the combination of the area rug and the laminate flooring, but it always seemed that my feet would be slippery or squeeky. A bit odd, but didn't take away from our stay. The hallways are open air in the middle of the building, so it seems like maybe this is a converted apartment building, so the hallway is not great, but the interior of the room is more important anyway. We had a great stay, and would definetely consider coming back.

We stayed four nights at Lotus Honolulu this April in a Ocean view room. At first we were surprised that we don't have a full ocean view but only a partial view between other buildings that are surrounding the hotel. However it was very pleasant to have also a nice view on Diamond Head and Kapiolani Park. The room is large and very well furnished with all amenities needed. There is also a nice balcony. The bathroom is also large enough and nicely decorated. The location of the hotel suited us because it is not directly in the noisy and busy center of Waikiki but in the Diamond Head neighbourhood. You can reach the center by bike in less than 10 minutes. The personal was very friendly and helpful. We would return again with no doubts.

Spent 9 nights at the Lotus. Rooms are VERY clean. Rooms have view of Diamond Head and the ocean. Street is quiet. We enjoyed early morning coffee on our balcony, while parakeets and birds flew among the palms. Hotel provide towels and chairs for the beach which was small but clean. The Lotus is within easy walking distance of the Waikiki Strip. The restaurant is being remodeled, but several places to eat within easy walking distance. Shout out to JR who helped us with directions and local activities

We stayed here last week with a family of four (13 and 15 yos) in 1 room with ocean view. Excellent location — not in Waikiki, but only 5min away so we could walk the whole area but not suffer the noise near our hotel. Proximity to Diamond Head also preferable. Room was clean and new. Wine happy hour in lobby. Free valet for rental car. Bikes for use but we didn.t have time. Nothing to complain about!

My wife and I stayed at the Lotus for the first time last week and were very impressed. In the past when we visited Oahu we always stayed in one of the large hotels on the main strip of Waikiki. The Lotus is about 1/2 mile off the Waikiki strip and away from the noise and congestion. We loved the calm and quiet of the Lotus. It's a smaller, high-rise hotel. The hotel is a little older, but our room was remodeled with nice furniture and very clean. Valet parking is included in the resort fee and is very convenient. Since the Lotus is so small it never took the valet more than 30 seconds to retrieve our car. The resort fee also includes use of beach towels, beach chairs, bikes and yoga mats. The staff is helpful and courteous. The only downside is that the hotel does not have a restaurant or pool. We didn't mind because the room has a small refrigerator/microwave in the room along, coffee/tea in the lobby and the beach is very close. Eating places are a short walk from the hotel. My wife and I will be going back to Oahu next yearend definitely plan on staying at the Lotus again.

This is a small no-frills hotel far enough away from the bustle of Waikiki, but close enough to walk to the shops and beaches. It’s right up against Diamond Head and we were treated to a double rainbow yesterday! There isn’t a pool, fitness room, or restaurant. Just nicely appointed rooms and professional staff.

This is our many repeated stay at the Lotus which is our most favorite place.This time we had some business transaction going on during our stay kind of rash emergency so we have to use their business center to send some documents.Carrisa at the reception was such an angel to help us when we were little panicking.She was so kind, helpful and most of all so pleasant!!Thank you Carrisa!!Not just Carrisa but all the people in the hotel they are so professional with friendly manners.Can’t wait to visit again!!Mitch & Tomoe M

My wife and I enjoyed a wonderful stay at this hidden, small gem ( only 51 rooms, 5 per floor) south of Waikiki Beach. It’s nothing much to look at from the street or even from the outside corridors to the rooms. But once you enter, you will find a lovely, cosy and spacious haven which is very clean, bright and comfortable. This hotel is all about attention to detail and attention to the guests’ comfort and needs. Management gave us gifts of a very useful water bottle, and a lockable beach bag for valuables. Free coffee, tea and hot chocolate are provided each morning, and free espresso is also available in the room. At happy hour free wine is offered although my wife and I did not partake as we are non drinkers. We did make use of the free bikes with locks to go up to Waikiki for lunch. Since this is a very small hotel there is no pool or gym but two minutes away is a very secluded and beautiful beach good for swimming and snorkelling. Make sure you spend some time here as I think it is much more pleasant than the very congested Waikiki Beach. If you enjoy running, there is an amazing two mile loop around the park next to the hotel which attracts all sorts of runners. And if the weather is good the slow, long walk to Diamond Head is definitely worth it. The resort fee of 29$ is cheap for Honolulu and this fee includes free valet parking and phone calls. We had a car and we believe this will make your plans more flexible and convenient and your overall vacation much more enjoyable, especially since the Lotus is NOT close to the restaurants on the Waikiki strip, about half hour walk away or more. All in all this hotel is an amazing find for expensive Honolulu! I booked my room at a very reasonable price as they offer promotions all the time. I highly recommend the Lotus. Photo shows the hotel’s secluded beach.

My second time staying in this property and I still like it. The staff are outstanding, very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect, close enough to Waikiki but not too close to all the noise & crowds. Hotel has tennis racquets to borrow & we enjoyed playing tennis across the park at the diamond head tennis center. The hotel no longer offers free yoga classes every morning which was a minor dissapointment (I loved the yoga classes during my stay last year). Otherwise everything was perfect and the new ownership is maintaining the very high standards that this property is known for.

We loved LotusHonolulu. The location was great as it is located on Waikiki Beach. We could run along the shore and stroll to restaurants and shopping. From this locale, we were able to easily drive to various locations in Honolulu and other parts of the island. We loved the big bedroom and bathroom and the elegant dark wood. A “plus” was Happy Hour featuring red, white and blush wine from 5:30-6:30 pm and free coffee and tea at breakfast. The staff were friendly and eager to assist.

If you value privacy and a peaceful experience, the Lotus Honolulu deserves serious consideration. With its ocean and Diamond Head views and the proximity to a spacious park, the Lotus gives you the best of Waikiki Beach without the throngs of meandering tourists found less than a mile away. Clarissa and JR at reception will make you feel like family and Travis will cheerfully help you with your car and the complimentary bikes.Our room was spacious, quiet, and extremely comfortable. We even had feather pillows to compliment the comfy king bed. Perfect week!

We liked the location of the Lotus, it’s just a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach but luckily bypasses that noisy, overcrowded high rise feeling of the main beach area. The web advertising pictures are however totally misleading - this is not a luxury boutique hotel. The entrance is near the underground drive-through, it looks like a down market billiard room. Lifts are extremely old and noisy, and walls are so thin .. if you have a room near the lifts like we did, then be ready for clunking and crashing noises at all hours. No breakfast, no uninterrupted view of the ocean despite us paying top category for an ocean room. Be prepared to primarily view the building in front blocking all ambiance. Overall, we managed for 2 days, but feel ripped off for the quality versus price which was definitely very expensive for something that did not deliver what the website represents.

Ocean view was completely obstructed by large buildings, the room smelled awful, the chair in the room had multiple stains, the shower was dirty, the vent in the ceiling was hanging down and looked like it had never been cleaned. We didn't stay. We asked for a new room, they told us they had nothing available except a ground floor, small bed combo - so we checked out and found a different hotel room. The smell of the room alone was unbearable, but the poor conditions of the rest of the room just made it worse. For $289/night, it was horrible. I'm working to get a full refund, but have not received one yet.

Very friendly and helpful staff, both at the reception desk and the valet parking. Spacious rooms with hardwood floor and a large, comfortable bed. Large terrace with nice view on Diamond Head. The hotel is situated a little outside of Waikiki itself (which is still easily accessible by foot), which was an added value for us. Two small notes of warning. Airconditioning is relatively loud if you are a light sleeper. There is a club on the second floor, which can be noisy (especially on Saturday), so ask for a room higher up.

Lotus Hotel is a friendly, clean, well priced hotel at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. Great access to a small almost private beach with excellent swimming. We have stayed there a number of times and we are always pleased.

Stayed in November with my girlfriend for a late birthday celebration , hotel location is great , close to waikiki but far enough that it’s nice and quiet, room was great! Had a really nice view , the restaurant down stairs was awesome, nice atmosphere ,great food, good prices. And everyone in the staff was great!! But the ones that stood out the most were Ward, Carissa, and Sarah , they were awesome, great hospitality and exceptional service, will be back again soon for sure!!

We loved everything about The Lotus. Diamond Head views, park, restaurants and beaches were all walkable. Staff was super helpful and friendly. They have thought of everything you might need to enjoy a trip to Honolulu. From daily wine and music reception to chairs and towels for the beach (steps away) we felt well taken care of. If you want to be close to Waikiki, but away from the noise and crowds, I highly recommend The Lotus for a relaxing visit in a great location.

My husband and I stayed at the Lotus for our honeymoon and our experience far exceeded our expectations. We arrived very late due to flight delays and we were greeted by a gentleman who surprised us with a room upgrade. Our view from the 11th floor was simply spectacular- an ocean view from one lanai and an unobstructed view of diamond head from the other lanai. The room was everything we could’ve asked for. It was meticulous! I couldn’t believe how clean it was. The bed was very comfortable and I love it when the hotel provides slippers and robes. There was a mini fridge and microwave as well. Loved how environmentally-friendly this hotel was by providing a reuseable water container which can be filled with the water dispenser downstairs; reef-safe sunscreen was also provided for our snorkeling trips. I loved how I got great value out of the $25 daily resort fee which included valet parking, wifi, use of beach chairs and beach towels, coffee, tea and the newspaper each morning. As a frequent traveler the one thing that stood out to me was the friendliness of all the staff- by far the friendliest staff I’ve ever encountered at any hotel. Everyone genuinely seemed like they were happy to be there. The one area for improvement that I could identify was the hotel’s restaurant. We checked it out one night for dinner. The food was mediocre and the music was much too loud- I felt bad for those staying on the 3rd floor as they surely could hear the music throughout the night. With that being said, I wouldn’t hesitate to stay at the Lotus again the next time I’m in Honolulu. Thank you for a memorable stay!

Very comfortable and clean. Bonus with everyday newspaper, coffee & great Restaurant to dine. Good for kids also. Valet service is very good and quick! Will definitely stay there again in the future. Can’t wait.

I just selected this based on searching through Tripadvisor and then websites and wasn't disappointed. It's down at the quieter end of the Honolulu beaches - away from the hoards on Waikiki. Our room was attractive, spacious, comfortable and had everything needed, including a view of Diamond Head from the lanai. The complimentary coffee/tea, etc in the lobby in the morning, and the great happy hour with nice wines, nibbles and lovely musicians each evening were delightful. While there isn't an on-site pool, it isn't needed, as the quieter, beautiful beach is just 200 steps away (and Louts provides beach chairs, tatami mats and beach towels). The only "downside" was that the separately-operated restaurant on the 2nd floor seemed to have erratic times for service and a limited menu. Not-to-worry however, as Lotus reception folks advised us about the wonderful beach-side restaurant in the hotel next door. Definitely recommend Lotus!

review_body: This is a very nice hotel. the staff was very friendly. The hotel lobby was beautiful and the room was spacious and clean. It was a short walk to Waikiki Beach. Our room had a beautiful view of Diamond Head. The location was quiet and peaceful which made it even more relaxing.

well appointed hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, close to beach but away from the hussle and bussle of waikiki. Nice easy walk into waikiki. surrounded by parks. They have beach chairs and towels available.

The hotel is esticically pleasing very clean and well maintained. We unfortunately were given a room on the 3rd floor, which is directly above the lounge/night club. The bass and music were so loud we could actually sing along to the music. There were no more rooms available so we were stuck. The walls are also paper thin we could hear the neighbors quite clearly. I would stay way from this hotel.

Lovely hotel tucked away from the crowd with a lovely private beach just steps away. Very nice rooms with hardwood floors and nice furnishings. Very friendly staff. Great restaurant with an excellent happy hour.

First off the service here was very nice! The staff is friendly and always at our service, and the amenities are great too. And you get nice views from your room if you are high enough. You get free movies (out of a Redbox kind of machine) but you have to go past the entrance of the restaurant. So sometimes that was awkward when I’m in my pjs. They give you a water bottle to refill instead of plastic bottles, but you have to walk all the way to the front check in to get the nice filter water. The room itself though we had some issues. Our first room was absolutely filthy dust everywhere and the air smelled musty! Under further investigation I found bugs coming from the wallpaper! Just too much moisture locked in the room and the ac was broken and when I went to get ice there was mold on the rim. We tried to switch hotels but our travel agency was being difficult. The front desk man handled the situation well and moved us. The next room was much cleaner, no bugs but the smell was still there, I ended up buying Lysol and tried to make the best of it.So all together the service and amenities were nice but they need to figure out there dirty room situation and why it’s stinks!!!

A wonderful hotel by Diamond Head that keeps you away from the noise of Waikiki yet is close enough to still enjoy! Room offered a great view, privacy, and quiet. Nice restaurant too for breakfast or dinner!

Totally enjoyed our stay. Staff was friendly and willing to help in any way. Valet driver knew who we were and got our vehicle quickly. All information provided by staff was top notch. Rooms are large and well appointed. Coffee and Fridge in room were a nice touch.

We chose the Lotus for the amenities offered- minimal resort fee, bicycles to ride, shuttle service, wine hour and view lanai's. We were pleased with the room and the service. It is a bit far from Waikiki, but there is a shuttle service offered (we did not use, as we had a car). The rooms were very clean and the view of Diamond Head was fantastic. There was a partial view of the ocean and from the west side of the building a wonderful view of Waikiki.

We stayed here October 2018 for 4 nights. The check-in was a little slow as there was no-one on reception when we arrived, however after a 10minute wait, check-in was smooth.The room was a little tired, however, it was clean and designed nicely and quite spacious for a city centre hotel.The sea view we paid for doesn't really exist as to see the sea, we had to look between two high rise buildings in front of the hotel. Yes the hotel can argue that you can see the sea from your balcony but it's not what I would expect from the 'term' our main view was of a car park and the two high rise buildings. You can see all of Diamond Head so there was some sort of view. The hotel is a 20 minute walk to downtown and apart from the hotel restaurant Wisp, we didn't find many facilities around the hotel. We enjoyed being a little out of town as it was quieter but in the Hawaiian heat, it can be a little arduous walking to the main drag! We got an Uber for many of our trips.The hotel provided us with towels and beach chairs for the beach which is a nice touch. There isn't a pool here.

Our family of 4 loved the 6 nights we just spent at Lotus Diamond Head. Our room and patio on the 7th floor had a view of diamond head and the ocean. Sunrise views over diamond head were amazing each morning. Hospitality was excellent .... early check in, informative/helpful valet and great housekeeping (clean, fresh linens). Rooms were quiet. Parking was super convenient .... valet only and included in the $25 daily resort fee. The setting At the end of Waikiki was really nice. Close to restaurants and shops, but quiet and not crowded. Private access To a beautiful beach at the outrigger canoe club was a nice surprise!! When the rest of Waikiki was busy, this beach was quiet and a wonderful spot to watch the sunset. Hope to stay here again. Also....Great for families and people who are looking to sightsee and enjoy the beach. We didn’t miss the resort pool atmosphere that large hotels up Waikiki offer. Our friends were staying up at the Sheraton and workers were on strike. TRhey said that the noise from protestors and the street noise made it hard to relax. That made us appreciate the Lotus even more

Loved this hotel and restaurant The Wisp! Friendly staff, comfortable beds, clean rooms and common areas. This place has beach towels and chairs available. And complimentary wine in the lobby during happy hour. Also the water bottle is a nice touch too. Waikiki bus shuttle comes there as well and if you do have a rental car the valet parking is included in the amenity fee which is awesome because other hotels ots seperate.we had an awesome view of diamond head and the ocean.

My partner and I stayed at the lotus for three nights. After a long journey from London, a stay at this beautiful boutique hotel was just what we needed. It’s located away from the hustle and bustle of central Waikiki to be quiet but was close enough to pop down for dinner with the provided bicycles. There’s a beautiful sandy beach just in front of the hotel and it was great for swimming and relaxing with a book. We had an 8th floor room with breathtaking views of diamond head. The room was spacious and also very clean. The bed was super comfortable, not too firm not too soft, just right. The amenities are really fantastic - coffee, wine tasting, valet parking, newspaper etc. What I really loved most about the hotel though was the staff. With our jet lag we were waking up at odd hours during the night and despite this they were very attentive, gracious,and kind. The service overall was absolutely outstanding. My partner and I are hoping to come back to Waikiki - when we do we are definitely staying at the Lotus. Thank you!

The Lotus was recommended to me by my friend, whom I was visiting and is a local. Away from the noise and bustle of Waikiki, but with a view to die for, this spot is my home in Honolulu. The staff is wonderfully accommodating; I stay in the same room each time. They ask helpful questions and offer items such as free tickets to the Honolulu Aquarium which is a short walk up the street. Just steps from the San Souci Beach and across the street from Kapiolani Park, there is so much to do in the secluded location on the Gold Coast. The room are huge and beautifully furnished. The balcony with it's view of Diamond Head, is roomy enough for a table and chairs as well as plenty of room to sunbathe in comfort. Out the front door is a spectacular view of the Honolulu skyline and Waikiki Beach. At night, it is magical as the lights of the city sparkle. The bed is comfy and made up with smooth, silky sheets. There are free movies available too, if bunking in and relaxing is something that might on your menu. For those wanting to enjoy the beach, the hotel supplies towels and beach chairs. Thsi makes packing easier! I am scheduled to return soon, I look forward to it.

The staff were all very friendly and helpful during our four-day stay. Our room was very clean. The location of the hotel is great being at the foot of Diamond Head and next to a beautiful park! Seeing the sun rise over Diamond Head each morning and listening to the birds sing while sitting on the balcony in the mornings was wonderful! We would certainly stay at this hotel again.

We stayed for a week in the Lotus Hotel. It was nice, the view from our balcony was OK. We saw a glimpse of the beach to the right, and a park with Diamond Head looming beyond it. Most of our view was of parking lots and other hotels. But it was still OK. The room was adequate. Service was very good, especially the Valet service. Good coffee every morning in the lobby, wine every evening. Always free. The hotel restaurant is pricey. Better to go out. The location is nice if you like to be away from the crowds. Just over half a mile walk to Waikiki Beach. Beach to the left, park to the right. Very nice. The War Memorial and the Waikiki Aquarium are also on the way to Waikiki.The Honolulu Zoo is right at the intersection of Waikiki Beach. Free bicycles available from the hotel.

review_body: LocationLotus Honolulu is located right at the end of Waikiki beach not far to Diamond head. Actually a very nice quiet location with Kapi’olani regional park on one side, offering an outstanding view of Diamond head hill. The other side is Kaimana beach, really clean public beach that is not congested compared to main strip. Clear water & fish with a convenient store close by & some ocean front dining. Lotus is just behind it. From the airport it takes about 30 minutes & costs about $18 using shared Speedishuttle.The main strip such as Waikiki Shopping plaza is about 25 min walk and enroute on the same road is Honolulu Zoo & Waikiki aquarium. It’s basically close enough to the main area but quieter & more relaxing. RoomThe ocean view room on the 8th floor was really spacious, clean with boutique decor. Large comfortable king size bed faces good size TV that offers castnow & also there is a PlayStation on offer. Decent glass top desk & arm chair with foot stool. The room also offers an alarm clock, microwave, small fridge, illy espresso machine, ironing board, luggage rack & a huge safe with plenty of storage space. The bathroom was also large with a shower cubicle & foot bath, great for removing sand. Full set of mini bottle amenities from Awapuhi / Paul Mitchell. The highlight of the room however is the large ocean view balcony, though it is a side view with mainly a car park & the main park, one can see the waves between building. Two chairs & offered with both glass & black out wooden sliding doors. Overall a very nice room with modern lamps, nice rug & wooden flooring. Beach boutique done in a pleasant way that had no marks or overuse. There is also digital AC controls & cordless phone. It would be hard pressed to find the same standard of room in the big chains for the price charged. Facilities The hotel offers free secure WiFi with room credentials. There is no pool at this hotel & this only weakness, however the sea & beach is very close. There is also a restaurant & lounge bar that offers breakfast of which had to leave too early to try but also has happy hour with dinner daily from 4pm. They mentioned that they also present jazz, comedy, dance music different on every night. Parking at the hotel is not free but they do have space for valet during day at only $5 otherwise metered is outside. However they do offer complimentary bicycles to use to cycle about. ATM is also in lobbyIn the lobby is additional coffee & water machine and in room they provide a free branded water flask to use, instead of bottles of water in room. Like everywhere they do charge $25 resort fees. However one does get a free bottle of red wine & in addition around 5pm the reception area offers unlimited help yourself wine & small snacks. Plus expresso machine is also there & free. StaffStaff are mixed. Reception staff pleasant & friend. Valet staff that control bikes are ok but not very helpful with advice. Seem to want minimal dialogue.Overall a very nice boutique room in a quiet location but close enough to all the action. Would definitely stay here again.

I have stayed here multiple times and always love it. Primarily I love the location away from the main drag of Waikiki but, the people are always kind and engaged---Alita was especially kind to me on this visit---she recognized me from previous stays.

We really liked this hotel. 99% of the staff was nice and helpful. We loved our room...comfy bed and nice view from the balcony but our particular room could have had the bed facing the ocean and instead was facing the park so we only had a view of the ocean from the balcony. Loved the room had a fridge and a microwave. Loved the free bikes but you should really add bells for safety!
