review_body: This is a really nice little hotel in a great location, especially if you are there for an event at the Waikiki Shell. It was nice to be away from the noise and activity of Waikiki. More like a home away from home.

I was looking for a pet-friendly hotel to stay at and came across the Lotus Honolulu and I am glad that I did. The hotel and room were clean and the staff were pleasant. I wish there was room service as this hotel only has one dining option, but there are a lot of great places to eat nearby. There is a small fee for brining a pet, but it came with a basket of treats, a water bowl, puppy pads, and a blanket. At most places, pets are not allowed and bringing one often results in ugly looks and attitude. Not at the Lotus Honolulu. My pooch and I were welcomed and felt like valuable customers. The price was a little high, but my furbaby was comfortable and treated like another guest, so that more than makes up for the extra cost.

Overall a wonderful experience. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. A little bit of a walk to Waikiki but it's more than worth it if you want to be out of the hustle and bustle crowds there. Very nice to have bicycles available so you don't have to drive into Waikiki or eateries on Kapahulu Ave. Yoga is no longer offered as stated on their website.

I've stayed many places during the last 30 years in Oahu, and I'm thrilled to have found the Lotus. What a warm, professional staff. The location allowed us to explore nearby neighborhoods and we almost felt like a local. Can't wait to return!

This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. It is good for any vacation. It has great service, close to a park and beach, great price and has amazing amenities like bikes, wine/coffee, pool chairs, towels, PS3, and much more. It is clean, well maintained, and updated.

I have stayed at the Lotus a few times in the past and have always had a pleasant experience. Given those previous pleasant stays, I booked two nights for a quick pleasure stopover on Oahu on my way to Hilo from San Jose. My first night there I had to go to the hospital for an emergency surgery and ended up waking up the next morning on a ventilator in the ICU at Queens hospital in Honolulu. I knew I was going to be in the hospital for at least two or three more days to recover. I knew no one to help me on the island, and I had my room booked for one more night with all my clothes there at the hotel and a rental car due back the next day that was parked at the valet service at the hotel. That first morning in the hospital I got an email from Ward Almeida, the manager of the Lotus Hotel. He had been informed by his staff of my having to go to the hospital and apparently made some calls and found out I would be in the hospital for a couple more days. The email he sent informed me he had returned the rental car for me and cancelled my reservation for the hotel room for that night so I wouldn't be charged for a stay while I was recovering in the hospital. He also offered to have all my belongings delivered to the hospital. I called him later that day after being taken off the ventilator. I thanked him for his excellent service and asked if he could please store my belongings until I was released from the hospital as my new plan was to book another night at the Lotus once I was discharged. On the morning I was discharged from the hospital, I made a reservation at the Lotus for that night using their website.. Soon after I made the reservation, I received another email from Ward stating he noticed I had made a reservation and that he had also noticed the price was higher than the room rate of my original reservation as it was made with such short notice. He informed me he would be sure I would be charged the original rate of my original booking. I returned to the hotel that day and all my belongings were nicely organized in my room. I also received a bottle of wine, a box of chocolates, and a welcome back card from Ward sent up to my room. I have travelled extensively and have never experienced that kind of above and beyond service at a hotel before. I am very grateful to have received such excellent service. I will continue to stay here whenever I come to Oahu.

This has been our favorite place to stay since it opened. Clean, comfortable rooms and lobby; quiet location and friendly staff. And we really appreciated all the little amenities that made Lotus special -- Illy coffee in rooms, wine and cheese in the afternoon, proximity to great beach and use of mats/chairs for it. But on our last two stays we noticed many of those nice extras are being eliminated or reduced. Looks like manager is just trying to save money. Rates keep going up, tho.

I booked this hotel because of close proximity to kapiolani park for an early morning race. I could not be more pleased with my decision. The staff are welcoming and attentive. The rooms are spacious and clean. The location is perfect - far enough away from hustle and bustle of Waikiki but still close enough to walk into business area if needed. I requested a quiet room as we needed a good nights sleep before the race and hotel completely accommodated us and provided upgrade. So very thoughtful! They also have great amenities like coffee and water station in the morning, video games and movies for kids if needed. They are also pet friendly for fur babies. This hotel is awesome. I couldn’t have asked for a better experience. I have already booked 2 more stays for future races! Thank you Lotus!

Small hotel with great staff. They are very attentive, helpful, and friendly. Always smiling and great attitude. Older hotel, but excellently maintained and clean. This was our seventh stay. Still great.

My husband and I stayed here on our first trip to Oahu, and I’d happily stay here again. We checked in at almost midnight, and the desk attendant said, “There’s a bottle of wine waiting for you in your room.” Those are magical words. Beach chairs are included with the resort fee, and I’m a sucker for a good Tommy Bahama chair. They were perfect for the nearby beach. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the room was incredibly clean.

We decided to stay at this hotel after a horrible experience over at the halekulani hotel. We came upon this hotel after eating at the Wisp. My kids loved this restaurant they asked if we could come back the next day. So we decided to move over to this hotel after not being satisfied at the halukulani. Which was supposed to be one of the top hotels in America. We were greeted by Jr who was nice and accomodated us quickly and got through the reservation quickly as he noticed our kids were tired He asked them if they wanted snacks which was in the hotel lobby. Kind gesture that the hotel gave away free snacks and wine in the afternoon. Room was clean and facing the park which my kids loved. Downside is elevator is a little old and very slow. They have movies available in the business room which my kids got all excited upon learning this. Nice quiet experience from the hustle and bustle of downtown waikiki. Had breakfast and dinner mostly at the Wisp downstairs. 5 stars! Free hotel shutttle took us all around waikiki and Alamoanas. Free coffee and bottled water also available in the morning downstairs in the lobby. Overall great hotel and great staff. Will be back next year to this sweet hotel!

The room was OK - paid extra for sea view - but it was over a car park! The front desk staff were helpfull and friendly. There is a toal rip-off "boutique charge" of 25 USD per day. I asked what this was for and was told, "wi-fi, free coffee, free wine and other things" - I never found out what the "other things" were. The real let down to this place is Wisp restaurnat - which they are at pains to tell you has nothing to do with the hotel.- But it IS the hotel restaurant! If you are hoping to eat breakfast there beware, they close it for private functions. And if you do go there, the service and food is awful. So, hotel just about OK, restaurnat terrible.

Disappointed with the noise being on level 3 you csn hear the restaurant and school reunion below us into the late hours.On top of this we booked a room with mountain view and being on level 3 got a car park view with partial mountain view when you stepped out to balcony.Could not fault the room itself comfortable bed neat clean tidy room and nice front desk customer service from Rebekah.

From Front Desk to Maintenance to Housekeeping to Valet, we were treated and taken care of like family. Every time we were greeted, asked if we needed anything...just made us feel special! We will always remember our first time at Lotus Honolulu and already making plans to return!!

I really liked the view of the diamond head, the good size of the lanai and room. Refrigerator and microwave was very convenient as well. Only a mimutes walk to the beach and beach chair was ready to use.

Sarah delivered excellent customer service from the check in process and for the follow up of the shuttle going to ala moana! She is pleasant and friendly upon my arrival! I hope to have a chance to stay in this property again!

We just stayed for 10 days and couldn't be happier! The front desk was helpful, the valet was quick and the service all around was great! The water bottle filler in the lobby was the best! Fresh apples added a nice touch. We could take towels, chairs and boogie boards to the beach even if we drove to another area of the island. Room was clean and taken care of daily. Close to Waikiki but off the main drag and away from the noise and hustle and bustle. Walking distance to dining places and the beach. Recommendations from employees of places to eat did not disappoint! Would easily stay here again!

This place is a hidden gem. Off the beaten path of over-crowed Waikiki but walkable downtown if you like. The amenities are great - beach chairs and towels, daily yoga at 7:30am, wine and snacks every evening in the lobby. No frills and not overly fancy but overall a wonderful experience. Clean comfortable rooms and very friendly staff. Will always stay here going forward!

We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay at the lotus. The room was nicely furnished and clean and there are lots of thoughtful touches, such as a up to date suggestion of activities happening on the island for that week. The staff were so friendly and incredibly helpful - nothing seemed to much trouble and they were able to offer us advice too on how to get to destinations. I liked that the hotel was a short walk away from waikiki main area as it was quiet and the nearby beaches not too busy. We especially enjoyed the wine service and playing some of the games in the foyer. We ate in the restaurant and whilst the food & entertainment were great, the menu was limited in terms of choice for my tastes. Overall would highly recommend the Lotus Hotel.

We didn’t stay at this hotel but was referred to their restaurant for Tuesday R & B night. It didn’t disappoint. Great music, crowd, food bites and happy hour specials. All I can say that it ended pretty early at 9:30 on - our night was just starting.

WE chose this hotel because of it's location on the main drag by about 1 mile from Waikiki (we walked "home" there from Waikiki center)....and next door to lovely Kaimana Beach. It also faces Diamond Head crater and is very close to some of the best neighborhood eats in the area (about 1.5 miles to Monserrat Avenue restaurants). I had a government discount (ask for it; though not as good as military discount) that waived the daily activity fees and parking! And parking is by valet which is so convenient and quick. Also, free access to beach towels, chairs, free coffee/tea and wine happy hour!We had a couple of minor issues that the management quickly resolved -- although they continued to have trouble with their electronic keys working when we left on 6/11.There is a restaurant on the 2nd floor, but it's not owned by the hotel and somewhat pricey. So we took our breakfasts at Bogart's on Monserrat Ave most days (get there early and expect to wait online -- worth it.) However, we did do ala carte breakfast on our last day at the restaurant and it was good (and convenient), despite being pricey. They also have laundry facilities, but the dryers were not great. Luckily the rooms are not humid and our stuff dried quickly being hung in the closet.We had a premium room with 2 queen beds (be sure to specify and confirm bed type) and 2 balconies -- one that had a view of Diamond Head mountain, the other of the ocean (partial). I recommend a room on the 8th floor or higher for the best views. It's a small boutique hotel and pretty quiet, another thing we loved. I marked it as "luxury" in my review as the rooms are listed as >$240/night + resort fee. Will definitely go back again the next time we are in Honolulu. Thank you to manager Sarah and the valet staff for their help and attention to our group of 5 that was in town for a good friend's wedding in Kailua.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Every aspect was wonderful the bed great the room large one with diamond head and some Seaview views plus balcony. The staff wonderful and helpful highly recommended.Hau tree restaurant next door also fantastic.Only a short 10 min walk to Waikiki.Also nice and quiet.

This hotel turned out to be great find. It was clean and well kept by always friendly staff. My room had a spectacular view of Diamond Head and the ocean. The balcony was large enough to be comfortable. Each day I made excellent Illy coffee in my room and enjoyed the daily paper which was delivered to the door. I was given a lively reusable water bottle and fresh, healthy water was always available in the lobby. In the evening there was a wine and snack offering too. While this hotel is near Waikiki it is far enough toward Diamond Head that the is no tourist crush. It’s a quiet, lovely hotel with really great staff.

The Lotus at Diamond Head is a gem of a hotel (see what I did there). They have great staff, so helpful and so friendly. The rooms are really lovely that are nicely fitted out and the views of Diamond Head are out of this world. It does not have a pool, thus if that’s a tick box you have don’t stay here. However the beach is a one minute walk. The resort fee covers your parking, towels for the beach, great internet, as well as the happy hour daily. The happy hour: the Argentinean White they serve so easy to drink and I’d recommend take your glass upstairs get on your balcony and sit looking at Diamond Head. The beds are comfy as are the pillows. Nicely fitted out bathroom as well. I think this is a hotel you stay in and use as a base to go out and explore the island. You are a five minute drive from the highway giving you access to north east and west and its an easy drive to the outlets from or if you want to go up to the beaches at Northshore or the east coast. If you want a place where you can sup Mai Tai’s at the pol this is not the place for you. I would recommend paying a little bit more to be up on the higher levels to get the ocean view as there is a car park in front.

We did a little island hopping in Hawaii for our honeymoon and stayed here three nights. The hotel was really nice & clean. It is very close to all the shops and restaurants but not right in the middle of everything, about a 1/2 to 3/4 mi walk to the closest, so if you’re wanting a little distance from all that this would be a good place. There is easy beach access from the hotel, it isn’t right on the sand, but definitely plenty of pretty beach right there if you’re just wanting to hang out and soak up some sun.

With the Lotus Hotel situated in the best location in Waikiki, close to Diamond Head it’s certainly easy to get around with first class amenities and extra benefits make it value for the money. I always return to the Lotus with new friends twice a year . The staff are like family very friendly and helpful .

I was there for my 20 year anniversary and was put in a room right above restaurant with DJ that evening. I feel these rooms should be blocked and/or informed at time of arrival so I could either have changed hotel. My perception is the hotel was more concerned about having the hotel full rather than what is important to the consumer.

JR, Ward, Carrisa (shes awesome!,) Byron and Rebekka and all the staff were so welcoming and made us feel like we are on vacation and don't need to worry about anything. They always brought a smile and warmth when we were around. The Wisp restaurant inside was not so accommodating. When my husband asked to explain the menu, the waitress was vague, stopped explaining and went to attend another guest. Don't eat there! Otherwise, we would stay at this hotel again only because of Ward and the rest of the staff. We loved here. They also have several shuttles for several activities. My husband would rather stay here than the Hilton.

The Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head Hotel had the most amazing view of both Diamond Head and the Pacific Ocean. Sitting out on our lanai was extremely relaxing with the beautiful sites. It is down towards the end of Waikiki so you did not have all of the busy tourist traffic. They did have bicycles and beach gear for your use.The staff was amazing.

Due to a last minute trip to Honolulu that coincided with a holiday weekend, we were unable to get a room at our usual hotel. We decided to try Lotus since it was located outside of the busiest areas of Waikiki and had rooms still available at a reasonable rate. We were pleasantly surprised and have now found our new

My husband and I really enjoyed our stay here! I found this hotel because I was looking for something nearby but not in the midst of the hustle and bustle. This place was perfect! It was just a short 10-15 min walk to shops, restaurants, and beaches. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was really clean. The decorations were simple and elegant which made it easy to just sit and relax. We got the premium diamond head view room. It was a corner room, which we loved! Lots of doors to open up to let in the tropical breeze. We practically lived on the lanai. The only downside, is that the beds are a little soft, but not completely uncomfortable. We just prefer a firmer mattress. Overall though, this was a great find! I would definitely reccomend it. :)

Had a good staycation here with the wife for her birthday. Much quieter than the hotels in the main part of Waikiki which was good as we had our 6 month old in tow. The staff was friendly and the manager hooked us up with a complimentary bottle of wine to help us celebrate. I am sure we will be back.

This hotel is a gem for its quietness ( off the Waikiki crowds ), it's close-by best beach in town ( Sans-Souci ), the kindness and service-mindedness of its employees ( they lend you chairs and towels every day to enjoy the beach ), the great layout and size of their rooms ( particularly useful when you are, like us, unable to travel light ... ), the super-friendly and attentive valet parking. The mini-fridges are big enough so that you can stock your breakfast components in the room. The business center is available for free, and the views from the rooms are tops , even at lower floors. Considering all this, their prices is quite correct and totally deserved. Can't wait to go back during our next trip !

Fabulous property, fabulous,friendly and knowledgeable staff. I’ll be back. Parking is valet and free for guests. If you are dining at Wisp, the restaurant on the property, it is only five dollars to park. Great food there as well.

We can't wait to go back. Friendly professional staff. Housekeeping was on point. We returned to a clean, tidy room, restocked with toiletries and fresh towels daily. We loved it. We stayed on the 10th floor.. the view from our balcony was amazing! Diamondhead mountain on the left and ocean view to the right. It's a lovely place to get away from the hustle and bustle....but close enough to access the city without a problem. The beach is about a five minute walk from the hotel which is nice; since you dont have to carry your stuff with you..just your room key and towel.I really appreciated the security of the hotel itself. The elevator has an extra safety feature that I appreciate while traveling. Thank you so much Sarah F.M. for making our visit extra special! My husband and I can't wait till our next visit!

We enjoyed our stay at the Lotus Resort. We stayed here 3 nights then flew to Kauai, We didn't want to stay in the busy part of Waikiki Beach and this was perfect because it was about a 10 min walk to the busy area of Waikiki Beach. The Premium Diamond Head room was clean & modern with a view of Diamond Head. I would recommend a higher view room. Loved the valet parking which was included. The valets were so kind. The resort had Tommy Bahama beach chairs that we could take in our SUV rental . The gentleman at the front desk even helped us take the chairs out of the trunk. So nice & very much appreciated. I loved that they had a free reusable water bottle in the room for us and a water cooler in the lobby to fill it, Nice touch and a small souvenir from our hotel. There was espresso in the room. Coffee in the lobby. The room has a small fridge, a safe, cute robes and slippers. The hotel has a wine reception each night and we did go twice. The wine was pretty good. Didn't love the gold fish crackers. The only complaint would have was the laminate wood floor in our room was buckling in a few spots. Otherwise, we would definitely stay here again.

This was the first time my wife and I had been to Hawaii and we chose the Lotus. It was a great choice! We had a great view of diamond head and a view of the ocean. The room was perfect for us. The staff was friendly and very pleasant making or trip even more relaxing! The next time we go to Oahu we will be staying at the Lotus again!

The Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head is an absolute gem tucked away at the quiet end (south-east) of Waikiki. It's about a 10~15 minute walk to the start of the bustle of Waikiki and the city of Honolulu. This ~51-room boutique hotel is not quite on the beach but is set back slightly from it with a couple of hotel/apartment buildings between it and the beach -- the buildings really do not spoil the view much, if at all. We had an Ocean View Premium Room on a high floor with 2 balconies (lanais) with fabulous views of the ocean, of Diamond Head and of the beautiful park behind the hotel. Our room was spacious, modern, very clean and comfortable. The hotel exuded an atmosphere of quiet, understated elegance and tranquility. The staff were incredibly efficient and friendly.If I could do it, I would rate this hotel 6.0 out of 5. I'm almost loathe to write such a glowing review lest this hotel is booked full for my next visit to Oahu. Dear reader, let's keep this place a secret between us -- tell only close friends :-)A few items of information:-Hotel has valet parking only but, unlike many local hotels, parking is included in the ~$25 resort fee.Happy hour in the lobby from 4pm-5:30pm -- (free) red and white wine and nibbles.Restaurant of 2nd floor (a separate business from hotel) is great -- well priced, good food and live music -- happy hour until 7pm.Breakfast:- 5~10min walk towards Waikiki to the Barefoot Cafe right on the promenade above the beach. Wonderful!Remember, this is our secret!

A good hotel that has been ‘refreshed’ cosmetically. Some fine details give the age away, but overall it gives a great impression. The staff are excellent, both helpful and knowledgeable. The location means a bit of a walk into the centre of Waikiki for shops and restaurants.

great location away from the fray. walk 3-4 minutes to a lovely beach for swimming and snorkeling. coal. great views of the ocean and diamond head. illy espresso machine in the room. or coffee in the mornings in the lobby. wine in the afternoon was a nice thing. great service.

A great hotel close enough to the city center to walk to but far enough to still be quiet and peaceful. The hotel also has a perfect view of diamond head and the beach. I spent much of my trip just enjoying the view, especially at night.

We needed to have a relaxing time. Stress free...Lotus provided the perfect place. It was quiet yet easily accessible to Waikiki. The Wisp had good food and the staff answered all our questions. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay.

We stayed @ Lotus for a week in April. Our 11th floor room was very aesthetic and comfortable. The staff was excellent. Lotus’s restaurant had good food and the hotel provided free museum passes. The local beach was a 5 minute walk away (we went there to swim and watch the beautiful sunsets). My wife is a botanist so we visited several botanic gardens. And, we food tripped to the max: very good breakfasts @ Hau Tree Lanai (next door); excellent dim sum @ Yauatcha (a nice, 1 mile walk into Waikiki); very good fish tacos @ Haleiwa Joe’s (North Shore); our best lunch @ Senia (Chinatown); and a fun Saturday morning eating too much @ the nearby Farmers’ Market.

The staff was very helpful, it was an overall good experience. If you want good weather travel to Oahu May through October. we visited in March and we had 4 sunny days out of 14! As per the locals that's normal, it's their winter weather. Our first purchase was a sweatshirt.

Very nice room with a big balcony overlooking Diamond Head and the park, and a bit of ocean too. Lobby won’t blow you away but you’re not sleeping there so it does not matter. Dark wood floors in a big room and a nice bathroom. Nespresso machine in room plus mini fridge is a nice touch as is the coffee in the lobby in the morning and wine in the afternoon. Location away from the traffic on the main Waikiki strip is great and it’s still only a 15 minute walk along the ocean to the center of the action.

One of the best boutique hotels period. Our room was next to Diamond Head and a half a mile from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki Beach. From a minutes walk to a private beach, morning Yoga and Tai Chi, our room offered a very spacious, clean, quiet experience. The staff was the icing on the cake always making you feel welcomed. Thank you Lotus!

Third time in a row staying at the Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head and we were just as pleased with the staff and service as always! Love the location and the small boutique feel! We are certain to return to this property and soak up the Diamond Head and ocean views!!

Loved staying outside of Waikiki, but close enough to walk or bike into town. This hotel is quiet with easy access to the beach and park. Our room (#925 Premium Ocean) had a gorgeous view of Diamond Head and some ocean views. We took advantage of the bikes, yoga, wine, coffee and parking. Didn't disappoint! We will definitely return.

We had an incredible getaway to the Lotus. It felt like we were in our own private paradise. When we arrived we were upgraded to the 12th floor with the Diamond Head AND ocean view, it was perfect. We drank our coffee out there every morning and enjoyed the peacefulness. The rooms were roomy, decorated nicely and felt very relaxing. All of the staff were friendly and made us feel welcome. It was nice every morning to be able to get towels and beach chairs from the front desk before we headed to the beach. The valets were friendly and helpful. We were able to take bikes and ride around. The location is excellent, you are close enough to Waikiki to walk in but far enough away you feel more secluded and private. We are from Alaska so to take a quick trip and fly direct, grab our rental car and get to our hotel in around 20 minutes made it so easy. We definitely can't wait to go again!! Would highly recommend!

My wife and I stayed for seven nights for our honeymoon and had a wonderful time. We had a balcony with view of Diamond Head, the park and the ocean. Our room had plenty of space and was very comfortable. This area is much quieter than the bustle of the heart of Waikiki and this was exactly what we wanted. We woke up to the sounds of birds every morning.The $25 daily resort fee was very reasonable considering that it included gear for the beach (towels, pads, umbrella's, chairs), bicycles, coffee in the morning and wine in the afternoon. AND valet parking! Some of the hotels in the heart of Waikiki charge as much as $50/day for parking alone.Wisp, the in-hotel restaurant, was very good and we had a few meals there. It was especially nice to be able to grab dinner there our first night since we were dragging after our 8-hour flight and the 5-hour time difference from Texas.There is a small convenience store (Russell's) right next to the hotel where you can get drinks and snacks at a reasonable (for Waikiki) price. There are also a number of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel if you don't feel like getting the car.The housekeeping staff were unobtrusive and very efficient. We found that if we got the car in the morning for an hour or two, the room would be cleaned when we returned. If we slept in late, they did not come to clean the room until later.We recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing base for their trip to Oahu.

We left after the lady at the reception was absolutely unprofessional. I had a feeling she is being personal, so I asked, and she admitted it. Right from the very beginning when we were checking in (it was April 5th) she was giving me an attitude while checking out other guests in more friendly way, those guests were the Americans. She was complaining that she has to do "extra job" by giving me a room with twin beds, although I have requested this during my booking. Is this something really that takes an effort? I did not request any upgrade, any special treatment, yet, she kept complaining that she is "trying her best", rolling her eyes, in order to give me a room with twin beds, which is obviously a difficult thing at the empty hotel.I didn't want to spoil my vacation and at the beginning I though that it only seems to me that way, but then my friend told me that this lady is being extremely rude. So I asked, why was she talking to me like that? And I couldn't believe what is literally said in a viscous way: "Yes, I have hard time understanding you. Because you have an accent!"So this basically put a big "no" to this whole hotel and my experience with them. I simply do not tolerate rudeness and obviously this kind of place doesn't deserve any income from me.The hotel seems very old, more like for mature travelers, although the location is very good. There is no modern touch, smells like mold, even in the room that I was given to check if I like it, that had a wonderful parking view. It was a rainy day, we arrived at noon, she said the room will not be ready by 3pm, so I canceled my reservation and went to another hotel, which was amazing. I will not give my business to anyone with this attitude and I think those kind of actions should be strictly addressed with consequences. I would really like to receive some explanation from the management regarding this case. I hope that the management will not only provide polite reply, but actually will change their attitude and stop treating people badly. I also believe that people like her should not work in the hospitality industry. To all travelers: please never tolerate those kind of behaviors. You do not deserve to be treated this way in any hotel or anywhere else. Everyone has an accent, skin color and many other things, this is not a way to treat anyone, especially a guest. Never put up with anything like that, do not give those people business and make those cases public.

I stayed here a week and was really impressed with this smaller hotel. The location is perfect, about a 15 minute walk from Waikiki so outside the crowds but close enough to go out to eat or go shopping. The hotel is extremely well managed and I noticed that many of the staff have been there for over a decade (not a lot of staff turnover). My room was beautiful with a great view of Diamond Head as well as a peek a boo view of the ocean. Very comfortable room and furnishings and I slept well here. The $25/day resort fee includes valet parking and a yoga class is offered every morning, usually in the park across the street. I have to say the yoga teachers are excellent. I myself am a certified yoga instructor and was impressed with the quality of the yoga classes, and the instructors ability to teach students of varying levels of experience was evident. The hotel has a small beach right on site and several larger beaches just a short walk away. I would not hesitate to stay here again and highly recommend this excellent property.

It's a cute hotel. Rooms were nice. They have a free wine happy hour in the afternoons, but we weren't able to attend one. We had breakfast 2 mornings in hotel restaurant - service was slow but food was good (although they were out of milk for my son one morning...who runs out of milk?). I like that it wasn't right on the strip. The beach was ok where we were. I'd probably rate as a 3.5.

Over the past 10 years we have stayed at the Lotus on numerous occasions. We like the size of the rooms, the simple but tasteful decor, and the peace and quiet. The staff are always friendly and helpful. We really appreciate the personal touch that comes with the Lotus; it is so much better than the big hotel feel of much of Waikiki. We feel that it is a great value for the money.

My wife and I just completed an 8 night stay at the Lotus Diamond Head. The hotel met and exceeded all of our expectations. To give you an idea of how it is situated with the rest of the hotels on Waikiki Beach, it is about a 15 minute easy walk on the beach to the Royal Hawaiian Hotel . The hotel is located on Kapi'olani Park at the base of Diamond Head, so it is in a park like setting, with lots of trees and is removed from the mass of humanity that you find in the main areas of Waikiki Beach. But as I mentioned, it is a very easy and short walk to all of Waikiki Beach. So you have what I consider the best of both worlds.The hotel staff was excellent. It is a small boutique hotel, so the staff quickly learns your name. All very helpful, friendly and professional. There is a mandatory $25 resort fee, and for once, you really get what you pay for. Valet parking is included in the resort fee and your car is always parked within steps of the door, so it never takes them more than a couple minutes to retrieve your car. The hotel is not on the beach, but it might as well be on the beach. There is a very nice dedicated beach area that was a closer walk from our room than many hotels we have stayed in that are on the beach. The hotel has towels and beach chairs as part of the resort fee. Everything super easy and quick to check out.Our room was fantastic. Corner room on the 7th floor overlooking Diamond Head. Everything in the room was perfect. Great shower, big bathroom, great air conditioning, oversized safe, refrigerator and very fast internet. There is coffee in the room, but the free coffee in the lobby was very good. Nice and strong, but not too strong.

For the price, this is a definite 5 star. The rooms are nice and extremely clean. The amenities are nice. I particularly liked the kimona and meant to buy one, but forgot. We had a partial view of the ocean through buildings on the 6th floor, which was very quiet. Off the large balcony we had a nice view of Diamondhead and the park. The restaurant on the 2nd floor is a little worse for wear, but the food was excellent for both dinner and breakfast. We did not take advantage of the free bikes, beach equipment or yoga classes, but will if we stay longer next trip. The major plus to this little gem is the staff. It is obvious that they all "care" about their hotel and the comfort of the guests. We will definitely stay again.

Located near the base of Diamond Head, the Lotus provides a refreshing alternative to the hustle and bustle of the large Waikiki chain hotels. Just minutes walking distance to the “main strip” and with a nice uncrowded beach right around the corner, this boutique 12 story hotel offers most of what larger hotels can offer. A big advantage is the quick and easy access to your car. Usually can just walk to your car just outside the entrance without having to wait for valet service - very convenient! Most rooms have partial ocean views and all have nice sized balconies.The rooms are modernly furnished with a relaxed and refined aesthetic, very comfortable. The bathrooms are spacious with lots of counter space and shelving for storage. Tips: There is a restaurant/nightclub on the 2nd floor which can get noisy on Friday and Saturday nights - so being higher up gets you away from the noise. You want a room on the 6th floor or above - definitely avoid the 3rd floor. Rooms that border the main street can also get some street noise, but many offer views of both Diamond Head and the ocean - so upper story rooms get you away from street noise as well.We are frequent guests of the Lotus and have always found the rooms to be clean and the staff friendly and helpful. During one stay, our shower drain clogged and the staff addressed it promptly - very responsive.

We are very glad we skipped the big, crowded center of Waikiki and stayed at the peaceful boutique Lotus. It’s a great location- on the beach (short walk in between buildings to the ocean), next to a beautiful park, ocean and Diamond Head views, but away from the crazy crowds of Waikiki. It’s a nice 20 min walk when we wanted to get to Waikiki, but we preferred staying close to the hotel in the peace.The hotel is small - only 5 rooms per floor - and the staff friendly. They have amenities like wine at happy hour, coffee and tea in the morning, beach gear, bikes, water bottles, etc. we took advantage of the 7:30am yoga and loved it!One day the elevator was not working for a few hours so we had to walk up 11 flights to our room. Not a big deal for us, but there is only one elevator so if something goes wrong you’ll need to adjust. This may be the very first time this ever happened but I wanted to mention it because it may be important to someone. It did not affect my rating in anyway.The lobby is very nicely decorated. The rooms are attractive and serene and we loved our view. There is a resort fee of $25 per day (not a choice) so be prepared for that. It includes parking and all the beach amenities I mentioned so I think it’s worth it, and the hotel is reasonably priced.I know I’ll recommend this hotel to friends and family which is the best indication of how I feel about it.

review_body: Loved this hotel! Numerous amenities including beach towels, beach chairs, bikes, included parking, DVD check out, bottled water in room, fridge in room, espresso machine in room and coffee in the lobby. Also, coin laundry available as well. Great staff and great location! Very comfortable room with beautiful view.

Had high expectations after reading the views. The service was fabulous, very friendly valet and front desk staff. Immediate disappointment when arriving at our Diamond Head view room and finding that we really just overlooked an ugly parking lot and can barely see the top of Diamond Head (through the trees) only if standing right on our balcony and looking to the far left. There was no bath but the shower was a bit awkward and had almost a small bathtub base that pooled water in it. We were excited to stay off of the strip but were planning to rely on the shuttle to still get to Waikiki for meals and touring. Unfortunately the program the hotel advertises to track the shuttles (so you know when they will arrive) was not working so we never knew when they were coming/going. It made it very difficult to make plans without sitting in the lobby waiting 30 minutes for the shuttle. Very frustrating when it could have been a great system. The good things are that the hotel is peaceful, the bike borrowing option is nice as well as the beach chairs for the beach which is small but very close. The rooms were clean and spacious. Next time for the price I would pick another hotel closer to the strip or with a well operating shuttle.

My husband and I just returned from a week stay at the Lotus. We purchased the week via Interval Getaway exchange. One of the reasons for choosing this hotel was the location. It was perfect for what we like. It was close enough to the action, yet far away from all the hustle, bustle and noise Waikiki has to offer. Our room was on the 5th floor; we had a nice view of Diamond Head and a fairly decent view of the ocean. The hotel is a little older, but has been updated and the rooms were nicely decorated.The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds! The fresh morning coffee in the lobby was a bonus as well as the wine in the afternoon!The Kapiolani park is across the street and short walk to the beach park area. We walked to restaurants and shops, We also took advantage of the Aqua Hotel shuttle service, which we used several times to go downtown (Earl the driver was great!).The Lotus staff was excellent!! Everyone was friendly, accommodating and helpful. We loved having the restaurant Wisp on site. We took advantage of having a nice breakfast and their happy hour specials. Again, great staff!The only item I was a little unsatisfied was because we purchased through Interval, we were only given one mid-week cleaning. This was not the issue; however, it would have been nice to have our garbage removed from the room daily. In all, a wonderful stay at the Lotus! Thank-you

What a great place to experience Oahu. The room was spacious, clean, well-equipped and reasonably priced. The view from the good-sized balcony was spectacular- Diamond Head to the left and the ocean to the right.Valet parking is included in the $25 a day resort fee (along with a free wine happy hour, free morning coffee and newspaper and beach chairs and towels!) so you aren’t being gauged with add-on charges if you have a rental. We had family nearby, so we didn’t have a car. We used the shuttle service to Waikiki a few times, but decided the beaches by the hotel were less crowded and we didn’t want to shop. We also had privileges through family members to the Outrigger Canoe Club, so we were in a perfect location to take advantage of all that had to offer. We took various side trips and all the tour buses were willing to pick us up at the Lotus, so we weren’t penalized for being out of the main Waikiki area. All in all the Lotus is a great choice and one that will help to add many wonderful memories from your stay on Oahu.

Like the location as it is close but much quieter than Waikiki. Older building, no fitness but they offer yoga. One elevator, which didn't work one day and that is an issue when you are on floor 12. Valet parking is convenient and pleasant a real plus. Our apologies as we forgot to tip one time for valet. Staff friendly. But the place needs upgrades. We stayed here two years ago, it was more in style then. Now trendy magazines spread out in room are many months old editions. Bedrooms are nice. Baths are how to deal with 60's apartment style. Offers wine in late afternoon and coffee in the morning. Note ocean view means a glimpse of ocean, not the full vista. Probably better to skip the cost for ocean view. Nice balcony with small table and two chairs. Microwave. mini frig, coffee maker. Towels etc standard, nothing special. Offers discounts at Macy's and Honolulu Art Museum. Has shuttle to ala Moana mall. Am dog person but could have skipped the 6am doggie barking alarm from the next room.

Stayed 2 nites. Comfy beds, espresso in-room, very friendly staff, wine in the afternoon, good beach access, towels, mats and chairs for the beach. Great view of Diamond head. The papaya fruit bowl for breakfast is great.

First, hotel staff members were friendly, pleasant and tried accommodating whatever travel needs you may have and did so with smile. Second, you can't beat the location with view to Diamond Head and beautiful, calm and peaceful Kapiolani Park. Lastly, I found Lotus Honolulu's free valet parking a great value as most of Waikiki Hotels charge well over $20 per night. Lotus also provides free extra bed in room - great additional benefit for family travelers like us. Overall we strongly recommend Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head.

Very friendly, more than what I expected...What an amazing gem of a hotel away from the busy Waikiki. Easy to get with valet parking. Lots of accommodations, on one of our days it was raining and we were offered hotel umbrellas. Great view of Diamond and the ocean. we will definitely make this our favorite place to stay <3 while on Oahu...

I have stayed here when it was under different owners and had a different name. It is accross from the park and always peaceful and quiet. If you enjoy walking it is just a short walk to many places from here restaurants and other things to see. There is a lovely small beach here and it too is peaceful. You may have to make room for a sleeping seal nearby. I am always happy to go here.

We had visited this place for our 10th anniversary. The valet parking as soon as we arrived made us feel cared for. The hotel is not large so the personal touches really stand out. Free coffee in the morning down in the lobby and then happy hour of white or red wine between 4 and 5 pm every day. Such a treat! It took us a few days to figure out the apples in the dish by the elevator were real and to just help yourself! The restaurant on the 2nd floor has taco Tuesday specials. A change from the over priced restaurants further down the beach. We particularly enjoyed using the hotel's tandem bike. It took a few minutes to get the hang of it but eventually got the rhythm and were about to enjoy a ride up and down Waikiki beach. All beaches are public but some are harder to access than others. So Lotus has their "private" beach a 100 yards down the path. Ask for beach chairs and snorkelling gear at the front desk. We were able to enjoy a corner suite with a full panoramic view of Diamond Head Park and a bit of the beach. Every morning we sat on the balcony and watched green, blue, yellow birds fly in and around the trees below. So magical. Our rooms were clean, spacious, with robes, slippers, a safe to use at our leisure. We recommend this place away from the craziness of central Waikiki.

Stunning views of diamond head, small boutique style allowed for is to feel very special. The staff was super accommodating. Join the “A list” and book directly with the website - we received a few extra perks for this. It was a peaceful stay, thank you !

review_body: Spent the night at the Lotus hotel in Waikiki for our Anniversary. It is a small hotel but very nice. The hotel is at the far end of Waikiki, close to the aquarium. We were on the 11th floor and there were only about 6 rooms on our floor. We had a slight ocean view. From the outside walkway to our room saw the Hilton Fireworks that night. The next morning it was nice sitting out on the lanai with a coffee. Room was well appointed with amenities and had a refrigerator which is always nice. Would definitely return.

Pros: Great balcony ambience with the birds chirping in the morning, very peaceful. Valet parking was handy and always prompt. Minutes walking distance to the park, zoo, or beach. Local eateries are a 20 minute walk. Diamond head is a 15 minute drive or half an hour walk. Waikiki beach is a 10-15 minute drive. Did not try the restaurant in the hotel but it had good reviews. Cons: Third floor room near the elevator, super noisy as all hotel rooms near elevators are, though. DVD machine was not working. Business room was not internet ready, not normally a problem in paradise, but I actually needed to get work done and my Mac had gone haywire, so this was kind of a bummer.

This was a great location for us, very peaceful but in walking distance of most everything. Loved our corner room with the two balconies. The room and bathroom were spacious. The beds were terribly uncomfortable. Housekeeping service was terrible.

We had a good time staying here and wish we could have seen We should have stayed longer. Maybe we will stay longer next time. The WISP restaurant in the Lotus was also a pleasant surprise: good food, friendly service, comfortable booth and great music from Thick Tubes.

The Lotus is located in a great location, alongside Kapiolani Park outside the main area of Waikiki. It's much quieter than Waikiki and you have a feeling of living in a neighborhood (of beachside condo buildings) rather than a touristy area. The hotel has a wonderful small beach shared with a couple of the condo buildings and the Canoe Club. The resort fee includes beach chairs, mats, and towels, valet parking, wine-tasting every afternoon and yoga every morning, and since I take advantage of all of these, it's one place where I don't mind paying the fee. Rooms are large and pretty much identical, so there's not much fuss over which room to take. Higher floors have a slightly better view.The hotel is not for everyone, however. There are few restaurants and amenities in the immediate vicinity, so you can't just walk out your door to a large choice of restaurants, etc.. You will have to walk or bike .7 mile to the beginning of the main Waikiki area and then potentially further to arrive at your restaurant, store, club, take-out, or shopping. The hotel does provide a free shuttle bus into Waikiki and then into downtown Honolulu. Note also that there are three restaurants and one small convenient store within a few feet of the hotel. That said, IMHO the hotel works best with a car, Uber, or biking. The hotel provides free bikes that are quite nice and are well equipped with front and rear lights for riding at night. Also, the beach is small, private, and quiet and not a big scene with lots of bathers, volleyball, concerts, movies, vendors, etc. Just depends what you like.

The Lotus bills itself, as do many of its reviewers, as a calm alternative to the Waikiki madhouse. In a relative sense, that is true. It is located about a mile from the Waikiki "strip," in an area mainly occupied by high-rise condos, across the road from Kapiolani Park in a pleasantly landscaped area.The decor adds to an impression of tranquility: a small lobby seating area with Asian furnishings and fresh orchids. No desks pushing tours, although I imagine the check-in personnel (helpful) can arrange what you are looking for if that's your goal. The guest bedroom we stayed in was on the small side though well appointed and cheerful.But The Lotus doesn't carry through its Zen-like vibe. The present management (which I suspect took the property over from the one that commissioned the design) seems to distrust the appeal of the quietness. In the public areas (including elevators) speakers play reggae and pop music.The Lotus's only restaurant -- and there are few others in the immediate neighborhood -- doubles as a sports bar and live music scene in the evenings. While the food is satisfying (we ate one dinner and every breakfast there) the multiple TV screens showing sports events and the bands shatter any pretensions to relaxation. The Lotus management seems to want to have it all ways for all people.On our second night when we went into the restaurant for dinner a bunch of oafs were setting up the sound equipment for the band and clowning around obnoxiously and loudly. We left and asked at the front desk for an alternative choice, and were directed to Miyako next door in the New Otani. It is very traditional Japanese, and if that suits you, you can be sure of an excellent experience at Miyako (try to get a table near the large window in the evening and watch the sunset). Meanwhile the Lotus's sports bar/restaurant offers, and I quote from their promotional material, "entertainment nightly which varies between Jazz, Conemporary Hawaiian Dance Music, Rhythm and Blues, Comedy Shows and Special Movie Nights."There is so much about the Lotus that is worthwhile, it's a shame management feels a need to go down-market and up-market at the same time, promoting a laid-back atmosphere and subverting it significantly.

The Lotus is a relaxing, more intimate hotel, away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, with great service and friendly staff. We had a corner room, which was beautiful. No pool but the Pacific Ocean on your doorstep.

Relax on the beach,without the crowds.wonderful friendly staff,complimentary wine at 4pm!Beautiful spotless rooms.walk to shops.very low key and relaxing.our home away from home,can’t wait to return,and see the monk seals again.

Great location. Easy walk to Waikiki but far enough away from the hustle and bustle. The staff were all friendly, helpful and professional. Lobby and rooms were all nicely decorated and the whole place has a nice relaxed, zen-like atmosphere. Free water in the lobby (that's a big deal) and free wine for happy hour! Wonderful hotel, I highly recommend it.

Had a room on the 10th floor Views from the balcony of Diamond Head and the Ocean Room was very comfortable Had quality coffee in the room unlike other Hotels ,this trip where the coffee was tasteless Had 1 breakfast and 2 evening meals The Food was excellent and the price reasonable This hotel is at the quieter part of Waikiki The reception and waiting staff were polite and helpfulNo downsides that we found

I highly recommend the Lotus. It's in a wonderful location, if you don't want to be in the thick of things in Waikiki. It's across the street from a large park where they offer a morning yoga class. It's easy to get to the beach and the hotel offers towels, chairs, and snorkel equipment.The staff is lovely. Everyone is helpful, friendly and professional. When we arrived, they were serving wine in the lobby which was a nice surprise.Our room was clean and well appointed. We had a view of Diamond Head in one direction and a snippet of the ocean in another. Sitting on our lanai in the afternoon was delightful. We look forward to staying at the Lotus on our next visit.

You start to feel relaxed the minute that you step into the lobby. The hotel is located in an out of the way location away from the crush of Waikiki. The walk along the ocean wall in the morning and evenings are great. Avoid the restaurant on the second floor. Opt for the Hau Tree Lanai next door instead.

We spent one night here after a week at the resort area of Ko Olina. We wanted to experience Honolulu without all the craziness and tourists on top of each other.if you want some peace and quiet this is a perfect place for you.The rooms are spacious and feel zen and uncluttered. They come with robes and slippers. There is no bathtub, just a shower. The room had a small microwave and fridge. The lanai was very nice and we were upgraded to an ocean view room due to painting outside our planned diamond head room. There is plenty of ocean to see but the view is in between buildings. There is no pool but the ocean is a short walk away.The hotel has a wine happy hour at 4 to 5 and they served some cheese fish also. There was good coffee in the lobby in the morning and an espresso maker in the room. The staff was very friendly and very helpful with dinner recommendations and directions. We walked into the Waikiki area and enjoyed the walk around shops and to dinner. Resort fee of $25 a night covers valet parking, towels, the lobby drinks, free movie and PS games etc.If you want a full on resort or want to be in the crowded beach this won’t be for you but if you want a zen place by the hustle and bustle this will make you happy.

First time to Hawaii for anniversary and this hotel was fantastic. We selected it based on reviews and that it was a way from Waikiki beach. We did have to walk to get to the shops and restaurants but it was worth it to be in a quieter location. Hotel staff was extremely pleasant and very helpful. Room was clean and we are very picky. Hotel is not directly on the water, but still had great view from balcony. There is beach access but the area is small. If you want to be on a good stretch of beach you have to walk a little ways. We didn't mind. Business center computer was not connected to the internet but the hotel staff printed our boarding passes for us. Definitely recommend if you are looking for a more quiet place and don't mind walking. They did have free bikes that could be used, but we did not use them.

I choose our hotels by reviews and I definitely found that our stay proved these true plus more. From the check in that was super pleasant when we were exhausted from the trip all the way to the awesome cleaning crew, the wonderful view and the valet that was always helpful and pleasant. Not only will we return but I have already recommended

My friend and I decided to go shopping in Honolulu as there is no shopping in Molokai. We were referred to this hotel by a friend. Great location and away from the hustle bustle of Waikiki. Rooms are very comfortable and clean.Really enjoyed availability of having free wine at happy hour. Staff are friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

Lotus hotel is nice enough, but certainly not luxury. Rooms are spacious, bath is spacious enough. Closet is also fairly large. Small refrigerator & free water for your convenience, as well as bicycle, beach chairs, parking, etc for your use ( mandatory resort fee, whether you use these items or not). Complimentary coffee in morning and inexpensive wine for happy hour. Beach is 100 paces away. Location is across from a park and off the beaten path a bit, but an uber ride from the shops, restaurants, etc. New Year's week the price was double, but most other times fairly reasonable. Staff is helpful and congenial. But if it is a resort you're seeking, it's not.I would stay there again.

This hotel is great if it is what you are looking for. It is quiet, close to but not on the beach, has lovely rooms (spacious, nicely furnished, with comfortable beds and a good size shower rooms). The views of Diamond Head are good, but I would have been disappointed if I had particularly wanted a sea view since at best these are between other tower blocks. As far as I could tell, whatever floor you were on, you would be looking over a parking lot, although the higher the room, the less obvious this is.The hotel staff were without exception very pleasant. We requested a microwave oven at check-in, and the staff were already putting it in the room as we arrived. This was very handy, since many island activities start early and would require you to be out and about before breakfast is served. For example, sunrise at Diamond Head is popular; Pearl Harbor visitor center opens at 7 am, and you need to get there early if you like history but only have one day to spare.However, the Lotus Honolulu is not a resort hotel, the eating facilities are limited (and the restaurant was closed several nights of our stay for private functions), and there are not many other non-room-based facilities, which is fine if that is not important to you. We did have a rental car, and found the valet parking a minor nuisance (no fault of the staff, it just means having to remember to take everything from the car that will be required in the room). We were not tempted into eating places within walking distance.In summary, this is a really nice hotel if your main requirement is a good quiet room convenient for getting out and about, but if you are really into resort living, or lounging on a beach that's just outside your room, or very keen on nightlife or entertainment, or love to be waited on hand and foot, you will end up being disappointed. You have to work out some of these things by reading between the lines on the hotel's web-site, or studying TripAdvisor quite carefully, which in my opinion is a shame because it means someone who has not done their research might have unrealistic expectations. Having written that, we would very happily stay at the Lotus Honolulu again because it suited us very well.

We have visited Honolulu many times and usually stay at ‘big name hotels’ on the Waikiki strip. No longer!The Lotus is on the quiet end near Diamond Head. Very attentive staff that does a great job at the small things: daily paper, in room espresso, daily yoga on the beach, evening wine on the lobby. The rooms are good sized with large functional baths and a balcony.

We had a great time there ! Staff was great ! We like the location and the convience of being close to everything. The complimentary coffee in the morning and the complimentary wine in the afternoon was an added plus. The room was clean and functioned perfectly for us.We enjoyed having the morning paper at our door each morning. Having the restaurant on the second floor was great ! Food and service was good there too !

We really enjoyed our visit to the Lotus Honolulu, this is a nice boutique hotel with access to Kaimana beach. The hotel supplied all necessary amenities to enjoy the beach including lounge chairs and an umbrella. Other amenities included morning yoga classes which the family enjoyed doing in Kapiolani Park right across the street. Every evening there was a nice happy hour with wine and snacks. We also liked the fact that we could walk over to Waikiki but still be away from the congested touristy areas. Our hotel room itself was very comfy and we enjoyed panoramic views of Diamond Head and the ocean. If we are ever in Honolulu again I would definitely consider this hotel again.

It was well priced, and easy for a quick visit. It is not a "lie around the pool" resort as there isn't a pool or place to be outside except for a small and crowded sliver of beach. I recommend it for a business or short stay in Honolulu...

I was visiting a friend in a very nearby condo, so the location was excellent for me. Service was generally good. I never tried breakfast or dinner so can't judge those. Beach was pretty crowded, but it was Christmas week.

The room smelt unclean and the sheets and pillows were not great. They were advertised as “Egyptian cotton” but were just crappy sheets pillows smelt like they need to change. The lift was clunky and needs a proper clean - big dirty skid marks over the handrail do t give a clean quality feeling pretty average two star Pensione.

We spent a week at the hotel in one of the supreme rooms with two lanais. The room was spacious, beautifully appointed, and very clean. One of the lanais overlooked Kapiolani Park with a full view of Diamond Head and 1/2 water view. Our view was unobstructed with at least 50 yards of open space before the next building. The staff were attentive but not obtrusive and responded quickly to every request. We paid an extra $25/day fee that included valet parking, beach chairs, towels, umbrellas, mats. This was a perfect romantic getaway within walking distance of everything we wanted.

We had a relaxing time at the Lotus. Staff was incredibly helpful. They contributed greatly to the peaceful experience. The valet service perfect and a huge assist during our visit. All staff went out of their way to make our stay a positive experience.

Should NOT be ranked 9.2/10 or 4.9/5 “superb”...that was not my experience at all. Plus, I tried reporting the issues to the front desk when I checked-out; but, the woman at the front desk just shrugged & said, “Oh well, that happens sometimes.”What?! Zero customer service or attempt to rectify the problems! Over $200/night: ridiculous.Let me start by saying I’m local (just checked-out today...writing this immediately to warn others), so I am very familiar with other resort properties here. Comparatively, it deserves about a 5 or 6 max (out of 10; or, 3 out of 5), only if the cleanliness issues & malfunctions had NOT occurred. The property overall is noisy, outdated, and surrounded by parking lots (garbage - or other - trucks come through around sunrise & beep incessantly when backing out of the lot). Further, it is not an enclosed hotel; so, rather than an enclosed hallway insulating noise that echoes from the parking lots, every sound carries under the door & passes through thin walls...reverberating off of hard wood floors.When showering, the basin (like half of a hot tub at the bottom) filled with water rather than draining: disgusting. There were many large noticeable stains on the furniture. Also, the DVD player the front desk attendant talked-up when I checked-in (because the TV is terrible and offers only basic cable channels) is actually a PlayStation and did NOT work.I am out of space. Still, this should be enough to discourage any sensible traveler from choosing this place.

Stayed for ten days and had a very relaxing and enjoyable stay. The immediate area around the hotel is peaceful and beautiful with Kapioloni Park across the street and San Souci beach practically around the corner. Our room was clean and comfortable with a great lanai offering excellent views of the park, Diamond Head and the ocean. We've stayed at the Lotus numerous times over the years and always look forward to our next return visit.

We always stay here when visiting Oahu. Boutique hotel that is off the beaten path, but still within walking distance of Waikiki proper. We select the Lotus because it is on the east end of Waikiki, out of the noise and heavy traffic.

Great location with fabulous views of both Diamond and the beach/Pacific. Easy access to walk Waikiki Beach as well as downtown shopping. The adjacent park gives the area a positive feel of openness versus being in the tight quarters of most hotels on Waikiki Beach.

Best place to stay in Waikiki. Perfect location on the diamond head side of Waikiki. Small confortable hotel with nicest rooms in Waikiki. Might cost a little extra but well worth the price. Wonder views

Close enough to walk into Waikiki but far enough to feel peaceful.Great room,beds and staff.Boutique style but almost deluxe/luxury.Nice wine reception in the lobby daily.The park across the street allows for walk and running.A few steps from a great beach.

Easy access to a nice beach, right on the park, generous room, pleasant porch. Use one of the bikes if you want to cruise the Strip. Great place to view the Friday fireworks. The Hau Tree next door is a great spot to dine.

The Lotus is a hidden gem, tucked away at the end of Waikiki, near one of the locals favorite beaches--Kaimana Beach or Sans Souci. Your view of Diamond Head makes it seem like you can reach out and touch it! The blue Pacific is even closer. Take advantage of the hotel's yoga class held in Kapiolani Park which is just across the street. The attractions of Waikiki are a five minute stroll away--you won't need your car. The rooms are comfortably appointed with emphasis on the beautiful view past your lanai. The bathrooms are spacious and well designed both for function and aestheitics. I like that the floors are not carpeted but wood floors that look like the real thing but may be laminate. The housekeepers at Lotus do a marvelous job of keeping the rooms spotless! The lobby is very tastefully decorated. I really appreciated that it took less than one minute from the time I handed my car key to the valet to cross the lobby and enter the elevator to our room. It usually took longer than that because the friendly staff always had a smile and a recommendation for other fun activities--and then there's the complimentary wine in the afternoon. A very nice touch indeed! A true test of how well a hotel is managed is the morale of the the staff--do they like working there? I spoke with housekeepers, maintenance men and front desk staff. Not only do they say they like it, the proof is in how long they have worked here--unofficially, I would say an average exceeding ten years! And they don't fake the smiles! With all of the good things I have to say about the Lotus, I'd be remiss if I did not mention that it is a value when compared with other beachfront Waikiki properties. You can check that one for yourself. Do yourself a favor and consider the Lotus for your next stay on Oahu.

Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head is a very special boutique hotel: beautiful decor, lovely setting, large rooms, beautiful views - and all of that crowned with no doubt about the most knowledgeable and friendly staff in Honolulu. We have been staying at this property for many years - the Lotus Honolulu team have really brought it all together and made it shine. I want to stress that this is a boutique hotel - there is not a large staff (but everyone there is very helpful and proactive) but there are VERY expensive "brand name" hotels for folks who want those amenities. What we enjoy about hotels like the Lotus Honolulu is that they offer extraordinary value while delivering luxury and beauty. We recommend the Lotus Honolulu unconditionally and without hesitation - enjoy the private beach, its the best in Honolulu!

Spacious and clean rooms in a quiet location, but only 15 minutes walking distance to Waikiki. Yoga lessons provided at 7.30 daily. Bicycle included in amenity fee. Complimentary wine from 4.00 to 5.30 was great.

Quiet and comfortable, good sense of distance.The rooms are clean and clean, but the facilities are old.The elevator is old, it seems to be broken and scared. I wake up at night with the stop of the elevator.

The only reason I did not rate this a “5” is due to the number of homeless and panhandlers in the vicinity. With that being said this is a quaint boutique-type hotel with beautiful views, comfortable rooms; attentive staff, and a great location. Most everything you want or need right down to bathrobes and slippers are provided. An ample supply of bottled water is provided and replenished each day along with in-room coffee/ espresso, wine in the afternoon (in lobby), beach chairs and towels. This was an oasis and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay ...... only wish law enforcement would clean up the neighborhood.

The hotel has been updated and the decor is lovely. We enjoyed the happy hour wine bar and the valet bringing us all a cold bottle of water when the car came around was unexpected and very much appreciated.My only recommendation was if they were to update the elevator. It's old and clunky. I'm claustrophobic and I'm glad I requested a lower floor so I could take the stairs.

My cousin recommended The Lotus for its location and because it's a boutique hotel, which we prefer. The hotel is just a bit off the beaten path from Waikiki, which was great, because it was quiet but still within walking distance to Waikiki. We booked the Ocean View Premium room and it did not disappoint! While we didn't have a full ocean view (but still nice), what made it stunning was our unobstructed view of Diamond Head. The room itself was spacious and well-appointed with extra little touches. The $25 amenity fee included so much more than other hotels on Waikiki, like valet parking, beach cruisers, yoga classes, to name a few. The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. Everyone we had contact with had a can-do attitude. We had breakfast one morning in the Wisp Restaurant, and it was fine. A little pricey, but that's not unusual for Waikiki. I would highly recommend The Lotus for all the reasons stated above. You won't go wrong if you want a quiet, peaceful stay near Waikiki.

A wonderful small hotel in perfect location if you don't want to be in the middle of busy Waikiki but close enough to enjoy its charms. Great staff, nice rooms. Free bicycles for rent, with locks and helmets. We will come again!

I love this boutique hotel and the only place I will ever stay!! Located across from Kapiolani Park near Diamond Head. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are clean, include mini fridge, coffee bar, microwave, hair dryer, large bottle of water, robes and house shoes, gaming console (don't remember which one), and room safe.Nice balcony to view Diamond Head and partial ocean (on upper floors only) and watch the sunrise over Diamond Head.Bottled water, umbrellas, beach chairs/towels, and bicycles are available and included in the resort fee. Wine is also offered each late afternoon in the lobby.The Wisp is the on site restaurant serving breakfast and dinner. We did not dine on site this time. Also a lounge with live music. Beach is at most a 2 minute walk out the back. Beautiful park across the street. It is a very quiet and relaxing location, far enough away from the hustle/bustle of Waikiki but close enough to walk to it. What more could you ask for????

Great place to stay, only a short walk to Waikiki beach, rooms very clean and quiet, don't use the free bus Shuttle to the shopping mall due to a very rude driver, that was the only issue on our trip. Great views when you go down to the beach

Lotus Hotel was amazing. I loved that it was away from the main Waikiki stretch so it was quieter and right across from the park. Staff was welcoming and amenities and views were great. They have yoga every morning, bikes you can take out to ride, a very knowledgeable staff and are right next to a pretty secluded beach!

We originally booked one night here to close out two weeks in Hawaii before flying home. The start of the second week on a second island was a nightmare so we decided to add three nights to our stay at Lotus. Good decision. The room, and the view were fabulous, and the staff was first rate. The location is superb, though about a 15 minute walk to the main strip of Waikiki.

The lotus makes you feel you are in Paradise. The room was well layout and very comfortable. The staff was excellent. Evening wine and morning coffee combine with yoga and free bikes makes for a perfect vacation.  with yoga and free bikes and you have the pe
