review_body: We booked a family trip to Hawaii for the purpose of interring my father-in-law's ashes at the military cemetery. There were 7 of us total staying at the Lotus, and they were able to book us all on the same floor, with our rooms next to each other, which was really nice and convenient. Unfortunately, when we arrived, the elevator had just stopped working, and we were on the 3rd floor. For most of us, this was just a minor inconvenience, but my mother-in-law suffers from painful arthritic knees, so that was not such a great start to our stay. However, the staff was wonderful and carried our luggage up the stairs and deposited it in one room so we didn't have to lug it up ourselves. Luckily, by the time we were ready to come down again after we were settled in, the elevator was working again, and all was smooth sailing after that. The rooms we had were on the side facing Diamond Head, and we each had a nice lanai outside our rooms with a small table and chairs so we could relax out there and look at the glorious view. You can't possible have a bad day when you wake up to a view of Diamond Head! Another fun bonus was the daily visits from the local colorful birds who were hanging around hoping for crumbs. There were so many different types, it was great just to watch them. My husband and I had the corner room, which also had views of the lovely park across the street. The room itself was very comfortable and spacious, clean and stylishly decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable, which made it easier to fall asleep. The amenities were very nice, good quality coffee, and the local Hawaiian bottled water was provided and replenished every day, which was a huge plus for us. The bathroom was also roomy and very clean, with shelves to hold extra towels and room to place your accessories, which is usually a problem at most hotels. They also provide very nice Japanese cotton robes for your use during your stay, and even slippers, in case you forgot yours. I loved the provided toiletries so much that I ended up using them exclusively, instead of the ones I brought from home! The hotel also features a restaurant, Wisp, which we ate at multiple times during our stay, not only for convenience, but because the food was great, and the staff was very friendly and fun to chat with. I want to especially single out Will, who often waited on our table at breakfast, and provided us with a lot of tips about where to go and what to see, and how to get there. We got to know him a little during our stay, so much so that he almost felt like family by the time we left! Speaking of staff, everyone we dealt with was very friendly, helpful, and kind. No request was greeted as an imposition, and they seemed to genuinely care that we were comfortable and had anything we needed. What a unique experience! As others have mentioned, the location itself was perfect for a relaxing time. Peaceful surroundings, but you could easily walk to all the "razzmatazz" of Waikiki and enjoy the shopping and restaurants. The fact that it is also on the beach made it nice for walking in the area. The only minus, which I guess can't be helped: on the last morning of our stay, they had to kick everyone out of their rooms for a while so they could spray for bugs. A necessary evil, I suppose, since really, who wants bugs in the room? However, my mother-in-law didn't want to be exposed to the pesticide afterwards, so they accommodated her by waiting until after we were checked out to spray the room she'd been in, which was thoughtful and appreciated. Although we never took advantage of it, we saw many guests enjoying the wine happy hour in the lobby, and we did enjoy the lemon infused water whenever we returned from an outing. All in all, I found The Lotus to be a lovely place to stay, with personal service, and in fact would be my preferred choice to stay for future trips to Honolulu. I very highly recommend it for both honeymooners and families, as well as business travelers.

Great location away from the craziness of Waikiki. Beautiful views from room. Everything you need for a fun stay including beach chairs, towels, boogie boards, etc. Easy walk to Waikiki and all other areas. Peaceful, clean, friendly. We will be back!

Great location and fabulous staff. Short walk to delightful swimming bay. Awesome views of Diamond Head. Easy stroll to Waikiki. Room generous with all amenities. We were on 12th floor and had 2 balconies with great outlooks.

Stayed at the Lotus last night and had a fabulous time as usual. Great team, full of Aloha, extremely helpful and ready to please. At great choice if you are in Honolulu for business like me or in vacation and do not want to deal with the craziness of Waikiki (BUT still be close enough to enjoy it). Mahalo!

I really appreciate the location, that it's set away from the noisy, busy waikiki streets, but not so far away that waikiki is inaccessible. We took advantage of the bike rentals and the beach chair rentals (which are very comfortable!). The hotel is small and quaint, which I also appreciated. Staff is very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I just stayed there for two nights and three days. It's a great boutique type property in Diamond Head, away from all the tourist hype in Waikiki. The rooms are great. I would've preferred a higher floor room with a view, but we didn't go there to stay in the room and we were out and about most of the time. Amenities are great with illy coffee in the room, beach chairs, beach towels, bikes and chilled bottled water. The beach is just a quick walk away. One night we even walked into Waikiki for dinner and it was a great 15 minute walk to and from the restaurant. The service really made it for us. Marcie (spelling?) at the front desk was wonderful and so very helpful in addition to the guys that work at the valet desk. You can tell that they really care about their guests, in addition to the hotel. Thank you Lotus for a great stay!

For being in such a prime location, you would think this hotel would have been updated a bit more. It seems a bit worn. I thought the elevator door was going to shut on me as it seemed to be set to "impatient". Used the luggage cart to get my belongings to my room, only to be informed the next day that it was forbidden. My rental car was a small gouge on the door that wasn't there before...Avis was not happy and chalked it up to careless valet.Not the best stay in Waikiki. Had a much better experience on the west side...Hawaiian Hilton Village is a better value in my opinion.

Love the place. It is still close enough to walk to Waikiki as well as get transportation to all part of the island. Next door to fine dining and one property away from the Outrigger Canoe Club. Excellent value.

review_body: After the aggravations of a flight that was delayed multiple times, we arrived on Ohau the morning after our planned Friday afternoon check-in the last weekend of September. Marci and Byron offered aloha greetings which helped dispel our travel weariness, and they also provided useful directions for dining and activities. The location of Lotus Diamond Head worked very well for us. We were able to walk to area restaurants for all of our meals, Waikiki shopping is nearby, Kapiolani Park is across the street and Sans Souci State Regional Park is just up the street (we watched some kind of circus acrobats with glow-in-the-dark hulu hoops). The comfortably sized rooms were clean and well kept. The self-service laundry was convenient. From the moment we checked in to the time we left, the staff was helpful and friendly.

We were very pleased with the staff and quality of the room. We will definitely consider the Lotus for our next vacation. We especially like the location because of closeness to the beach and quiet atmosphere compared to downtown Waikiki.

Close to Waikiki...but not in it...in adjacent neighborhood, walking distance. Older property, well maintained...very friendly staff. Amenity fee well represented. Not great option for restaurant on property. Best rooms are high floors and corner rooms.

I usually don't write reviews but I wanted to make sure to tell everyone about this wonderful hotel! We happened to stumble across it as it was a part of a package that came with flights and we decided to make it a part of our week long Honeymoon. What a great idea it was! One thing to note is that there is a resort fee but it is only $25! This resort fee covers complimentary delicious Aloha Wai waters each time you head out for your day, coffee service from 7am-10am, wine and snacks hours from 4-530pm (if I remember correctly), free valet parking, beach towels, beach chairs, umbrellas, and use of the bicycles which are very convenient as the close by Waikiki shops are a short pedal away. Also as other reviews mentioned there is no pool on property but who needs it when the beach is a short stroll away? It is more of a private beach as well so it wasn't as crowded as other areas, so that was wonderful.Upon checking in we were greeted by nothing but pure friendly service who truly cared about making your stay more pleasant and helping you out. They upgraded us to an ocean view and we had a perfect view of both the beautiful Diamond Head Crater and the ocean down below it truly seemed like straight from a postcard views. When we headed up to the room our luggage and stuff was already there and there was a bottle of sparkling wine with a personalized card waiting for us. The rooms also include a good size balcony where you can really take in the views. I also have to say that this is the first hotel where all the online pictures were very accurate to what we received. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was big with lots of shelving! We will definitely be considering this hotel again for our anniversary trip!

Stayed here in September as part of my Hawai‘i birthday trip. We were hesitant but we found this hotel with a great rate and since we were only staying a few days we decided to give it a shot. We realized after booking that it had no pool so we were a little disappointed. Upon arriving, this hotel exceeded all expectations!! Room was beautiful and very clean and updated!! view was beautiful with two views looking towards the ocean and Diamond Head. Hotel was located close to the beach (2 minute walk?) and they provided towels and chairs. We were also away from all the Waikiki hustle and bustle but close enough to walk if we really wanted to. Such an ideal location, to our surprise! Hotel staff were extremely nice and welcoming. Would DEFINITELY recommend, especially for those not wanting to be in the heart of the city but close enough to enjoy it. If I ever get back to Hawai‘i I’m booking here again!

An excellent value for the price. A 20-minute walk to Waikiki beach, but with access to excellent beaches at San Souci and the Outrigger Canoe Club. Very quiet. Restaurant service at breakfast was very slow.

As soon as you arrive at the Lotus you just know its going to be superb. The quick friendly valet service, the easy check in to the lovely comfy rooms. We stayed on the top floor in a ocean view room with balcony and it was well worth the little extra. Cosy, relaxing and lovely and quiet, away from all the madness that is Waikiki. The hotel has a peace and serenity about it and the smell of vanilla just adds to you unwinding very quickly. When ever we went out everybody said hi and asked how we were and was there anything they could do for us. The car valets work very hard at pleasing you. We also had a lovely breakfast in the restaurant. Its a divine place to stay and trust me you will love it.

The hotel, staff & amenties were wonderful. There are very few dining locations that are close by which is the only drawback. Easy walk to the park, zoo and the beach. Shuttle service which takes guest to downtown and the shopping centre.

All the important things are covered at Lotus. Good bed, nice sized room, quiet area, good friendly staff, free Valet parking. One block from beach and a nice area to walk on path above beach or the adjacent road. It is about 3 blocks from the dense Waikiki beach hotels. Our room had a small view of the ocean and a nice view of Diamondhead.

other than the mattresses being too soft in our room, the property was fantastic and the employees so helpful and pleasant. Well located to enjoy Waikiki but not located in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

The Lotus provides a comfortable, welcoming alternative to the mad bustle of Waikiki. With easy access to parks and beaches and great views of Diamond Head, it is on,y a short walk or bus ride to the action.

First off, my surprise birthday vacation for my mother to Hawaii got off to a terrible start due to a hot, stuffy, moldy and dilapidated condo rental via Airbnb. We left that awful accommodation almost immediately and search for more suitable living spaces. We happily stumbled upon the Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head on HotelTonight (excellent ratings). The Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head was willing to match and beat the price on HotelTonight and allowed us to book directly with them. Marcie, the front desk agent at the time of our arrival, was so sweet, kind and accommodating. She was the reason that we chose this property). We stayed in room 422 for our first night's stay, a room that featured two queen beds, marble bathroom, mini refrigerator and microwave (available upon request if not already in the unit). Rooms were spacious with a great mountain and ocean views from the balconyMuch to our surprise, we were upgraded upon request by the kindness and generosity of the hotel manager, Dean, the following morning to a higher unit on the corner (825) that featured two balconies (one oceanfront, the other mountain, and oceanview). Like Marcie ensured that we chose the Lotus the evening before, Dean ensured that we had no reason to look elsewhere and stay.... and stay we did!All the staff (valet {Travis, Dev and Yure}, maids, front desk personnel {Marcie, JR "William"}, the hotel manager {Dean}, etc.) were extremely down-to-earth, kind, courteous and overall quite helpful. They were indispensable in helping erase the initial terrible experience we had at an Airbnb that almost ruined the surprise Hawaii trip for my mother for her birthday.It is without hesitation and definitely without reservation that I highly recommend the Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head for a smart-upscale, boutique property and a warm, personalized, Aloha! experience.The daily resort fee covers the prompt and courteous valet parking, beach towels, beach chairs, bicycle rentals, as well as the shuttle that takes guests to the main areas in Waikiki.Daily Happy hour between 4:00pm and 6:00pm with red and white wine with bar snacks (like popcorn, pretzels, etc.)Daily Hawaiian coffee and tea in the lobby from 6:00am to 10:00am

This was by far the best place that we have stayed at on Oahu. It’s located on the quieter side of Waikiki, which means less traffic and noise. The staff is all extremely friendly and they have great amenities including coffee and tea in the morning, wine and snacks in the afternoon. You also have bicycles to use, beach chairs and towels, and if you’re in need of some exercise, they have yoga in the park each morning. There is also a free shuttle service that will take you to many locations in Waikiki including the Ala Moana Mall. If you choose to stay at the Lotus, you will not be disappointed.

My husband and I truly loved this hotel! We stayed in Waikiki in the beginning of our trip and ended at the Lotus Honolulu. I loved that it was far away from the hustle and bustle, while Lotus still offered shuttle transportation between their sister hotels, valet parking (free!), and bicycles. The front desk staff and valet were also incredibly friendly. We booked through Orbitz and a couple months ago I changed our beds from two doubles to one king. Turns out Orbitz didn't notify the hotel of this change but Lotus was able to accommodate our requests with no problems. We were still lucky enough to get the same thing we booked - a King bed, Premium with Diamond Head view which was a beautiful stay! I definitely would not hesitate to book another room at Lotus when I come back to Oahu!

Lovely hotel in every way My only criticism is that nobody there knew how to book a shuttle to the port or to Waikele outlets ! I thought this would have been done hundreds of times. Our room was wonderful. Top floor overlooking Diamond Head

Very nice hotel and great location. Friendly and accommodating staff.clean, good location with easy access to the to the beach. Really nice bath amenities. Great location for walkers and runners. And free wine in the lobby every evening!

Our stay was great, we could not have asked for a better room ! the view was wonderful. The tips of where to go and what to see was spot on. We had a fantastic time. We would recommend this place to all our friends traveling to HI.

My husband and I stayed here for 5 total nights during our honeymoon. The staff was very helpful and the price and amenities mix was a great value. The beach is a short walk away and they provide beach towels and beach chairs. The view from our balcony was great. We booked ocean view/premium ocean view room. The location was outside of the bustle and bustle of the city center and the nearby beach was not overly crowded. The water is beautiful. We were initially going to stay at a different hotel for our final night before going home, but we enjoyed our first 4 nights so much, that we canceled our final reservation and rebooked here.

Highly recommended. Great location, great staff and just the right mix of comforts and value. Short walk to beach, great valet service with bikes and beach chairs and a cold drink always ready for us.

Stayed at the Lotus for 4 nights in September and loved it. Away From the hustle and bustle but choose enough to walk to the busy life of Waikiki. Huge room, comfortable bed, excellent balcony/lanai with gorgeous view of both ocean and Diamond Head. Amenities included in resort fee were numerous - Beach towels & chairs, daily newspaper, complimentary happy hour wine in the lobby each afternoon, bikes to go exploring on, even fresh apples by the lift each day for a snack! Staff were wonderful and friendly. Sure, there's no pool, but you only have to walk across the carpark and down a lane (2 minutes at most) and you are on a beautiful private area of Waikiki Beach with the clearest water ever! Would highly recommend the Lotus if you are looking for a relaxing, quiet hotel with everything within walking distance. Thanks Lotus, hopefully will be back one day.

very friendly staff, nice accommodations, outside of Waikiki so Much Quieter and you can avoid traffic. easy valet parking right at the front door. two restaurants walking distance. Coffee in the morning a glass of wine in the afternoon. what more could you want!

Stayed two nights in September at Lotus. Really want to give them a 4 star, but can't. Great location. Far enough from Waikiki madness to be quiet. Across from beautiful park. Great views of Diamond Head from premium room. Balcony nice. As reviewed before, staff super helpful and nice. Beach chairs, umbrella and towels great add. Valet service particularly good. Water as we left everyday. Room had good and bad. 7th floor, great diamond head view. Bright. Good amenities. In room coffee very good. Cons; slow noisy elevator, no internet service/terrible, stained furniture, dirty rug, sticky floors, and old shower. We had stained, smelly pillows when arrived. The next day, I give a plus to housekeeping. Cleaned floor and replaced pillows with fresh ones. Super noisy air conditioning, worked, but so loud hard to sleep. Repeated tries to fix, no luck. This has the potential to be really good. Would consider again, because of location.

The noise of the city center is not here.This hotel is perfect if you want a quiet stay.The correspondence of all the staff is wonderful.A wonderful correspondence of the large lobby and the valet parking The view of the diamond head is all satisfied.We will definitely stay here again.

We booked the hotel on their official website and seems like it offered the best deal. Before proceeding to the final step, we called the hotel and the staff informed us that resort fee which is 25$/night was included in the rate. The hotel did not charge us prior to the arrival so we believed the final cost.However, during the check out process, we realized that the resort fee was added in addition to the rate that was initially presented to us. We stayed 4-5 days so it made about 100$ difference.The website also advertise about benefits of being an A-list member but seems like it was just words. For example, they say we get 100$ credit to the restaurant in the same building and it did not happen. It also says we get daily bottled water to the room and car. Often times, that did not happened.However, the room is spacious and offers small outdoor space. The view for beach and diamond heads were 80% blocked by the trees. The hotel does not have pool, gym or direct access to beach. We drove to the shopping district and it was about 2 miles but finding fee parking was difficult. The worst part of the hotel was stained / molded bathtub window and it was so gross! I did not even want to take pictures. The some portion of the glass door was black and moldy. Plus free wifi was so slow!! I did not ending up using it at all. I used about 2 G of LTE, which I m not really happy about. They really need to working on the faster wifi. The restaurant on the 2nd floor has very loud music and interfere with sound sleep.Overall, I do not recommend this hotel, you can pay similar money by choosing fancier hotels such as Hilton, Westin and Sharaton and have direct access to the beach and shopping. We thought we were saving $$ by staying away from the hot spot location but it was not true.

Recently revamped, situated at the far end of the Park, close to the Outrigger Canoe Club and just below Diamond Head, this boutique hotel is perfect for those who want the beauty and peace of Hawaii on the main island. Close enough to rock the nightlife and shopping, quiet enough to sleep in, listening to waves thru the open doors to your lanai. Upscale and friendly, a wonderful happy hour and really good food. A runners paradise, great attractions within walking distance and a most amiable staff.

It is off to the side from Waikiki so it is quieter and closer to less crowded beaches like Sans Souci or Queens beach. They offer rental bikes (included in the resort fee) and it is great for venturing out towards the busier part of Waikiki or go around the Diamond Head. Also included is the daily morning group yoga session in the adjacent park, which is perfect for starting your day refreshed and in sync with nature. People are nice and and the rooms are clean. The window has a blackout shutter which is helpful if you want to sleep in, but I wish there was also a sheer so I could've still enjoyed the view without feeling too exposed from the surrounding buildings.

Staff are amazing at this property and made our stay very enjoyable. The rooms are adequate and staying here was a welcomed relief relative to the hustle and bustle of busy Waikiki's main drag. Valet parking is efficient, which is great if you need a quick getaway to explore the island or just to duck out for a bite etc.

We decided to stay at the Lotus because of Tripadvisor. It was a great recommendation. It is located in a very quiet area at the end of Waikiki. Small and clean hotel with amazing service. We booked three rooms for five nights and we all enjoyed it. Close to the beach, zoo, aquarium, parks, etc. Great for families.

review_body: We really liked the location, far away from the busiest part of Waikiki, and close to Diamond Head and cool local coffee places across from the park. The personnel were super nice and accommodating, extremely friendly. I also enjoyed the free yoga in the morning, and the happy hour in the afternoon.This is definitely NOT a boutique hotel. The rooms have been re decorated but the interior felt like a tired motel from the 80s. The entrance was hard to find, and very dark.

The staff was just great staff from the manager all the way down to the maintenance staff. They were informative and on top of everything. The room had great view and we loved the location! I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thank you so much, Lotus! I wish you all the best!

Misleading description of the location and view. The facility has been painted a few times and probably slightly updated but is definitely older. The price is much higher than comparable rooms in town with similar amenities, better facilities, and more convenience. The staff was very nice though. They have good people there...

This hotel is in a great location. The hotel staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. We arrived to a free upgraded room! The room was clean with lovely views. The free yoga class is amazing!!! I'd definitely stay here again.

This was our 2nd honeymoon and we're so glad we've picked the lotus .the people were friendly.It was nice to be so close to the beach.Always cleanI would recommend this place to anyone.I would come back again This is my first stay at the hotel and Hopefully not my lastWe ask for places to eat the people there were helpfulI'm planning my next vacation to the lotus

From the moment we arrived at this hotel the lady on reception was amazing and first impressions last a lifetime! This lady upgraded us and sent up a complimentary bottle of bubbles for our honeymoon which was a really nice touch. The room was massive with views of diamond head on one side and the beach on the other side! We ate breakfast and dinner in the one site restaurant whisp and I could not fault the service or the food! We left to go to Maui for a few days and the hotel were very accommodating and held our main luggage for us! The location of the hotel is a bit out of the main area of Waikiki but a short stroll and there are endless amounts of restaurants and shops to choose from!

We stayed 5 nights and would gladly return. Our adult children stayed in Waikiki and our vacation experiences could not have been more different. This is a lovely, quiet location. There are no lobby shops. It is not a resort. Our room had an ocean view and a diamond head view from the balcony. They made it very easy for us to visit the beach by providing chairs and towels and they even had some fins we could borrow to snorkel. They brought our car around quickly and always had fresh cold water bottles for us for our excursions. It was simply an easy, lovely place to stay. We had reciprocal rights to use the Outrigger Canoe Club next door and that makes it perfect, because then we could walk over and spend our day there. We used the hotel bikes to head in to Waikiki which was great, and this location made it very easy to head out to other parts of the island. The staff were wonderful.

if possible book a corner room....back has great view over the park and the front slightly obstructed view of the ocean very friendly staff and free coffee in the morning plus free wine from 4-5-30 a nice bonus

review_body: We have stayed at the Lotus many times and keep coming back for the nice rooms, friendly service and quieter location that is still convenient to Waikiki. It is not oceanfront but does have some nice views and good privacy with a 1 minutes walk to the beach.

Excellent Service - we enjoyed the kindness and Aloha spirit of the entire staff, particularly, Marci and Clarissa as well as Travis. We were always warmly greeted on our way out or back into the hotel. We loved our experience at the Lotus hotel.

Staff was very friendly upon our arrival and departure. The concierge service was above and beyond what I would think any hotel could accommodate. Every time that we left to go anywhere the hotel staff made sure we have bottles of water on hand to make sure we were hydrated. When we told him we were wanting to go to the beach they then handed us towels and chairs, complimentary of course. Everyday at the hotel they had fresh fruit and lemon water for us to drink to make sure that we stayed healthy as well.I also loved the complementary one hour that they had at the hotel which was combined with a few snacks to eat. The view from my hotel room was impeccable. I could see the Diamond Head and I can also see the beach. If I come back here again I will be staying at Lotus of Honolulu.

Talk about service, the employees that work at Lotus hotel make you feel like you're their most important visitor. Views of Waikiki from the open hallway to the rooms and the view from the actual rooms of Diamond head are amazing. I love that we stayed out of the big city feel of Waikiki but close enough to visit easily. The only issue we had was some of the tours don't go down to this hotel but we worked it out (parking at a hotel in Waikiki which wasn't too cheap). There is a wonderful well used park in front of the Lotus Hotel. I also didn't pack as much as I would have normally since this hotel has a small coin operated laundry mat. I would definitely stay here again. WISP restaurant was loud (you could hear it from the lobby) and the wait staff and food was mediocre at best.

We had a wonderful time at Lotus, the friendly staff made the experience complete. The wine happy hour and coffee/tea service was great! We also got a free upgrade to searoom which was really good! We highly recommend this hotel!

Just returned from 10 days at the Lotus. Great hotel at the quiet end of Waikiki. 50 metres to the beach. Lots of extras included daily yoga. Staff were always happy and very helpful. Would definitely return to the Lotus.

I like the location at the quiet end of Waikiki, with great views of Diamond Head and the ocean. The rooms are lovely and spacious, and the the staff - front-desk clerks, housekeepers, valets - all went out of their way to make my stay pleasant and comfortable.

Wow what an experience, from exiting the taxi, we were greeted by friendly staff, the level of professionalism, as well as being able to have a laugh was amazing. The rooms and the view were second to none, no there is no pool but who needs one you are 500 metres from the beach, the restauraunt is nice and a small shop 100 metres from the hotel. There is a $25 boutique fee but that includes a whole heap of free wine and snacks for a 2 hour period in the evening, as well as free DVD rentals and yoga classes etc. I can honestly say I this would be in the top two hotels we have ever stayed at. Thankyou

Marci, Byron, and Carissa ( the staff), went above and beyond to make sure that I have memorable 50th Birthday. And they gave me excellent advice on great places to visit on my island hops. The room was comfortable and the hotel décor was my taste. The view of Diamond Head from my balcony was wonderful. When I l looked to my right I had a partial view of the ocean. In front of the hotel there is a park. The beach is a ten minute walk behind the hotel. The Lotus hotel was Perfect.

Lovely boutique hotel in the quiet part of Oahu across from Diamond Head and a beautiful park. This is a pet friendly hotel, so if you bring your dog(s), the park is convenient for walking your pet. Helpful, friendly staff, clean rooms, pretty grounds. Convenient hotel shuttle, excellent French restaurant next door (Michel's). Close to beach, and not a bad walk to Waikiki.

Love the rooms and atmosphere! Staff is friendly. It is a great hotel just outside the hustle of Waikiki. This was our second stay for a one night get away for my husband's birthday. Couldn't have enjoyed it more.

Perfect for our needs....first time in our almost 50 years of marriage staying in a hotel over $50Our son Morgan had recommended The Lotus......he just thinks we are a couple of "old hippies" as we don't normally ever spend large sums on accomodation....but we loved our stay!!

THE GIST:Does it qualify as a 4-star resort? Absolutely. If you need to be in the middle of chaos, surrounded by shops, restaurants, and people, and you prefer the busy beaches of central Waikiki, then this hotel is not for you. If, however, you like to be ever-so-slightly off the beaten path (about 1/2 to 3/4 mile) and you don't mind the absence of a pool, then read on....LOCATION:The Lotus Honolulu sits next to Diamond Head Crater and the ocean. You are about 3/4 of a mile into the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but it's a seriously easy walk AND the hotel provides bikes. Personally, I welcome the walk back after a meal in Waikiki! Across the street is the Kapiolani Park, a large, well-maintained park ideal for runners, walkers, and dog owners (yes, the hotel allows dogs). Overall, you feel like you're just outside of Waikiki and able to perceive the personality of Hawaii, and yet you're a short walk from the eateries and shops.THE HOTEL AMBIENCE:You won't be greeted here in a grandiose lobby with music and sensory overload; rather, it's a serene, if ever-so-slightly dated, lobby complete with orchids and Buddhist influences. It is inviting and calming. The elevator does need an update, as I felt like I was riding a 1970s lift installed at Disney's Polynesian Resort. This was extremely minor, though.THE ROOM:We were in a "Diamond Head View Premium Room" on the 12th floor (the top), which I highly recommend. Looking out one large window, you see Kapiolani Park with Diamond Head in the background, meaning your view is of nature and not a lot of buildings. Out the other window is a view of the ocean, which is slightly obstructed but you can still see the water quite well (see photos). With gorgeous views out of two walls in your room, it feels very bright, open, and airy. Unlike many hotels, this room is exceptionally large with ample space and storage. It also has a mini-fridge, microwave, espresso maker with ceramic cups, water glasses, wine glasses, ample plugs/outlets that are accessible, a PS3, and an app on the TV that will allow you to use your Netflix account (the wifi, however, could be A LOT better). The bed and pillows were on the softer side, which I like, but may not be for everyone. The AC worked very well and didn't seem to fall into the trap of clicking off via a motion sensor (like some hotels these days). The room has two balconies, but only one of them is large enough for chairs and a table. THE BATHROOM:This is one of the larger bathrooms, again with ample storage, that I've had in a hotel. There is a table along the wall that enables you to store all of your stuff so it's not sitting on the counter. That table could use a paint job but it allows the bathroom to be uncluttered, and, frankly, I'm picky and its need of paint didn't bother me. The bath/shower is a European design, where it's a square shower with raised sides so it can be turned into a bath -- but not an American, rectangular bathtub (see photos). Overall, the bathroom is well maintained, clean, and large. It comes with a full-size hair dryer and a magnifying mirror that is attached to the wall.EXTRAS:Like all hotels in Waikiki, you'll pay a "resort" or "boutique" fee. At this particular hotel, that fee also provides you with free valet parking, which was huge for us, a daily morning yoga class, towels and chairs for the beach, complimentary wine each day from 4-5:30, and free bicycle use, among other things.BEACH ACCESS:You are entitled to use the beach that adjoins the Waikiki Canoe Club. It's a small beach, but it was never very crowded.STAFF:If I could give the staff 10 stars, I would, and that is no exaggeration. From the front desk, to the valet, to the cleaning crew, the attention to detail, thoughtfulness, and helpfulness was superb.FOR THE ACTIVE READERS:I'm a serious runner and found this location to be ideal. The proximity to Kapiolani Park, as well as the $1 entry fee to Diamond Head, allowed me to amass at least 4-5 miles each morning without having to run through the chaotic area of Waikiki, stopping at every light and dodging the masses of people.DRAWBACKS:If you need a pool, there isn't one. The hotel isn't right on the beach like many in Waikiki, but its location -- just slightly off the beach -- affords you the unparalleled views of Diamond Head. The wifi could be A LOT better, and the elevator needs an update.

slightly away from the hustle and bustle of the main Waikiki Beach strip, delightful room, great staff. no pool on site ,but the beach is a very short walk away and they nicely provide beach chairs and towels. They also have BIKES(!) to cruise around town, all included as part of the "resort fee". Honolulu and Waikiki Beach have bike lanes on many of their main roads, so it's easier to get around by bike than it is to drive for many of the local destinations. It's small, 12 floors, only 5 rooms per floor, so the staff remember your name when you come down through the lobby and are always ready to help. best service I've experienced in a hotel in a long time.  Only gripe I could come up with is the resort fee add-on, but couldn't stay mad about it for long when they told me about how the bikes, beach chairs, beach towels, daily happy hour and breakfast were all "included" for the non-optional $25 resort fee. I've paid similar fees at other hotels but don't recall one where I felt like the services supposedly covered by the fee were things I actually wanted and used!

We love this hotel and even though this was our first time staying here with Samata Mag's Adventure Camp we are so glad they selected your place for our accommodations! The staff was great! The view was beautiful and the ambience serene and refreshing!

Quiet location compared to "Waikiki" but ~2/3 mile walk to end of strip and Starbucks along sidewalk or beach walk. Hotel very "zen" like vibe to it with larger than normal, updated rooms. Only one elevator for 11 floors, but never seemed to be a long wait. Staff were all very friendly and went out of their way to make sure everything was convenient and comfortable. From Valet and water bottles, to room service and any necessities. Front desk always greeted you coming and going, and even learned names after a couple days! The location adjacent to the park, on the Gold Coast and off the main strip made this a perfect location for a more quiet and tranquil "Hawaiian" experience.

We loved the Lotus at Diamond Head. We had a room on the 11th, 9th floor. We were situated on a corner with a view to Diamond Head and the ocean. Much quieter than the other end of Waikiki. The staff was helpful and attentive. We liked it so much that we cancelled an already booked hotel to stay here at the end of our trip.

Staying at this property was like staying in old Hawaii - elegant, simple, quiet (compared to the rest of Waikiki). One of the few hotels you can have your dog. Great location with lovely walking right outside your door. Highly recommend!

This is our go-to hotel in Honolulu mostly because of its location across from the Kapiolani Park away from the high rise congestion of central Waikiki. It's location almost next door to the Outrigger Canoe Club is a real plus for us.Walkers will enjoy the ocean front stroll into Waikiki as well as the loop around the Park. Bicycles are available, as well as beach chairs and towels. We like the hotel's boutique feel, the staff's friendliness, free wi-fi and complimentary wine hour. Valet parking is very handy and quick. We have stayed at the hotel about 10 times. Very good value!

Firstly, location is superb. At the bottom of Diamond Head, and, far enough away from Waikiki to be quiet and relatively uncluttered, but well within walking distance( about 15 mins slow walk) to the main selection of hotels and high-end designer shops.Hotel staff are really helpful, and, don't be put off by the entrance via the car park. Amenities include beach chairs, towels, mats and mountain bikes, and, the afternoon (16:00 - 17:30) free wine and nibbles goes down really well!Access to private bay, which is lovely to take your free wine and go sit and watch the canoes, swimmers, and, the sun slowly going down!Take the free bikes and cycle up to the entrance to the Diamond Head Trek - quite an easy ride and good views - places to lock your bike once you get there.Hotel is clean and tidy, and rooms a good size (we had a King room with views of Diamond Head and a slight sea view).Highly recommended.

The location is perfect. It's far enough away from Waikiki for peacefulness of the islands but close enough to walk to shops and restaurants. The shuttle to/from the mall is a plus. The hotel also provides chairs for the beach, wine happy hour, and coffee in the morning. Win, win for all!!

The Lotus is a treasure. Not on the beach but just off it with access to a little private bay. The rooms are nice with views towards the sea or diamond head and Waikiki. The staff are lovely, very friendly and helpful. We are loving it here. I can see why the Lotus has repeat business.

We booked this hotel because we got married at the Elks Lodge in Waikiki knowing that it 's walking distance to our wedding location. From the time we arrived, to the seamless check in, to answering our basic requests with aloha, till checkout the staff there was very hospitable and friendly. Especially the front desk agent Marci. She greeted us and provided the Aloha spirit throughout our stay. She was off on our day of the wedding but the next day she made a point to check on us and talked story with us. As other guests were walking through the lobby she addressed each guest by their name making everyone feel extra special. The rooms are spectacular with the views of Kapiolani Park, Daimond Head and the Pacific Ocean. This is a small boutique and the rooms were clean and modern. The beach is minutes away and they provide beach chairs and towels. Parking is also included in the resort fee which is a plus compared to other hotel in Waikiki. We enjoyed staying here and our friends also stayed here during our wedding and loved the accommodations and friendly staff.

I did a lot of research on where to stay and I don't regret for 1 second staying at Lotus Honolulu. Every employee was kind, considerate, and went out of their way to make us comfortable. The room was perfect. Oh my goodness the bed was so comfy. The front desk managers were extremely considerate and seemed to have everything at the ready that we needed. We loved that it was away from the craziness of Waikiki but close enough to walk there if we chose. The valet parking attendants were awesome. The Happy Hour - wine and crackers every night was wonderful. We would recommend Lotus to anyone traveling to Honolulu.

Found the hotel recommended online, it's not one of the mega hotels along Waikiki, but it's a nicely renovated building a few yards from the water. The rooms were very well appointed, the bed was super comfy, and all the furniture was new and in good shape. The balcony had a nice small table, some comfortable chairs, and a great view. The location is great, a shortish walk to Waikiki Beach and that strip, with easier access to the east side of the island for getting around. I think a real factor to recommend it was the service. Everyone working there, from the valet, to the front desk, to the from service, seemed really happy to be there and pleased to help. If or when we're back on Oa'hu, I wouldn't think twice about spending my money here again.

We spent three nights at the Lotus. The rooms were spacious with spectacular views of Diamond Head. The beach was minutes away. Beach chairs, towels and bikes were available. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would definitely return to this hotel.

We were introduced to The Lotus when we were booked in for a wedding in the Diamond Head area of Honolulu. JR was at the front desk to welcome us with stylish efficiency. Our room had a killer view of Diamond Head and a bit of an ocean view as well. The room was spotless and up to date, the free local paper on the door was welcome as we sipped lobby coffee, or the Illy espresso from our room. Used the free bikes almost every day. Enjoyed a (slow) but tasty breakfast at Wisp, but there are other tasty options nearby. Loved the cold lemon water in the lobby after a days adventures and the wine in the lobby during happy hour. Steps from the beach and they have chairs, towels and mats to borrow. No pool, but...THE PACIFIC OCEAN. Highly recommended. Their resort fee was reasonable ($20/day?) giving access to fast internet, the bikes and more.

quiet spot in Honolulu. located along the street between Kapiolani Park and the Pacific Ocean . so easy to explore the Diamond Head area and very close to downtown without the noise , crowds or overpriced hotel rooms. lovely hotel . incredible value. valet parking included in the $25 daily resort fee was so nice . most hotels are adding another $49 per day for parking . valet was quick , ready with cold bottled waters and gave us towels and beach chairs, also offered beach cruisers to go exploring . morning yoga and afternoon wine was offered daily . rooms were fantastic , great staff , so friendly .

the location is fine at one end of Waikiki beach within walking distance of everything that the beach has to offer. The room and bathroom both were a very good size. A sea view from a nice balcony. All amenities: parking, wifi, coffee machine, slippers, bathrobe, free coffee in lobby at 6pm and free wine and snack 4pm to 5.30. there is a resort fee of 25$ that covers the latter items. The lobby is a bit gloomy but the staff were exceptionally helpful. A very good place to stay.

The Lotus Honolulu is a delightful hotel in a quieter part of Waikiki. The beach is steps away and across the street is Kapiolani Park. We had a lovely premium room which gave us views of Diamond Head and the ocean. The hotel has beach chairs and towels as well as bikes available for guests. They also offer yoga every morning at 7:30 in the park which was a great way to start each day. No need to bring your own mat as the hotel has them for you. Coffee and tea is offered every morning, water throughout the day and wine and cheese in the afternoon. The staff is friendly and always available to answer questions, make recommendations and ensure your stay at the Lotus is an enjoyable one.

Just stayed here for one night (by myself in HNL for just a day) and I chose the Lotus for its reasonable price and location... being fairly close to Waikiki (and still very close to the beach) but not right in the middle of the Waikiki chaos. I was very pleased! Lobby and room were clean and tastefully decorated. Room furnishings were all very satisfactory and views weren't bad either! I would definitely stay here again.

The service was stellar with a beautiful location that was "close but not too close" to the downtown. The only other time I have had service so consistently good was at the Broadmoor. The amenities from the water at the valet to the bikeshare to the beach chairs reduced decision making to appropriate vacation levels.

We originally had reservations at a large chain hotel on Waikiki (due to a cruise line perk) but decided to look around and changed to the Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head because we didn't want all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The hotel is near the beach with Kapiolani Park right across the street. This was just what we were looking for. A short drive/shuttle ride from Waikiki with a very personal/upscale touch for a reasonable price (for Hawaii). The room was very nice with wood floors, a balcony with a doorwall and a second doorwall sized window on the adjoining wall with great views (we were on the corner). There was a very large room safe (about 2 1/2' by 1 1/2'), a desk, a small, cold (unlike many hotels I've been in) refrigerator, iron & ironing board, large flat-screen TV, DVD player (with access to a DVD library), game console, free wifi, free Valet parking, etc. Just look at all the amenities on their website (they're accurate). There is a $25 boutique fee which covers all these amenities but almost every other hotel charges a "Resort Fee" so this is not a big deal. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The property was clean and well maintained. Unlike most hotels, we felt at ease and relaxed as soon as we arrived. I highly recommend this hotel and will look for other properties belonging to this company when we travel in the future.

Great hotel on the Waikiki Gold Coast. Away from the craziness of Waikiki, but close enough if you want a little craziness. We would recommend this hotel to our family and friends. The staff at this hotel are amazing. Friendly, knowledgeable and exhibited the true meaning of Aloha.

This hotel is consistent in it's high quality, friendly staff, and overall experience. They go above an beyond to make our stay comfortable. We'd especially like to thank our valet who always had our car ready with extra water for our morning surf trips. We have stayed here many times and will continue to do so in the future. Mahalo!

We were very happy with our stay here. We had a view of the beach and Diamond Head from our room. The room was very large and very clean. Everything looked new. Teh staff was very helpful and friendly.

Wonderful experience with the very knowledgeable staff and terrific views from the 11th floor room. Valet gentlemen were friendly and prompt. Easy walking to beaches and attractions like aquarium and zoo. Definitely would return to stay again

The view of Diamond Head from the room was spectacular. Room was large and clean. Furnishings were upscale and well maintained. No pool but the small beach was convenient and private. Service at the front desk and valet parking were excellent. We would definitely stay here again.

review_body: In my opinion,the best place to be.Walking distance but just far away enough from The Waikiki madness.Wonderful rooms,great beds,warm efficient staff and a great wine reception make this boutique gem stand out.

Just spent our honeymoon here last week (May 13-20, 2017). Absolutely fabulous! Since we were on our honeymoon, we wanted a more "quiet" hotel, not in downtown with all the hustle and bustle. Lotus is only 1 mile from everything.......walking distance. So if you want quiet at night but able to get to "everything" this is the place! EVERYONE employed here were above outstanding. JR at the front desk was amazing as were the ALL the valets. Oh yea, the valet parking is da bomb!!!! You don't pay additional for it and you pull in and they do the rest. The call you by name and give bottled water when you arrive and leave. Room was perfect (1023), we had the ocean view/mountain view. Views were amazing. Did I mention quiet? I never saw another person on our floor the whole time! Now its not "oceanfront" but there is one building in front of it but not a big deal. The beach is a little small right there but we enjoyed it. All the same beach as Waikiki, just not all the people. Kind of like your own private beach. Hotel is nicely decorated and very clean! Also very safe. They even had a bottle of wine and a lovely note welcoming us! Definitely highly recommend the Lotus! (Only negative....no pool)

Great smaller hotel. Asian-Hawaiian cube. Service was A+ excellent. Staff very friendly and helpful. Amenities galore. Beach bikes, swim towels, robes, beach chairs, laundry, afternoon wine and cheese, morning coffee and all the bottled water you want. Hotel could use painting in spots, but room was clean and well furnished. End of Waikiki Beach but a good location. Had ocean view and great view of diamond Head.

This was our second visit staying at the Lotus Diamond Head, and it had just been remodeled 5 years ago. Requested the same room! Views are wonderful off the small private balcony. Fairly spacious bathroom. Enjoyed the complimentary 4:00 afternoon wine and lite apps. Newspaper delivered each day, along with turn down service/fresh towels at night, bathrobes, and small in room refrig you could actually fit a couple drinks in! Valet parking is convenient-steps away, and the crew make it a point to know where you car is quickly. Staff Carissa , JR, housekeeping, and crew very helpful. Phone reception in room was not always great, but spouse's worked fine. Only one elevator now servicing all floors, which could be easily remedied. It's across the street from Kapiolani Park, and a 10 minute walk to Waikiki. Until our next trip, Mahalo!

My husband and I were traveling to Kauai for a weeks vacation and decided we would spend a couple of nights in Honolulu before catching our flight over to Lihue. There were so many options to choose from and I am very happy that I came across the Lotus. After reading many reviews of this hotel and others I decided to give Lotus a try. First of all anyone that has visited the Waikiki area knows that it is an extremely busy section of town with many people and lots of traffic so I was really happy to find out that the Lotus was on the quieter side of Waikiki. Upon arrival we were greeted by the valet with a nice bottle of cold water and then in a flash we were checked-in, all with a warm welcome and smile. Our room had a great view of the ocean (between two buildings) and a lanai with two chairs and a small table that we used in the afternoons to have the complimentary wine and snacks provided by the hotel. Which was a very nice touch. The rooms were very clean and spacious and best of all quiet. The beach is a very short walk with a nice park across the street. We will be returning here in the future. Thank you to the staff at the Lotus for making our short stay very enjoyable.

This is our first lodging in Oahu and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The room was spacious, clean and tastefully designed, and the cookie and relaxing Hawaiian music playing on the radio that greeted us were a nice touch. We took advantage of their many amenities, including afternoon wine/snacks every day, beach chairs/towels, robes/slippers, complimentary bottled water daily in room and refrigerated water from the Valet as we headed out each day, complimentary bikes (with helmet and locks) to explore the area, close access to a small beach, good wifi, and free DVD rental. We used the in-room Illy Espresso machine every morning and sat on the lanai enjoying the views and colorful birds. Regret not having time to participate in the daily Yoga class. A plus - this hotel charges a single boutique fee that includes Valet parking, as opposed to other area hotels that charge a separate fee for parking. There are good food options within short driving distances (Diamond Head Market and Grill scones for breakfast and lots of good and reasonably priced places for lunch/dinner along Kapahulu Ave, just a few min drive from hotel). We would definitely stay at Lotus again.

This hotel was impeccably clean and well maintained, staff were friendly and helpful and the room spacious and clean. The hotel is close to diamond head and a short 10 min walk from Waikiki centre. The hotelhas a couple of small beaches close by and it offers the use of beach chairs, towels and parasols. The free wine and nibbles is a nice welcoming in the lobby after a busy day sightseeing. Would definitely stay again.

Last night lodging before leaving the paradise of Hawaii. Room had oceanview and view of Diamondhead. Two balconies - one small, the other with chairs and table. Sliding doors opened fully - great airflow. Very comfortable beds, robes and Hawaiian water in the rooms. Wish we had been there longer so we could take advantage of the nightly reception, the bikes and the yoga. There were three negatives: the room's A/C was supposed to shut off if doors open, but it didn't seem to do so, the rug was fraying a bit, and the elevator was a bit creaky, however none of these detracted from the overall stay.Easy walk to the main portion of Waikiki, but far enough away to enjoy the relative quiet.

We really enjoyed our stay. Had a beautiful view of Diamond Head AND the beach. The room was comfortable and clean. Staff made us feel like we were the only guests there. Loved the special touches: coffee in the morning, robes and slippers in the room, morning paper, lemon water in the lobby, reception hour with wine and cheese each evening. Was convenient to Diamond Head, Waikiki Beach, and the airport. The restaurant on the second floor was very convenient. We will be back!

The Staff was really great .Hotel update is nice and has a friendly feel. The location is the best !!! Right in front is a great beach , your out of the waikiki craziness but in walking distance to it.

Incredible Staff, Clean and Friendly, close to everything you'll enjoy doing.Many great perks....AM paper & coffee, PM wine & cheese. Guidance available for any questions or help you might need. Discounted rates in some cases.

I'm sorry to say my stay at the lotus was below my expectations and underwhelming. I had initially been very excited to book and stay at the hotel during my recent visit to Hawaii. The reviews were good and I had booked an oceanfront view room as per the website description. When we reached the hotel I was somewhat surprised - the lobby and entire building was tired and in dire need of renovation and the hotel is NOT an oceanfront property - there are 2 other buildings between the beach and the hotel. The "private" beach near the hotel belongs to a boat club and had speedboats docked, lots of people playing and sunbathing. It wasn't the private beach which we had envisioned at all. The restaurant looked and felt like a throwback from the 70s although the service was nice and our server was friendly. Our room had been advertised as an oceanfront view room - in reality we had a slither of ocean view from between the view of 2 other hotels, and our balcony looked out onto another buildings parking lot. The one saving grace was the room which had obviously been newly renovated and was modern and stylish - and big! The room decor and atmosphere was vastly different from the rest of the hotel. The hotel also had no swimming pool - I understand we are in Hawaii and we prefer the beach, however, we had also been looking forward to lazing around the pool on some afternoons - although in that case I'll take responsibility for not thoroughly making sure the hotel had a pool before we booked it (I assumed it did, most hotels selling at this room rate would most likely have one). At the room rate we paid, we could have stayed at other very luxurious hotels with much newer and more complete facilities. Like I mentioned, the room was the saving grace - and the only reason I didn't decide to move to another hotel for the remainder of our stay ( we stayed for 4 nights). Sadly I cannot wholeheartedly reccommend this property as I feel the overall experience was not worth the price we paid.

Entire experience was perfect - Staff is very attentive, were responsive to every need. Would highly recommend this hotel - very convenient, without being in an area where there is NO parking. Food at the Wisp restaurant was very good.

Really a good hotel.A bit away from Waikiki, but only 5 mn drive.Very clean. Excellent welcoming.Large room.Valet for car parking : all are very professionnal and are friendly welcomers.And of course 50 yards from the beach.

A great little boutique hotel... Perfect for someone wanting stay close to the action but far enough away for a quiet and relaxing stay while in Honolulu. Was very pleased with the hotel staff, nice and professional. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was good and again the staff was great. Beautiful corner room with view of Diamond Head. Highly recommend Lotus and definately would book this property again.

There's a lot to like about the Lotus Honolulu. We've been to Oahu several times and wanted to to try something a little different. Everyone should stay in Waikiki at least once, but it is very crowded and can be a bit overwhelming if you're not from a big city. The Lotus is only a 10-15 minute walk to the center of Waikiki, but it is much quieter and more relaxed. Kapiolani Park is right across the street, and this is about as close as you can get to Diamond Head.The staff at the Lotus are terrific and make you feel very welcome. Parking on site is a breeze, and when we visited they provided free passes to some of the local museums & attractions. The room was a good size with new furniture, flooring and entertainment systems. Overall this place is a very good value and a great way to experience Waikiki.

I am a well traveled Flight attendant and have had such a lovely experience at this hotel.The manager Dean was so kind and so attentive to all our needs while staying there. All of the personnel were gracious and you could tell each of them loved there job. This felt like home. I highly recommend this place especially because of its location and the friendly staff. It is tucked away in a quiet area however it is just steps away from the lively bustle of Waikiki.

Couldn't decide if I should give Lotus 3.5 or 4 stars, so with 3.5 not being an option, I went for 4, due to the level of service and attention to detail...despite it not being "high end luxury." I had several days work in Honolulu, and my group was staying right on the main beach in Waikiki. I decided to stay a few extra days on my own and prefer a quiet, less populated area. Lotus in Diamond Head was the perfect choice.I bit funky, but great value. The room was sort of cluttered, with an ironing board propped against the wall in full view...but it was hard to quibble with this when each room also gets its own little patio/balcony, and kimono robes in the bathrooms. Lotus has its own lovely little private beach, which I used for my daily morning swim, beach towels and chairs provided by the hotel (covered by the $25 daily amenity fee.) Bottled water is offered every time guests arrive and leave, and bicycle rentals are included in the amenity fee (I used one...and encourage you to do the same, for the scenic route to Diamond Head!) Beds are very comfortable, and despite being on a lower floor, the room was quiet.Minuses: no pool or room service. You can order food from the on-site restaurant, which I did, and dine at your private little balcony table under the stars (this is a sort of cumbersome workaround, however.) The facility is a little tired in places, and though it's a one minute walk to the beach, the property is not on the beachfront and being on a lower floor, I had a view of the parking lot. If you're used to 4-5 star luxury, Lotus may not cut it for you. But if you appreciate a quieter, boutique hotel run by very nice people, you're in good hands. Daily wine and cheese happy hour, morning coffee and fresh fruit in the lobby all add to the hospitable vibe of this little gem. I appreciated it's quirkiness and would definitely stay here again, should the opportunity arise.

The hotel is very well situated, fantastic staff, clean and spacious rooms, great service with lots of amenities, including beach chairs, towels and umbrellas, coffee and tea in the lobby as well as in the rooms.Need of upgrade: the beds are old and extremely uncomfortable. Also the air conditioners would need to be displaced as the cold air is directed straight to the beds.

We extended our trip by 2 nights at the last minute and booked here. I WISH we had been booked in here our entire stay. Everything was top notch, location, rooms, personnel, bikes available. We rode towards Diamond Head and up the hill to scenic viewpoints. Plenty of places to lock up your bike and walk down to the beach. It was cool the following day when we hiked up to DH and looked down to the spots we had biked the day before. The shuttle other areas in Waikiki was very helpful and the driver was excellent in his directions once we left the shuttle.Thanks Lotus for a fabulous head start to our vacation.

review_body: Stayed here with my wife for our 30th Wedding Anniversary. It's a Class act hotel located in a quiet neighborhood with great views of Diamond Head, only footsteps from the Waikiki Aquarium & Zoo, about 1-1/2 miles to the center of Waikiki. Beach is about a 2 minute walk. Hotel offers bicycles, beach chairs and towels as well as bottled water whenever wanted, also coffee in the morning. The staff was always friendly and upbeat. There is a restaurant that is located on the 2nd floor, great for dinner or Happy Hour. If you run out of any sundry, there is a small Convience store located next door. Have already discussed with my wife and have decided this will be our Go To Oahu Hotel. Mahalo to the staff for making our return to Oahu great.

Lovely hotel, great staff and great part of town. quiet and easy to access at any time. We chose a premier room with 2 view aspects. Valet service for the car was terrific and the beach is a short 2 minute walk. Concierge was very helpful with chairs, towels and cold water to drink at all times.

We were in Honolulu for my cousin's wedding and decided to stay here for a couple of nights. I had not visited Oahu before, but I knew that we did not want to be in the middle of Waikiki, and the Lotus worked well for us. It was relatively peaceful. It had access to a couple of small beaches. There are a couple of restaurants nearby with more dining and shopping about one-half mile away. The staff was friendly and very helpful. There is no pool or lots of amenities, but it was good for what we wanted: a nice quiet and comfortable stay.

This is an awesome little botique hotel located toward the end of Waikiki. It is close to everything but secluded enough to bring a little peace and quite to your vacation. The staff is amazing and will make you feel like a VIP. Would go back in a minute.

Located on the "Gold Coast" of Waikiki this hotel is a 1 min walk to a beautiful private beach. The staff at Lotus are experts of customer service. From the valet, houskeeper, maintenance personnel, to front desk receptionist; all were professional, and courteous. The staff quickly learn your name and preferences and catered to your every need. The Hotel is very nice, with comfortable rooms. Most rooms have a ocean view on the right with Diamond Head on the left. This end of Waikiki is very quiet compared to the madness in town. The hotel features inclusive valet parking, free bike rentals, beach gear, in-room espresso machines, refrigerator, free DVD rentals, comfortable beds, and great location.

Friendly and helpful staff. From valet parking to front desk to maid service, everyone was cheerful and helpful. The room I had on the 9th floor was spacious and nicely appointed, but best of all was the small lanai with a great view of Diamond Head and a partial view of the ocean. I saw whales from the lanai. Can't beat that!

We stayed here for one night as we had a flight cancellation and needed a last minute booking. The customer service was excellent. Everyone we came across was kind and welcoming. Wine and cheese was provided in the afternoon and coffee in the morning which we thought was nice. The beach by the hotel is a small private area but we didn't spend time there, we thought the other beaches in the island were much better. The elevator was a little sketchy as it shakes before it opens up and after it lands. The room was clean, well decorated, comfortable bed. Nice kimono robes were provided during our stay. We did rent a DVD as it was part of the boutique fee so we thought we should use our money's worth. Thanks!

My wife and I stayed at the Lotus for 9 days in February while visiting Honolulu on business. We chose this hotel because it seemed to be in a quieter area but still within walking distance of everything in Waikiki. We stayed on the 4th floor, which was just high enough to get a glimpse of the ocean from our balcony as well as a nice view of Diamondhead. The room was very comfortable (especially the bed!) and we really appreciated the use of the in-room illy Espresso machine. Nothing like waking up with an espresso on the balcony every morning with the sounds of the ocean and the birds in nearby Kapiolani Park.All of the front desk and valet employees we met throughout with were very helpful and friendly. The staff seemed small enough that we became very familiar with most of the staff by the end of our stay. They made us very much feel at home at their hotel! The resort has a mandatory 25$ a night boutique fee, which covers your parking as well as other perks including: beach chair and towel rentals, bike rentals (locks and helmets included), morning Yoga classes, and a 4-5:30 wine happy hour with light snacks (at no extra cost). Friends we were staying with made use of the valet parking, which was always very fast, and my wife tried to attend the Yoga classes every morning, which she very much enjoyed. We enjoyed coming home in the afternoon to a glass of wine (which you are free to take back to your room). The closest restaurants to the Hotel are along Monsarrat Ave (you can easily cut across the park for a ~15 minute walk), otherwise there is a decent little beach cafe (Barefoot Beach Cafe) just a couple blocks North along Kalakau. If you don't want to walk or would like to venture a little further, you can borrow a bike (lock included) and easily be anywhere in Waikiki in 15 minutes or less. There is a decent bike trail system in the area if you are wary of riding in traffic. Lotus is also part of the AQUA hotel line and offers a free shuttle that comes around every 30 minutes from ~9am to 8pm and travels between the Lotus and the Ala Moana shopping center. This was especially handy for me, given I was attending a conference at the Hawaii Convention Center, and the driver was very helpful, even offering to drop us off closer to our destination. We only ate once at the hotel restaurant, and though I found the food to be good, the atmosphere was not very relaxing and we felt a bit out of place. They had a dance floor set up right next to the bar with live "Oldies" music being preformed. This may be attractive to the retired vacationing crowd (of which I acknowledge probably makes up a large amount of the hotel's clientele), but we did not enjoy it. Kind of felt like we were attending a stranger's wedding reception. We would definitely love to stay at the Lotus again if we are lucky enough to find ourselves in Honolulu again and we'd like to extend our sincere thanks to all the staff who helped us out and made us feel welcome during our visit.
