review_body: I have family that lives in the Diamond Head area so I first picked this hotel due to its location. Now I would recommend this small boutique hotel to anyone interested in Waikiki. You are only steps away from all the action, but when your day is over you can return to tranquility. While the hotel rooms are very nice and the views from the lanais are pretty spectacular, I think the best feature is the staff. They are all so attentive and friendly and helpful. I have now stayed three times and each time I am very happy to return to a place that feels like home (or better).

Nice property! Away from the chaos of the main strip in Waikiki but close enough if you want to be near the action. About 15 min walk to main strip. The is also a free shuttle that runs between their different properties. Smaller hotel compared to other properties nearby. All of the staff were very helpful and knowledgeable of the area. Free parking(in resort fee), bikes, beach chairs, umbrellas, and wine in the evening.

The Lotus Hotel has very comfortable rooms with excellent views of Diamond Head and the ocean. The hotel is far enough away from all the noise of the downtown hustle but close enough to walk there. The beds are extremely comfortable. Hardwood floors along with a rug that makes the room very comfortable. There is a night time turn down service.

Having previously stayed in the main tourist part of Waikiki, on this trip we opted for the quiet Diamond Head end of the beach. The Lotus was a fabulous find and we were not disappointed. The small hotel feel was just what we were looking for after, being on a cruise with 2000 plus others. The wine each afternoon was of good standard, and we loved the coffee machine in the room and the fact that on request for more coffee pods, we were given more the next day. The free DVD's were an unexpected bonus and the ability to purchase continental style breakfast items meant we did not need to go back and forth to the ABC shop. The room itself was very roomy and comfortable and we enjoyed the breeze we picked up on the balcony where we had breakfast and enjoyed our wine. The small convenience shop outside the hotel next door was useful and while we did do the walk into the main tourist area for dinner twice, we mostly opted for the beach kiosk in Queen Kapiolani Park enjoying the casual outside seating and live music watching the sunset. Magic. We will definitely return and highly recommend for travellers who want a quiet environment and enjoy park surrounds and do not have to be in the overpopulated downtown area. Thank you Lotus for a memorable stay.

It was the staff actions that differentiated this hotel. The valet guys, for example, are way more than "car parkers". They help get you out the door, and in our case when they heard where we were going or what we had planned they would jump ahead and say things like "Oh, you're hiking on that trail today? It poured yesterday, let me throw some towels in the trunk for your likely muddy shoes/sandals." The towels were Key. One of the front desk staff heard me coming back downstairs after I left something in my room and they crossed the lobby to hand me my other stuff and save me the walk. ("I heard you coming..."). It wasn't just that the employees were cordial; it seemed like they were thinking ahead to get you things or info that you'd likely need.

Great gem. Used to be W-hotel. Great views, past the Aquarium and ZOO, away from noisy Waikiki. We got upgraded to a penthouse on the top floor. We could basically run around the whole floor, two bedrooms. Very outdated, super nice staff.

review_body: Nice and quite hotel away from the hustle of downtown Waikiki. Rooms were very clean and comfortable, staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed on the 9th floor and had wonderful views of Diamond Head and the ocean. Great value too! The only downside is no restaurant in the hotel but there are a few within walking distance and shuttle service and uber/taxi rides are reasonable.

This is really cute boutique hotel at the end of the Diamond Head row of hotels. We had a corner room Oceanview 10th floor room. While not actually on the water, the views of the ocean and Diamond Head were beautiful. Comfortable beds, attractive room with patio, mini fridge, free bottled water, free wine and pretzels in the afternoon, free apples everyday at the lobby elevator, wonderful friendly helpful staff. They couldn't have been any nicer or more helpful. Free continental breakfast in the morning, but no protein except for lox and hard boiled eggs for sale, so one star off for that and no working restaurant on site (heard restaurant to reopen later this year), and no pool... They do have a free shuttle to other Aqua Hotels in Waikiki area for shopping, sightseeing, eateries- get a map of pick up spots so you can wander Waikiki and then back free to this quiet refuge. Taxi should be $35 or so from airpirt, about $10 back to hotel from Waikiki. Loved being down at this quiet end of Waikiki...2 miles away. A short walk through front parking area and you are at a gorgeous quiet beach with a beautiful park across the street and next door. They have beach chairs and bikes to borrow and beach towels at lobby for water fun. Closest restaurant is in the New Otani Hotel next door- heard it is the best breakfast in town, but make a reservation. The Outrigger Club and Elks Lodge are just down the street, but are private. Also a small market next door on the street at New Otani with good prices and everything you could possibly need. Catch the city beach bus a few steps down in front of Elks Lodge for the 20 minute ride to Hanauma Bay for amazing snorkeling. $2.50 each way...go early if driving...lot closes up when it is full in the morning...or go in the afternoon. $7.50 to get in. Crowded but worth it. Waikiki is not my idea of a Hawaii vacation. I accompanied a friend. It is very busy and crowded - like going to downtown LA for vaca, but millions of stores and eateries. For me The Lotus was a wonderful place at the quiet end. I highly recommend it. Photos are our view from balcony.

Awesome attention to detail from the lux Paul Mitchell toiletries in the room to the free yoga and water waiting for us in our car from the included valet parking. Breakfast was great and they helped us pack it to go so that we could meet our early morning reservations. Kind, considerate, clean and unique, we would definitely stay here again.

The room was lovely and very clean. The staff was great and gave us anything we needed, from extra room towels to beach chairs and towels! The only downside was the cost of food. You only get free tea and coffee, and have to pay for everything else!

We loved the location of the hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Because it is at the quiet end of Waikiki Beach it was very peaceful. It was also super easy to get to Diamond Head where we wanted to hike.

I rarely write reviews. Only in the most extreme circumstances will I sit down to draft something (usually if my experience was quite poor or, as in this case, simply wonderful). The Lotus is a boutique hotel about a ten or fifteen minute walk outside of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. So, if you like to be in the center of it all, you may find this hotel a bit quiet (and it hasn't got a pool, if that's important to you). However, if you prefer a more tranquil setting across from Kapiolani Park (perhaps the nicest park in Honolulu), this is a lovely hotel. The best aspect of the hotel, beyond the tranquil setting, is actually the staff. To a person they were extraordinarily kind and thoughtful. From the people at the front desk, to the valet guys helping with the cars and bikes (yes, they offer mountain bikes for guest use, along with nice quality beach chairs and beach towels, and bottled water as you head out for the day), to the restaurant staff and the maid service, and let's not forget the really nice yoga instructors who offer yoga in the park every morning) everyone was professional, patient and attentive. I must say that the entire staff at this hotel may be the best that I've experienced in all of my years of travel, both domestic and international. It may sound strange to say this, but returning to the hotel each day almost felt like going home in the sense that everyone at the hotel made my wife and me feel so comfortable and welcome. I strongly urge the hotel ownership and management to take very good care of the hotel staff. Their professionalism and attentiveness is what sets this hotel apart from your competition.I used to live on Oahu for many years and now live in California (the Bay Area). However, I visit Oahu fairly often each year due to work (my company is headquartered on Oahu) and to visit friends who still live there; and when my wife and I are not actually staying with our friends, the Lotus hotel will be our hotel of choice whenever we are on Oahu. I cannot recommend the Lotus hotel more highly. An easy 5 stars.

Friendly and efficient front desk. A glass of wine at check in was very welcome after a long rushed day. A Great corner room with an awesome view. Clean and attractive room. We like that it's not in the center of Waikiki. For our next staycation, We will book here again!

I have stayed at this boutique property on several occasions. It is a tranquil setting within walking distance to the vibe of Waikiki Beach. Located next to a large urban park, and a short stroll to an beautiful beach, makes it ideal. Outstanding service and staff where everything has a personal touch.The premium ocean view befits the name, and worth the extra.

Our one night in Honolulu (after a week in Maui) was for an event at the Aquarium, which is a very quick walk from the hotel. It's a a good value, compared to other Waikiki hotels. It's quiet and pristine and has a bit of a zen-like feel. In fact, they offer regular yoga classes. It is off the beaten track, however, and restaurants are a bit of a hike. The breakfast was not very appealing and there is no dining room for other meals. I also couldn't quite figure out how one gets to the beach, but I'm sure that it's not an issue as the water is close-by, and they offer beach towels. I'm not sure we'll stay there again unless, once again, we have an event at the Aquarium. We had trouble with the wifi, but without asking, they refunded the charge for it.

Booked this hotel via Expedia based on the great reviews and location and I'm so glad I did! It was both our first trip to Oahu as we were celebrating our 10 yr. Anniversary. They gave us a room with a SPECTACULAR view of both Diamond head from our patio and upon opening the front door it was an amazing view of Waikiki. The customer service was FANTASTIC. From check-in to check-out and everything in between! Travis (valet) has excellent recommendations of where to eat, places to check out, activities to do he never disappointed! A nice surprise was the bottle of champagne they provided my husband and I upon arrival to our room. So thoughtful!They provide beach chairs, beach towels, cold waters whenever you leave the hotel and a private beach is literally steps away! They also have happy hour from 4-6pm every night near the check-in counter. There's even a complimentary shuttle to take your around Waikiki and to the main Ala Moana shopping mall. It's away from the crowds of Waikiki, but close enough you don't feel like you're missing out on anything. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, don't think twice! A HUGE Mahalo to the staff at Lotus Hotel, you made our week unforgettable! We hope to see you again soon! :)

This was our second visit to the Lotus, and after a hiatus of three years it remains an excellent choice for those who want elegant accommodations but not the mobs of tour groups and screaming kids that overrun most Waikiki hotels. The hotel is small, only around 100 rooms, all beautifully furnished and equipped. Mini-fridges and Illy espresso/coffee machines, marble bathrooms, and nice lanais with views of Diamond Head and the Pacific. The Lotus is around ten minute or so walk south of the main Waikiki area, across from Queen Kapiolani Park. Seriously underpopulated Sans Souci Beach is just a few steps away, and the aquarium and zoo are easy walks. And the staff on both trips was warm, welcoming, and way beyond expectations in their helpfulness. The hotel does not have a full service restaurant, but it does offer continental breakfasts and complimentary beverages in its second floor dining room, as well as complimentary wine in the evening. There are several excellent restaurants an easy walk nearby, and of course myriads in central Waikiki. There is also a very nice open air cafe about five minutes up the beach, which is both excellent and very reasonably priced for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and affords a lovely al fresco setting by the ocean. The only potential drawback is that if you are too limited in mobility to get to and from central Waikiki (assuming you want to) on foot, you will need to either hop the hotel's periodic (free) shuttle or a city bus to get there and back, or rent a car. There is no charge for valet parking, by the way.

Third time I have stayed at the Lotus. The location is great. The rooms are nice a size and well decorated. I love the staff they are helpful and friendly. Great view of the water, mountain and park from the room.

We opted to stay at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki in the knowledge that it would be quieter and more peaceful than in the 'heart' of the resort. The Lotus Hotel proved ideal for us. We had a fantastic room on the 11th floor which had wonderful views towards Diamond Head and glimpses of the ocean too in other directions. The room was spacious, very clean and very quiet. The staff were courteous and helpful at all times. Great location, close to beaches for swimming and snorkelling. There was a small shop close by which sold just about everything! We enjoyed the 20 minute walk into the centre of Waikiki. The hotel is near a bus stop although the bus service was not that frequent. Enjoyed this hotel so much that we hope to return!

Loved it here. Staff is FABULOUS. I can't say enough about them. I have to give a little shout out to Sebastian. He was the best! Although as I said, everyone made you feel special. Accommodations were clean and comfortable and it's really nice to be outside of the bustle of Waikiki. Loved every minute. Thank you to everyone at the Lotus!

We came to Hawaii for a cruise April 2016. The cruise would take us to the other islands but we wanted a little extra time on Ohau because of its history and all there is to see. Ohau is the heart of Hawaii.I chose the Lotus from the reviews on Trip Advisor and they we're not wrong. For price, location and a really great staff, what a find it is. It's a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach but its away from the congestion of it. For us it was perfect fit.I would highly recommend it if you want a little slower pace than crowed Waikiki area but want to be close by it or in it when you want.It's in a smaller hotel and condo area, very quiet..Not directly on the ocean it shares a private beach with the access a 1/4 of a block walk across the back parking lot.

The Lotus is a gem of a hotel hidden away in a quiet part of W Honolulu near diamond head. It's two doors down from the Outrigger Canoe Club, close to the beach and across from Kapiolani park. The rooms are clean and modern (although it's an older building) and the staff was cheerful and helpful. There are free bike rentals and free beach chairs as well free wifi and a free DVD kiosk in the business center. Room service is provided by a kind of Honolulu Waiters-on-wheels that can get you food from 27 restaurants. A very pleasant place to stay if you're looking for more of the romantic/quiet get away with a run in the park rather than the hubbub of Waikiki.

My mom & I stayed here in February after several days on business downtown. We picked this hotel simply because they accentuated the relaxing environment we were looking for on their website. We got exactly what we were looking for & much more! Complimentary lemon water was always available. Beach chairs & fluffy towels right at the desk. Free wine in the evenings. GREAT GREAT GREAT staff!!! (Their names escape me, but the valets were nothing short of top notch!! One of them even gave me a soda so I didn't have to walk to the store!) Our room was spectacular & the view was even more so! We could see Diamond Head AND the ocean every day. We slept very well & even kept our lanai door open so we could wake up to the view! After our hectic work week, the Lotus met our need to relax 110%! If you are looking for a quiet place, away from the hustle & bustle of Waikiki, THIS IS IT!! Thank you to everyone at the Lotus for such a wonderful visit!!!

Have stayed there now 3 times in the span of 2 months. The location is good - off the beaten path from Waikiki. Value is very good for what you get. Very clean and nicely appointed rooms (modern decor). The staff is wonderful and were very attentive and polite. The hotel is not directly on the beach but very easy walking to it. We never ate at the hotel but its easy walking or biking to a number of restaurants near the hotel. We liked it for the fact that it was easy to get in and out of the Waikiki area and the proximity to the KCC farmers market which is wonderful. Our family only wishes it had a pool which would have make it perfect.

Loved the staff, room, attention to guests. The location is right near Kaimana beach...a place I hold very dear to my heart:) we will definitely be back for another trip soon. Don't miss out on this property!

I live on a neighbor island and stay here whenever we come to Oahu to visit friends or doctors. Has the best location in Honolulu, second to none. Rooms are nice, comfortable, and quiet and catch the beautiful easterly Trade Winds we get in Hawaii. Staff is courteous and highly competent. I just hope this hotel doesn't get so popular that I won't easily be able to book a room

My husband and I stayed at the Lotus Honolulu for 5 nights in March. We had a wonderful time. This hotel was perfect for our stay. Close proximity to the beach, park, zoo and aquarium. It is not near the main strip, but we didn't mind the short walk back to the hotel as there is a lot of activity going on in the area. I can't say enough about the staff as they were so friendly and helpful.. We travel often and this is the best hospitality we have ever received from hotel staff. Everyone from the front desk, to the valets and room attendants were awesome! The valets were so helpful with directions and local information. I would definitely stay here again if I had the chance. Loved the view of Diamond Head and the ocean. We also enjoyed the beach chairs, bicycles and evening wine service that was provided by the hotel. The only improvement that could be made is to open the restaurant that is on site, because you have to leave the property of you want a meal. However, I do think it was very nice of them to have pastry available for a quick bite. No complaints about this hotel, we were very pleased. Mahalo to the staff and if I'm lucky we will have the opportunity to visit again.

We were in Honolulu for 3 nights. Primarily for the Pearl Harbor memorial tours. Hotel is very clean, attentive staff and excellent location. Area is very quiet, good access to beaches and parks. The only drawback was the continental breakfast...disappointed in quality and variety of offering. Best to plan breakfast somewhere else!

Perfection! The Lotus Honolulu is just as advertised. Our room was beautifully decorated and had a million dollar view. The staff is very friendly. Eric and Devini served us breakfast in the second floor dining area. They are so friendly. Robert is the evening shift valet and is incredibly friendly and helpful, and pointed us to some great restaurants. We didn't catch the daytime valet's name but he is also super nice, as are the front desk staff. The Lotus is a short walk to the main Waikiki beach/dining/shopping area. It is an even shorter walk to the nearby beaches. It must have been off season as the the hotel seemed quiet, which was a plus for us. There is a nearby convenience store two doors down the block where we picked up snacks and water bottles for the day's outing. We will definitely return to this hotel, hopefully soon!

Loved the view from our room, Travis the vallet was so awesome at making us feel at home! They offer you water every time you leave or you can ask also. Room was perfect for us, only thing is they need to clean behind the beds. Other then that we were totally in love with this hotel. Newspaper every morning and super friendly staff!

A jewel of a boutique hotel-nestled in at the far end of Waikiki Beach. Wonderful service, easy parking(included in resort fee), well-appointed rooms. Easy access to beach and the activities of Waikiki. And one of the best dining experiences we've ever had right next door at Michel's!

Lovely small quiet hotel on East end of Waikiki. Hotel is not on the beach however, but set back a ways. Beautiful views of Diamond Head from room patio.Very clean. Wonderful staff. We would definitely return to this hotel.

We spent our honeymoon at the Lotus, it was wonderful! Everyone that worked there always had a smile on their faces and were very helpful in suggesting places to visit and eat. It was very quiet and peaceful, and had a great view of Diamondhead. We will definitely be suggesting the Lotus to friends and family that will be visiting Oahu but don't want to deal with the craziness of Waikiki.

It's off of the main drag in Waikiki over by Kapiolani Park, so it's a little bit further from some of the restaurants and shops, but I view this as a good thing. It's much less congested with tourists and therefore more relaxing. Rooms are clean and modern. We chose it based on the parking situation. Every other hotel in Waikiki charges upwards of $35 in addition to numerous other bogus fees, but the Lotus included parking in their "resort fee." Staff was helpful. You can get bottles of water from the valet when you're heading out, and they will also provide you with beach chairs and towels if you desire them. I would have sworn that I read breakfast was included, but when we went down in the morning, a tiny muffin was priced over $4, so we went elsewhere. Overall a good value for the area. It's smaller than its massive Waikiki neighbors, and it allows the place to feel more like home.

We wanted to visit relatives on Oahu during part of our honeymoon, but were NOT looking forward to staying nearby in busy, hot, hectic, pricey, loud, touristy, ugly (come on, be honest) Waikiki proper. But as the very kind, professional staff (and my relatives) pointed out, Lotus is not on Waikiki. Rather, it's a mile or more east at the foot of Diamond Head (Leahi), right across the street from the lovely, quiet greenery of Kapiolani Park (itself another 5 star entity). The difference between the Waikiki main drag and the Lotus/Kapiolani Park/Outrigger area is huge--don't mistake one for the other. Lotus, both as a hotel and a location, is like a lovely, green, quiet zen garden, an oasis, a retreat, a safe place with its own lovely little beaches out front. While there are several other tower blocks adjacent to Lotus, the group are all set clearly away from the skyscraper logjam of Waikiki (exception: late night ocean view dining is a Waikiki specialty, so don't miss out). The other reviews here did not mislead or disappoint: Lotus is very clean, quiet and has lovely Asian-Pacific decor in all rooms and lobbies; Room had a superb large bathroom, comfy lanai (balcony), decent free WiFi and perhaps the best hotel mattress I've ever encountered. Free afternoon wine in the lobby? Yup. Complimentary beach gear for all? Check. Warm, engaging staff, who were equally helpful to my family guests? Absolutely. We did not use the valet parking but my relatives did and were greeted with kindness and ice cold bottled water. I even want to put in a good word for that highly addictive in-room espresso machine with its cute little ceramic cups (why yes, Lotus expects adults to be able to use real glassware). Now, many hotels can match such amenities, but Lotus has something others lack: it actually felt warm, welcoming, like coming home, not just resort or chain hotel fakery--the staff are true locals, act like family and proud of their aloha oasis. If I had to say anything negative, Lotus does not have a pool (the beach is way better) and not really a kid-oriented hotel (unless your kids are zen masters), but to each his own. After this experience, I would not stay anywhere else on Oahu and hope Lotus keeps up to their high standards.

Nice, clean and good for the price. $25 is charged daily which included parking, WiFi etc . Some hotel charge up to $50/day ($35 parking, $15 resort fee). We got upgrade to a corner unit with two balcony. Free wine upon arrival. Daily supply of big bottles water in room and small bottles when you go out or pick up your car. Very quite surrounding. 10-15 minutes walk to all downtown shopping

Really surprised at quality of rooms and staff. This is obviously a class operation. Complimentary bikes are a great thought. Well located at the foot of Diamond Head. Pity my stay was so brief. I would definitely recommend this hotel.The only drawback was a leaf blower (?) outside very early in the morning

From reception to room service, every staff at the hotel was extreme friendly. The hotel room was spacious and modern. Hotel offers a range of complimentary services (free breakfast/free wine between 4-6pm/free bottled water on demand). The gave us a bottle of champagne for free for my mum's birthday. We will definitely go back.

Front Desk agent who checked us in was very friendly and made us feel at home. As soon as I walked into my room, the amenities and views were breathtaking. I love the fact it was quiet and away from the busy side of Waikiki beach.

The Lotus was great. Loved the bicycles, the cleaning staff, the good guys who worked the bell desk, and the little extras like fruit water. My internet didn't work well, but the manager was very responsive and apparently that is being addressed. I'd totally stay there again. One other tiny thing: don't block the view of the ocean with a TV or a big piece of furniture! Otherwise, great part of town, great hotel.

Just returned from our annual trip to Honolulu and stayed at the Lotus. It's been a year since last time (have stayed there 4 times) and it was still an excellent hotel. Loved the very end of the public beach right off the park near the Lotus. Very gentle waters for swimming. Lotus staff is a collection of wonderfully hard working people. It's a nice walk to Waikiki but you are far enough away from the crowds at Waikiki. We'll be back.

From start to finish, we were very happy with our experience at the Lotus Honolulu.We were greeted warmly at check-in by Jonysius, who gave us a good overview of the hotel. The entire staff was pleasant. The hotel was convenient to everything - not far off the interstate. Nice views of the park and Waikiki - and of course Diamond Head.Our room was comfortable and well appointed.While we were well aware that there was no breakfast provided, I was still a little disappointed by the limited continental breakfast offering there. For a few bucks extra they could have put out a nicer spread that would allow people to grab something before venturing out. That is my only dissatisfaction.

We loved staying outside of downtown. It was very quiet and relaxing. There is no pool but you have access to the ocean behind you. The rooms were very nice - hardwood floors and large sliding glass doors to a good size balcony.

Following a busy family visit, my husband and I spent our last night in Honolulu at Lotus Honolulu. Intrigued by the descriptions on the website, and having spent many hotel nights over the years in Waikiki, we were anxious to experience the "zen"-like ambiance suggested in reviews. We were not disappointed!! From the warm welcome by the concierge, to the alohas from the front desk at check out, we had a relaxing time to regroup and enjoy the beach before heading home.The hotel's location is superb! Only blocks from the crowds of Waikiki, the hotel is somewhat secluded and protected from traffic with the park on one side and the beach on the other. Our unobstructed Diamond Head view was spectacular. The proximity to an uncrowded, safe beach was beyond expectation. The beach was very safe and we were comfortable taking our 2 young grandchildren for some late in the day water time.Our room was spacious, exceptionally clean, modern yet tastefully Polynesian in decor. Upon first glance we automatically sighed in relaxation and appreciation.We loved our experience and the staff at Lotus Honolulu, especially the concierge. Had the breakfast service not run out of most items by 9:00 I would have given this property 5*. We will return!!!

This is our third stay here. The staff makes you feel like family and the views, private beach, complimentary happy hour, morning yoga, and bicycles and spotless and spacious rooms are what hotels should be. The neighborhood is old Hawaii yet a short walk from downtown. One of our favorite hotels!

i choose the Lotus because it is quiet, friendly, close but not too close to the madness of waikiki, and its nice well appointed rooms. the staff in many cases have been the same on all 4 of my visits and their consistent quality of service keep me coming back.my only complaint is that although the hotel doesn't have that many rooms, there is only one elevator and sometimes (not very often) there is a wait. also, there used to be a full service restaurant on the second level and it would be nice if that sort of service returned. currently only a limited menu light breakfast is offered - coffee, tea, cereal, muffins, fruit, etc.

review_body: This was the hubby and i s first time in Hawaii. We got a ocean facing room - great views of diamond head and the water. They have morning yoga on some days and daily wine hour. Which can't be beat! The staff is super nice, there's always a bottle of water for the room. There's morning coffee on the second floor. We highly recommend it. The only downside to this place is that it's far from Waikiki beach. A good 15/20 minute walk to all of the action, but it's super quiet. We didn't have any noise issues. It's one of the trade offs. Our week long trip there was awesome and the relaxing stay was worth it. We traveled with a 8 month old baby And there wasn't issues.

review_body: My sister and I flew to Hawaii to surprise our brother for his 50th birthday and we needed a place to stay for a few days before the big event. We stayed at this property in December 2015, and we had a great experience. The hotel is a small boutique hotel at the quiet end of Kalakaua Avenue, and only a short, 15 minute walk to the action, on the way to Waikiki Beach. Being at the base of Diamond Head, our room had a great view of the beautiful landmark to one side, and a view of the beach on the other side. The staff was friendly and helpful, and our room was comfortable, clean, and nicely decorated. There is a daily resort fee, which was $25 when we stayed, and it included valet parking and complimentary beach chairs. We were offered bottled water to take along each time we ventured out, and that was a nice touch. The property is not right on the beach, but just a short stroll away is a private beach for hotel guests to share with adjacent properties. Towels and beach chairs can be picked up at the front desk, and they are first-come-first-served. Ask for the beach chairs with backpack straps - they're easier to carry. The beach was very nice, and not crowded at all when we went.The Honolulu Marathon took place on Sunday December 13, and we were right by the Finish Line. We were able to see the runners and cheer them on as they came by the hotel. If you happen to be in town for the Marathon, this is an ideal place to stay!If you're Catholic, St. Augustine By The Sea Catholic Church is less than a mile away. It's a nice walk, and you can stop for breakfast or brunch afterwards.I would not recommend this hotel for children, as there isn't much to interest young kids. Maybe late teens would do ok, but I think this hotel caters more to adults. I would stay here again and again and again!

We stayed for one night. staycation deal. the rooms were big and clean. great view of diamond head. they had free wine in the lobby. good kamaina rates. on the outskirts of the hustle and bustle of waikiki means its very quiet, but still close enough to enjoy the wining and dining of waikiki. really enjoyed our stay.

Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head was conveniently located in between Waikiki beach and Diamond Head National Park. The hotel had bikes, beach towels, and beach umbrellas that you could use (part of the "boutique fee"), which was great since parking in Waikiki is a nightmare. They also had a great breakfast selection and the coffee was delicious!Overall, this was a very good property for the price, the amenities, and the location. I would definitely recommend this location.

We like the Lotus very muck. It is like coming home every time we visit there. The staff is veryfriendly and helpful. Also it is very clean. The extras are nice too like the beach chairs, beach towels and beach bikes. The wine reception in the evening is a nice touch.

We just returned from a stay at the Lotus Honolulu that combined business with pleasure. We stayed in an Ocean View room and enjoyed its spaciousness, cleanliness and beautiful views of both Diamond Head and the ocean. While it's true that the view also included the parking lot below and a couple of buildings in the foreground, you'd be hard-pressed to find accommodations in Honolulu that combine the spaciousness of the rooms, the amenities of the hotel, the helpfulness of the staff and the peaceful quiet so close to the craziness of Waikiki, especially for the price. We've stayed in other hotels in Waikiki that had a good view of the ocean, but our rooms were the size of postage stamps. However, we loved our room at the Lotus! Every day at 4:30 p.m. we sat on our lanai and watched whales breaching in the distance. We also enjoyed watching the activity in the park below Diamond Head: dog walkers, joggers, kids practicing soccer, etc. In the mornings, we were awakened by the sounds of birds chirping in the palm trees below, which turned out to be parrots (or maybe parakeets?). We took full advantage of the beach, accessed by a very short walk across the hotel lot, which was never very populated and excellent for swimming with no reef. (When you approach the beach, take the stairs to the left, not the right, for the best swimming.) Originally, we ate breakfast closer to Waikiki, but eventually we settled for the hotel breakfast which was reasonably priced and more to our light-breakfast tastes. I can't say enough about the front-desk, breakfast and valet staff who were very accessible and saw to our every need. I want to give a special call-out to JR at the front desk and to each of the valet staff, who made every aspect of our stay comfortable and EASY. FYI: We took advantage of the free Honolulu Art Museum tickets offered by the hotel and were favorably impressed. The museum definitely is worth seeing and the food in the cafe very good. All in all, a perfect stay in Oahu, thanks largely to the Lotus. My husband has frequent business in Honolulu and has decided to abandon his previous hotel for this one. Very much worth the visit. We will be back!

Great location. Off the beaten path and easy to access all of Waikiki. We walked everyday for all meals and even to the scuba shop for a dive or two. Wonderful and accommodating staff for the whole stay.

Staying near Dismond Head gives you the benefit of a quiet neighborhood adjacent to Queen Kapiolani Park and a spectacular view of Honolulu. Great waking opportunities just footsteps from an uncrowded beach.

This place is amazing! This hotel feels more like a resort away from the busy Waikiki area. Its located in between the end of the Waikiki strip and the famous Diamond Head volcano. We upgraded to the premium room (corner suite) with two balconies, one facing the diamond head and the other facing the beach, where you can enjoy the beautiful sun set! The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. Each room has an Illy Coffee machine, which I found didn't work so well. But not to worry, the hotel offers free coffee service at the restaurant located on the second floor every morning until 10am. Plus everyday from 4-6pm the hotel offers free wine! The fact that this hotel has its own private beach area, you can even take the wine with you to the beach unlike other hotels. We rented a car, so with the $25/day resort fee ... it covers the valet parking! Pls note: you cannot park your own vehicle, the staff will park the car for you every time you return to the property. Everyone is very friendly and accommodating! If you don't have a car, staying at this resort might be a bit inconvenient - Unlike all the other hotels in the Waikiki area, where everything is walking distance! With that said, i think the best way to explore the island is to rent a car. That way you can visit all the other beaches and attractions, like north shore and dole plantation. The resort fee covers all the beach gears like towels and chairs. I'm definitely coming back here again, the next time I return to the island of Oahu!

Located 10-15 min walk from Waikiki and main drag. Far enough away to be quiet, but close enough to avoid taxis. Very friendly staff, especially the valets and beautiful views from our 10th floor room.

Very friendly staff, great room, great location.I slept very well Will stay there again Everything was just wonderful.I highly recommend thus lovely boutique hotel for business or vacation as wellMahalo

My wife and I recently stayed at the hotel.The experience was wonderful.The staff was very helpful and they went beyond the expected to help us. They were 5 star.The room was 5 star.We highly recommend the hotel to anyone.

A very clean, quiet and upscale Hotel. Also included is a very nice wine service late afternoon each day. Although there is no pool, they offer towels and beach chairs to use on a private and very cozy beach nearby.Excellent service, quiet and relaxing!Close proximity to Waikiki beach as well as Diamond head.

What a find!!! We loved this place. Quiet with only the birds to sing to you as you sit on the balcony resting your eyes on the luxurious green of Diamond Head & Kapiolani Park. A slight turn of your head and the view changes to the ocean with a surfer or sailBoat. The Lobby greets you with the calm beauty of an Asian oasis and the friendly & helpful staff. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated. The bed and bedding were of ecxcellent quality - a delight to crawl into after a day of sightseeing. The bathroom was spotless and a beauty of travertine marble. Michel's, a long time Oahu fine dining favorite, is right next door and Waikiki & its eateries are a short walk down Kapiolani Park. A shuttle is also available. Loved our stay here and didn't want to leave.

If you are looking for an excellent, comfortable hotel near the heart of Waikiki then I heartily recommend Lotus. We love the Zen like atmosphere and Balinese furnishings. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. We have stayed multiple times and have never been disappointed. I would definitely recommend it.

My wife and I had booked a long weekend in a Diamond Head View Premium View room at the Lotus. The website promised incredible views and free breakfast with a 5-night stay. When we checked in to the room our view turned out to be a Parking Lot View Premium (see photos) and we were told that the breakfast was actually not included. Noise from the parking lot was loud, bothersome, and the view was frustrating considering the price of the room. The staff offered no options to upgrade or change rooms. The only option we had was to cancel the reservation and find another place to stay. The location of the Lotus is literally in a parking lot behind three other properties. Their room categories are based only on the height of the room, with "Diamond Head" view meaning up to the 7th floor and "ocean view" meaning 8th floor and higher. "Premium" describes rooms on the corner of the building that have 2 lanais, and not a more premium view. Judging by the layout, the "Ocean View" rooms are probably quite nice, but really offer views primarily of Diamond Head and Kapiolani Park. All rooms face the park.

review_body: Nice big room with a view to the mountain, beach snd parking lot, nice big balcony. Clean, modern room, with coffee maker. Complimentaty wine serving every night(?). Nice calm location with easy beach access, nice small beach. Service was great!10min walk thru the park, safe. Parking included. Small breakfast option not so tempting. Overall, good price for the quality!

We loved the location of the hotel. It was a quiet spot away from town but close enough to walk there. A free shuttle to town if a person isn't able to walk or chooses not to. Easy access to the beach and a nice park across the street. The employees were all friendly and accommodating. The rooms were kept up and cleaned every day. We would stay there again.

highly recommend to the ppl who loves nature of Hawaii.Beautiful half private beach, diamond head and kapiolani park are walking distance.Evening wine service is good for watching sunset at the beach!!

I have stayed at the Lotus for three visits to Waikiki and always find it to be a welcoming, relaxing place to stay. Rooms are spacious and attractive, only five to a floor. Staff is friendly and hard-working. Beach is very close, there are bikes, beach chairs and towels for guest use. There is a large park across the street for tennis, walking; hike around Diamond Head is about 6 miles. Downsides are elevator, which is frequently very slow, and lack of a restaurant except for a cold/microwaved breakfast.

Enjoyed my stay. Perfect for my needs! Staff was accomdating and personable! My new favorite on Wakiki! The hotel was easy access to all the locations I needed to get to. This hotel had all of my personal requirements... Safe, Easy access to the hotel , to the front desk, to my room, comfortable bed, the ability to open the window and breathe the air ,

I can't say enough about how much my wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Lotus at Diamond Head. It truly was outstanding in every aspect. Our room was kept spotless, the parking was definitely a bonus, as was the complimentary drinking water that was offered each time we left the hotel on our many trips off the property. There was also a nightly turn-down service. Also appreciated was the quick access to the beach along with beach towels and chairs. The hotel is located outside the busy strip of hotels and shops that make up the main part of Waikiki so it is a refuge from the chaos and tourist traffic that makes up so much of Waikiki.

Wonderful place to stay for walking just about anywhere in Waikiki; from Diamond Head to Chinatown. We loved its location and the peace and quiet though close to everything. The private beach is a plus as we sipped our happy hour wine watching the sunset. Will definitely be back.

We had a lovely stay here for 4 nights in October 2015. On arrival the staff were very helpful and polite. The room was a good size and was very fresh and clean. The bed was very comfortable and there was an espresso machine and fridge in the room too. There was a great view to diamond head from the balcony which was lovely. Although this hotel is about a 15 minute walk into the centre of Waikiki, it is in a nice quiet location and has a nice beach area only 2 mins walk away. There is also a small store very close by for any essentials. Buses also come regularly that go into the centre of town for those who don't fancy the walk. We had hired a car to travel round the island during our stay and the valet offered us complementary bottled water every day when we took the car out which was great. The complementary wine in the evening was really nice too. The hotel is really nicely decorated and is very clean. We really enjoyed our stay here and would go back again if we are ever in Honolulu.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and had a lovely stay. We were on the 7th floor in a corner room with a lovely view of Diamondhead, but we could easily see the ocean as well. We walked around the area and enjoyed seeing the historical homes close by. So nice to be close to Waikiki, but much quieter. The staff was super helpful, polite and very friendly! The room was so pleasant and perfectly clean and the bed was very comfortable! Nothing negative to say. So nice to have the 2 balconies and lanai! I would be happy to come back anytime!

review_body: Poor first impression: We booked with the hotel 6 months prior to our stay for a $600/night rate. At our 6PM check in , after 18 hours of travel, we went to a vacant checkin desk with no lights on.Somebody came to help us quickly and we were checked in by 6:15. We asked for, but couldn't get, a welcome glass of wine because that was available from 3-6 only. We had no offer of a bellman to take our bags to the room. Pros: The room was clean and neat. Bikes were available when we wanted them. Cons: We waited 40 minutes for the shuttle one night then gave up on it. No bar or food was available though the website showed photos of them. Movies and Play station didn't work and their technician was no help getting it working for us. We checked Trip Advisor for room rates during our stay and found them to be in the $300/night range. When I asked why our rate was twice that, they couldn't tell me. I think the stay was average for a $150-200/ night hotel. Adding $100/$200 for it being a holiday, December 27 and 28, and being in Hawaii would still make it average . We payed twice that for a poor to adequate hotel with minimal services and nothing to put it in the "boutique" category by our standards.

We booked a corner room with views of both Diamond Head and the beach. The room was clean and updated, perhaps with a bit too much furniture, but comfortable. The hotel is at the quieter, north end of Waikiki beach, which was a plus for us. While the hotel is not directly on the beach, you can walk to a beach area in under 2 minutes; there is one building between this hotel and the water. Everyone at the hotel was helpful and professional. We were able to easily walk to the beach, zoo, shopping, and restaurants all under 15 minutes.

The Lotus is a great example of the Good, the Bad and the Ugly. Lets start-off with the positive:Good:The staff! Friendliest hotel employees I've ever met in both Hawaii and elsewhere. Really went out of their way to be helpful and all, from the housekeepers to valet, truly personified the aloha spirit.Bad:The restaurant. Per the website, you get free breakfast if booking a certain level room but both the front desk and restaurant employee said you needed a coupon from a meal inclusive package. In addition, the tv in the room boasted of a full service restaurant/bar but the both have been closed to anything except breakfast grab n go tiuil 10am for almost 2 years.Ugly;Disrepair. The Lotus isn't being upkept and is looking rather tired. My shower sprayed everywhere, the elevator was broken 2 of our days (imagine going up/down 10 flights, not fun), the pergo floors worn in spots and the a/c unit very loud (needed a tune-up). In addition, bikes weren't available when we asked (they seemed to have 3 total for all rooms/guests) so we had to Uber everywhere, adding in an expense; we did ask if we could reserve bikes and were told it was "first come."Some Hope:Another traveller told me they spoke to a new GM there so hopefully these will be addressed as the location can't be beat!

Loved the quiet location. Room was clean and more homelike than most hotels. We had a corner room with a nice balcony where we could sit and enjoy the view of Diamond Head. It would be nice to have a shuttle directly to the restaurant/shopping area.

We booked this hotel at peak season and paid about $350/night from Dec. 26-30. Nice room, great service. We got a roll away bed which was quite comfortable not the cot type which gave you an achy back next morning.

We picked this hotel again because it is not in the Waikiki frenzy, yet a nice 20 minute walk there if you really have to go. Kapiolani Park separates it from Waikiki Beach. It's a boutique hotel near Diamond Head, with a truly versatile small staff, each of whom can pick up another's job if necessary. There's no restaurant, but the classic Hau Tree Lanai is the the right in the New Otani, and the equally venerable Michel's is to the left, both two minutes away. Nice Nespresso machines in the rooms, and delicious Hawaiian coffee available in the morning downstairs. There are beach chairs, towels, etc. available for the asking, for a small private beach by the Outrigger Club just across the parking lot. The view of Waikiki Beach lights is dreamy as night descends, and the Friday night fireworks are close. For a splurge, I might pick the spendy historic Royal Hawaiian, or the Moana with the giant banyan tree, but for peace I'd pick the Lotus any time. No tourist luau, few children, fair prices for Honolulu. What's not to love? Five stars!

Nice staff and location- rooms large and comfortable- beach access and chairs and bikes nice amenities. Lower floors not great views, otherwise super! Boutique hotel with good vibe, but not super luxurious, if that's what your looking for.

Very clean and nice boutique hotel. Thoughtfully laid out interior, California king sized bed, and attentive & personal staff made this a great place to escape. Close to the beach & the downtown area ( but not too close), and across the street from a lovely park.

The Lotus is a charming boutique hotel at the far end of Waikiki, a stone's throw from Diamond Head. What it lacks in amenities, it makes up via the pretty, recently renovated rooms and the friendly staff and great service. It's not a cheap place to stay but we don't feel our money was wasted. This hotel is a good choice for couples who prefer a quieter environment and access to lush, green areas close by.

o view of the ocean ). If you are looking for a low key vibe in a great location out of the hussle and bussle of Wikiki then this is a great budget friendly option. We would definitely stay here again!

We had a very pleasant stay at Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head. We liked that the hotel was removed from the main Waikiki drag -- it felt like a real refuge and a place to relax. We also loved that there was a happy hour from 4-6pm. Overall the service was excellent. We felt very well taken care of. There was some confusion about breakfast; we were told there would be a continental breakfast in the morning, but went down to find that it wasn't a part of our package and for-purchase only. There was at least free coffee, and we ended up finding a great local restaurant away from Waikiki, Bogart's Cafe, instead! Our room was also attached to the neighbors' by a thin door and at time it felt like they were in the room with us. Definitely not as private as we would have liked, but an overall pleasant experience.

The bed was too soft, the pillows too large and firm, the one and only elevator too slow, and the bar and restaurant never opened. There is no pool and no fitness facilities. And yet.......The full view of Diamond Head's iconic west side and the view between condos to the ocean, both as seen from the large balcony of our room on the southeast corner of the eighth floor, redeemed the shortcomings. Observing the sun rise above Diamond Head each morning through the wide sliding glass doors, while still in bed, sealed the deal.The lack of options for nearby restaurants would be a shortcoming, except the half mile walk along the ocean or through the parks to multiple other eating options is delightful, and helps to wear off the calories.This is a good choice for the Waikiki Beach area.

We liked this Hotel as the destination was very quiet but those looking for better facilities with regard to shopping and dining are advised to be closer to town.Our room was nicely furnished with a modern contemporary style, all important items provided including scales which while on holiday is not such a good idea.A very limited breakfast but light years better than the nasty little outdoor cafe 1/4 of a mile towards Waikiki which serves revolting breakfast.So good Hotel, a little remote distance wise, good service , in general you should not be disappointed

What a great boutique hotel located away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki yet 15 minute walk to the center of Waikiki. Beautiful and clean decor this is a true gem in Honolulu. If you want a great experience, I highly recommend this hotel.

I loved this hotel set away from all the crowds. But, not far from all the restaurants and stores to shop at. The rooms were large and clean. The lobby had a zen feel to it, and was very nice. If I ever come back to Honolulu , I will definitely stay here again.

I stayed at a room with ocean view, but the center view is partially blocked by some other hotel and apartments. You can only see the diamond head on the left and the ocean on the right. The room was spacious and cozy. The only problem is that there was no bathtub. Yeah, I like to relax in the tub when I'm exhausted. One more thing: WiFi was extremely slow.

Terrific hotel and room for the price .... rooms very large and super comfortable. Hidden gem in Waikiki ... Just steps away from lovely Kaimama Beach and easy walk to Waikiki, Diamond Head and Kapiolani Park.

The rooms are nice, I got a room with a balcony toward the beach. Although another building blocked a full view of the beach, I could still enjoy the sunset. The staff are extremely polite and helpful. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there is a very good one in the hotel next door. Room service from multiple other restaurants too. Also a convenience store next door. No other shopping is in the immediate vicinity, which is wonderful. The acquarium is at walking distance also the zoo. Perfect place for being close to the beach, to the Diamond Head crater, and for walking around without bumping into hoards of tourists. I enjoyed it, I would happily return to this place.

Had a wonderful stay. Great staff. Eager to please. great amenities and steps from the beach. There's is coffee and newspapers everyday and wine and snaxs after 4. bikes, beach chairs and towels...what more do you need.

We researched online for weeks looking for a place to stay on Oahu. We settled on The Lotus. We made the right choice! It is within easy walking distance of Waikiki, but since it is down close to Diamond Head, it is in a quiet area, with little traffic. It has a private beach, just the right size. The staff was the most friendly folks I have ever encountered at a hotel. Our room was excellent. You cannot go wrong at the Lotus.

Hotel is a bit overpriced for what it is. There isn't any room service from the hotel, only the Waikiki online room service service. They direct you to a nearby hotel for breakfast since there isn't anything more than a continental breakfast available on site. The wifi is absolutely terrible and when I asked about it, they knew about it and it's something they were struggling with. I mean, this is the United States and we're in the 21st century, there should be working wifi. Hotel staff is nice and accommodating but overall the hotel is not impressive and like I said, overpriced for what it is.

The rooms were really nice and the staff was very friendly. We were very pleased with everything the hotel had to offer. Although it's not really a business hotel, they' were very accommodating with making sure we had everything we needed for our meeting. The food was brought in from a local catering company and it was excellent and well priced. I like that it is right below Diamond head and across from the park .

Loved this hotel !!Awesome service .We arrived early to the hotel at 7:30 am due to our early flight so we thought we try our luck if we were allowed to check in early ... We were told our room was ready (sweet) I forgot what the name of the conceierge but he introduced himself gave us a map told us abit bout Waikiki and where and what places to check out .. He was sooooo awesome !!! There's a shuttle bus that gets you to alo Moana shopping centre and around Waikiki and it's free!!! The room is absolutely gorgeous and huge .!!!! We were in room 1025 one one side was the diamond view and the other side was ocean view .. Bathroom was clean . I think we got our room cleaned twice a day haha On our second day when we were waiting for the shuttle bus , the driver came out and told us it was full house in there .. So he went into the hotel spoke with the manager and organise a taxi for us to get to Alamoana shopping centre at the hotel costs.. ( thumbs up for awesome customer service . Walking distance to Waikiki is a good 10 minutes my partner and I walked most of the time didn't mind.There was free wine from 4-6 pm . Free beach towels beach chairs DVDs these were included in the boutique fee. Overall I'm happy with this hotel it's freaking awesome and I love the customer service everyone is so friendly !!!!!! Will come back for sure

We only had two nights at the end of our holiday. Was convenient and comfortable. Quiet location. Walking distance to main strip and buses. Breakfast service was alittle unfriendly and resort fee annoying when you don't have a car to park! Friendly efficient service.

We arrived very late and after 28 hours of traveling it was a delight to be welcomed so warmly! We got a room with both ocean view and a fabulous view of Diamond Head. The staff was very helpful during our four night stay. We got directions and tips when we asked. The rooms were big and clean. Everything was exactly as it should be expected for the price we paid. :)The hotel amenities are great as well: yoga class in the morning outside in the park (perfect way to start your day!), beach towels and chairs, bikes (perfect for going to Diamond Head), wine in the afternoon, free wifi. The big plus staying at the Lotus, is that you are at the end of Waikiki, away from all the tourists and noise (if that's what you'd like).We would definitively stay again if we are lucky enough to visit Honolulu again.

Hey, my girlfriend and me went there after spending a night at a really awful Hotel, located at the border of Waikiki Beach Area (which provided pictures of a new and modern interior, did not match though, however); the view of the Diamond Head aswell as at the sea is absolutely amazing (who wants to look at Hotel Skycrapers, which Waikiki Area is full of, believe me, when he is in such a wonderful environment?!); staff was very helpful and kind in every question, the location is in comparison I would say definitely one of the most quiet and peaceful. By foot you get back to Waikiki Area in maybe 10 minutes, by bike which you can lend it happens in no time. The comfort in the rooms equipped with fridge, Flat-TV, PS3, Safe, Espresso-Machine,.. is very neat, modern decorated and very clean, there are Yoga-Classes provided in the morning hours, and Wine during 4pm-6pm. Valet Parking Services with friendly and helpful staff-members are ensured. A very nice little not crowded beach is also not far away!

The Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head on Oahu was recommended by a friend. We had never been to Oahu but I have visited Maui & the Big Island/Hilo side more times than I can count over the last thirty years. (Two sisters live on Maui and Big Island.)We had the best time at the Lotus. First, Robert (valet) greeted us when we arrived. He parked our car, took our luggage to our room, and gave the most wonderful, detailed information about the island and the area. He directed us as to how to get around in spite of the crazy traffic in the Waikiki area. He suggested a great dinner spot in the hotel next door and showed us the private beach we could use while staying at the Lotus. Beach towels and beach chairs were provided too.Before going to our room, we met Jana and JR who checked us in and welcomed us to the hotel. We asked more questions that Jana happily answered. We then asked for a regular coffee maker in our room in addition to the pod coffee maker that was already there. She then invited us to have a glass of wine since it is available in the lobby each evening from 4:00 to 6:00pm. It was about 4:30. We then found out that Jana was the General Manager at the Lotus and knew we had chosen the right place to stay in Oahu. When we got to our room, we found a "welcome letter" signed by Jana that said "we are happy to make the necessary arrangements to satisfy your wishes" and she meant it. We then went out for dinner and when we got back, the coffee maker we requested was in our room along with the shades closed and lights turned on so we didn't have to enter into a dark room. Very nice and welcoming. Our room was fabulous with two balconies; one overlooking the ocean and the other one facing Diamond ahead. This hotel was peaceful, clean, comfortable, away from the Waikiki crowds and SMOKE-FREE. It was a 10 minute lovely walk to downtown Waikiki and we walked there for dinner one night. It was very crowded and people were smoking everywhere. I was so glad we get away from this and knew our hotel would be fresh, clean and smoke free!!!I also want to mention another valet named Travis. He was incredible and was there each morning as we headed out for the day. He gave us great direction to Pearl Harbor, the museums and the Queen's palace. He told us where to go, what to expect and explained little but important details like the lockers at Pearl Harbor since bags are not allowed at this military base. One of our days we wanted to drive to the North and East sides of the island. He again gave us great direction and made suggestions about what to do and see when we got there. Where the ladies like to shop and the local shrimp trucks too. He made the few days we had there very valuable and we got to see lots of what we wanted to see. We will return to Oahu and we will no doubt, stay at the Lotus again. Try it! You will love it too. Thanks Jana, Travis, Robert for making our trip fabulous. See you next time.

Pleasant hotel, staff friendly but could have had more info on area. Rather far from downtown = no restaurants within walking distance. Quiet neighbourhood near park welcome after Waikiki noise.Large, comfortable room with balcony. Glass of wine offered in lobby after hot day very welcome gesture - mahalo.

review_body: A great hotel with close attention to details. Only stayed one night and wished we would have stayed here our entire time in Honolulu. Close to Waikiki but yet a bit outside to get some peace and quiet.

Great Hotel away from the busy WaikikiWine in late afternoon such a special touch.Staff was friendly, aimed to please.Will be back but longer next time.As a travel agent,I will definitely book this property for my clients visiting Oahu and will be at ease because of the wonderful experience clients will have

Very quiet and great place to stay and just an 8 minute walk away from all the noise and traffic of Waikiki, or what I called Vegas Strip without the panhandlers, the trash and the guys giving away fliers in the middle of the sidewalk. The Lotus Hotel is not a big hotel it has 51 rooms only it's not a new property either however it's well maintain, you get very professional and friendly employees, the rooms are big the beds are very comfortable and from my room in the 12th floor I had great views of the Beach and Diamond Head. You also get complimentary Yoga classes in the Kapiolani park across the street, Beach Chairs and towels, DVD rentals, wine service (4 pm - 6 pm), Coffee and Tea (6 am - 10 am) Beach biker cruisers to take to the park or beach.Overall, a great little clean and friendly place to stay.

My visit to see my family and participate in Sean's wedding was made so much sweeter by the wonderful stay I had at the Lotus Hotel in Honolulu. I felt spoiled and very well taken care of. The staff was very friendly and made you at home. Thank you so much I can not wait until I return with some of my friends.

If you want to be out of Waikiki this is the place to stay. Friendly staff...clean & well maintained. Three negatives...can't get decaf at their 2nd floor mini breakfast bar, no Fox News on TV& wish washers & dryers free.

The Lotus Hotel provided us with top-notch friendly service from everyone we met and the view from the balcony of Diamond Head was eye-popping. We enjoyed walking to the park and to Waikiki Beach which was just far enough away to escape the throngs. Mahalo to the great staff of the hotel- you do a great job!

This is great mid-size boutique hotel just a 15 minute walk (toward Diamond Head) from the main strip of Waikiki hotels. If you want a relaxing stay but still easy access to all the tourist amenities, this is the place to be. I stayed for a business trip, so it was perfect. I could be ocean side without being surrounded by tourists reminding that I was working while they are on vacation! The room was spotless and comfortable. I had a corner room with two balconies and a view of Diamond Head. It was a low floor, so if you can get higher up, your view won't be obstructed by the trees. I had slow drain in the sink and a light bulb out in the bathroom. I forgot to mention it to the front desk on my way out in the morning, but it was all fixed when I got back! Its obvious the staff is attentive to detail. I highly recommend the Lotus if you want to be away from the crowds in Waikiki.
